We had to practically run someone down to present us with our electronic check.  $35 for one aperol spritz and some chips and hummus all the while being rained on because the hostess could not accommodate a table with an umbrella!  So much for supporting local businesses!!!!   We will not be back to this supposed Conde Nast location.  Good luck with maintaining that attitude!

title: Old World Charm in the Heart of Chelsea
text: As a native New Yorker, I have wanted to stay at the High Line Hotel for many years. I finally booked a room this week and  my trip was a joy. The High Line Hotel surpassed my expectations. Not only was the staff extremely courteous and accommodating, but the rooms' unique features take you back in time. Since the property was a dormitory for Episcopalian priests in the late 19th century, the exterior's gothic architecture and the interior's classic design transport you to this bygone era . This old world sensibility was reflected in my room's rotary, landline phone and in the 1890's pencil sharpener that was mounted to my desk! Just as another reviewer stated, there is a magic in the air at this hotel. What is more, the hotel is just steps away from the High Line Park. With its lush, elevated gardens the park seems to float above the city, exuding the fresh, fragrant scents of seasonal wildflowers and rich foliage. For tourists, weekend travelers, and New Yorkers who just need a staycation, the High Line Hotel will give you the respite and the rejuvenation that you need! Enjoy!

title: terrible customer service
text: I spent the night here 3 weeks ago after being referred by a friend. It was to be  a special treat with my daughter before she was heading back to college. We were out all day and upon return the air-conditioning was not working  on a very hot evening. Im assuming because of covid no one was able to come service it. After a few calls complaining, the phone also wasn't working,  we were finally told at 10:30 pm we could switch rooms but only if i came down and got a new key and we moved ourselves. Im in my 50's but went to the concierge in my pajamas got the key and moved. The new room was smaller but now it was very late and we were exhausted. The next morning when we went to check out I asked to speak with someone about the smaller room and poor service. After quite a wait we asked for some water and were told we could have some but it would be charged to our room which we declined. The manager said yes it was a smaller room but still in the upgraded class of king size room that i paid for.  He did not care about the air conditioning or lack of help moving rooms. We were tired and It ruined a special night out and left a poor taste in our mouths that no one seemed to care at all . Ive never been treated so poorly at a hotel which is too bad because it is in a great area. Never again!

title: Charming, cool and great area.
text: If you want to feel like you are sleeping over at Paul Revere's house with better bedding, this place really lays on the Old New York, (Or New Amsterdam lol) charm. It is high design in a friendly, contemporary antique way. The outdoor cafe is Jet Set and cool and the location is right next to the Highline between Hudson Yards and the Meatpacking. There is no hotter neighborhood in Manhattan than this currently. The bathrooms are spacious and the fixturing is nice. I did not see it but apparently the banquet room is over the moon  and it would be a great place to rent out the majority of the hotel for out of town guests for any special event. The HIgh LIne Hotel is completely original and I would definitely give it a try!

title: Weekend getaway
text:
We spent a 3 nights weekend getaway - together with our dog!
This is the real magic about The High Line Hotel they love dogs amd you can bring your furry friend no matter the shape or size: everyone is welcome here.
The room (we stayed in room 17) was spotless and had everything you need. 
The staff was welcoming and friendly - our dog loved them too (might have something to do with the treats and cuddles he got. Not sure...).
This certainly wasn’t the last time we visited.

title: BEWARE OF CHANGE/MODIFICATION RULES
text: I tried to change NOT cancel my reservations and I was told the penalty was the EQUIVALENT to the total price I paid gor my original reservation. Even though the luxury hotels are understanding that the Coronavirus is changing ppls plans they couldng care less...they just want their $$$!

title: Could have been amazing
text:
This hotel has the potential to be absolutely fabulous.  Its location is perfect: we were easily able to walk to Soho, the Flatiron district, midtown and Tribeca.  And it feels like you're staying in the New Yorkers' New York, not in the main tourist areas.  But we had a couple of experiences that let us down.  Firstly when we arrived and checked in we flopped on the bed and my hand fell to the floor and there, half under the bed, was a broken tumbler smashed into pieces; not just a few fragments - a fairly sizeable pile of glass.  Which was really worrying given we could easily have walked through it. I didn't cut my hand but that's by luck.  I called down to concierge to explain that there were dozens of pieces of broken glass by the bed and she replied "Oh, and were they already there when you entered the room?" - as though she thought perhaps I had smashed the glass myself.
Secondly during our stay New York was locked down due to COVID-19 and most people checked out and left.  My partner and I were one of only two rooms still occupied at the hotel. On our last day, Virgin cancelled our flight back to London due to flight restrictions and we didn't know how or when we were going to get home. Hopeful I could get us on an emergency flight that night, I asked the hotel if we could remain in our room a few hours more to sort it out.  Despite there only being one other room occupied, the concierge refused to let us stay in the room to sort out an emergency flight and said if we wanted to use the facilities past our check-out time she would have to charge us another full day's rate.
Given that it was an emergency and we had literally no way of knowing if/ when we would get home to our families and jobs and dogs back in the UK, I would have thought we'd be allowed a few hours in the room to try to make arrangements.  
Overall it just left us with a sour taste in our mouths.  Which is a pity because the hotel is lovely and the porters downstairs in reception were lovely.

title: great location - poor service
text:
A sophisticated, non-pretentious hotel. Clean with historic charm.
However, hospitality was poor. I was changed a resort fee of approx. $30. However, the gym was closed due to COVID19. I asked if they offered anything as a substitute – ‘No”.  So what is the 30/day for ??? …high speed internet

My guest and I went to the patio for a drink, since we were only 2 people we were not allowed to sit at a 4-person table. They are ‘reserved for larger parties” I told the host we were guests of the hotel and we were only going to be here for 15 minutes for a quick glass of wine. They would not accommodate us. By the way, there were 6-8 open 4-perosn tables open. It was only 6:05pm.

I spoke to the person who check us in. He spoke in circles, would not accommodate us, and went on to say he’s from California and “people from New York are rude” he said it 2 -3 times. 

If I do stay here again, it will not be for the service, it will be for the location.
Btw: when we returned to the hotel (approx. 7pm) – those 4-person tables were still empty.

Lastly, my credit card was charged twice.

title: Unique hotel!
text: The High Line Hotel provides a cozy, clean, one of a kind experience. While the doors on the rooms are thin (not great for light sleepers), comfortable beds and beautiful furniture and architecture make up for it. The lobby truly sets the tone of the hotel with a coffee shop filled with young people and dogs. One of a kind hotel in Chelsea.

title: Quirky
text:
Beautiful refurbished building, with small lobby, often crowded with non guests and dogs.  Rooms are clean,  vary in size and have outstanding beds and linens. I have found the down bedding too hot, and they have changed it. 
There are no grips in the showers, and the very worn antique rugs present a tripping hazard. 
There is a coffee/snack bar but no restaurant. Also, no coffee maker in room, for obvious reason. 
Staff is friendly and helpful.

title: Perfection in Chelsea
text: The High Line Hotel on 10th Avenue at 20th is absolute perfection!  The rooms are cozy, quiet and comfortable.  A tranquil radiance envelopes you upon entering the intimate lobby and continues throughout the hotel with it's numerous thoughtful touches and immaculate decor.  This is no cookie cutter hotel, it is an intimate rest stop in the big city.

title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Chelsea
text: Our stay was only a short one, but we found the accommodation and service to be excellent, and it’s location close to the High Line and all the bars and restaurants in the area made it a perfect location to stay... and one we will use again

title: Wonderful experience
text: We loved the hotel’s ambience, the history, the friendliness. The staff, especially Emily and Xavier were so helpful and welcoming. The lobby/lounge has a wonderful relaxed atmosphere and is a great place to enjoy a coffee or a drink. The access to the High Line is so convenient and this area of New York is delightful to stay in.

title: Great Stay!
text: The only con to this hotel was having to wait an additional hour past the check-in time for my room.  Other than that I had a great experience.  There's a great coffee shop inside the lobby, a wonderful outdoor restaurant with a fantastic brunch, right outside and the rooms are very nice.  Well kept.  Stayed July 2018.

title: Awesome place
text: An amazing hotel with a ton of character in Chelsea. Each room is uniquely decorated and the beds are comfortable. Oversized bar (not just airplane bottles) in each room. It was our second time visiting the High Line Hotel and it will not be our last. Dog friendly. Don't forget to walk the High Line up to Hudson Yards. Very cool place.

title: Details make the visit!
text: Absolutely loved this hotel! I stayed in a standard King room and it was so spacious.  I loved the details included in the decor and the little things like a coloring book were such a treat. The staff is friendly and helpful, they were able to hold our luggage during the day and then called us as soon as our room was available. The bar is very nice too - wish I remembered the bartenders name but he was really cool and made the best toddy!! Great area within NYC as well. Easy to get to from Penn station, access to the high line and Chelsea Market, and lovely area to stroll through - especially during the holidays!

title: Excellent service, nice room, dog friendly, excellent coffee!
text:
This hotel is a lovely boutique hotel that has nice sized rooms (for NYC and big-city standards). The room didn't have a closet but they do provide a rolling rack where you can hang your clothes, which is a nice touch. We had plenty of room to open our luggage on the floor and be able to walk around. There was even a desk in the room. My favorite part of this hotel was the magnificent coffee smell (and excellent coffee), the fact that there are always dogs in the lobby, and the lovely bar at night. Michael (the manager) is fantastic. Very nice person and also makes excellent drinks. 

I would recommend this hotel if you like boutique hotels and somewhere where you won't feel like too much of a tourist. Many locals seem to hang out here which is really nice because I love to experience places the way the locals do. If you're looking for a traditional hotel experience maybe this isn't the place for you because they don't have a traditional front desk. It was definitely a lovely experience though!

title: Great stay!
text: Perfect location, super staff and comfortable rooms. The coffee bar in the morning has lots of variety, then turning into a social bar in the evening that is dog friendly. I would not hesitate to book The High Line hotel again for my next visit.

title: Good location needs new management
text: Room 49 leaked. Drip, drip, drip, drip. Lots of street noise. Trucks backing up. Beep, beep, beep, beep... Bed and bedding were great. Towels were big, robes & slippers, warm room, great water pressure, hot water. No front desk. Couldn’t figure out who was or if there was hotel staff. No for man. No bell man. Experience similar to walking into a pub with an inn upstairs. Clean enough. I kept my slippers on. Not a great hotel experience. But I liked my room and I slept okay both nights I was there. Three blocks from Root studio made it convenient and walkable. Great area and very close to the high line. There’s an entrance half a block away. Cute desk, coloring book and bike map.

title: Great visit to NYC!
text:
We had a great visit to NYC!  The staff at the High Line Hotel were extremely helpful and very friendly.  We were greeted each time they saw us and asked us about our activities and continued conversations from previous conversations like we were their only concern.
Hospitality at its best.

title: Historic hotel surrounding Hudson Yards, The High Line and Chelsea Market.
text: Dog friendly hotel.  Cozy lobby for drinks or breakfast with coffee and pastries.   Comfortable room with large bathroom. Beautiful lines, towels and robes. Location of hotel is perfect for exploring Chelsea Market and Hudson Yards.  And the High Line is just 2 blocks away.  Can’t wait to return.

title: the best hotel in NYC and where magic happens...
text:
The Highline hotel is where it all began for me--one gorgeous summer day I did my usual morning routine having my own business, I worked out of the back of the highline hotel where they serve amazing coffee and there's a beautiful hidden garden with tables where you lose yourself and forget you're in NYC and feel like you're in Europe surrounded by gorgeous flowers and the historic building which is now the hotel but was a theological seminary. 

That morning changed my life as that is where I met my husband, who religiously stayed at that hotel, also his favorite, every time he was in town from CA visiting a friend.

I sat next to him and that was the moment my life changed. Fast forward two years later and we are married and continue to go back to the Highline Hotel, a favorite not only because of our story but it truly is a treasure and the best hotel in NY; the rooms are large, comfortable and beautifully decorated all unique with personality and very charming. The beds are so comfortable and the staff is wonderful, friendly and we tell anyone who is visiting NYC to go to that hotel, and if they are not spending the night they must go to experience the magical hidden garden in the back while sipping some intelligensea coffee or tea.

We're lucky as we also got to know the manager who is hands down the best hotel manager I've connected with and that place is run so great--he also carries that warmth and kindness that you feel when you enter the front doors.

I can['t sing enough praise for this place that is very special to me, and it will make your trip extra special to experience it.

title: Anywhere BUT here
text:
Unless you are travelling with a pet and need a pet-friendly hotel, this is not where you should stay during your time in New York. New York is known for its variety of options and trust me, there are plenty of better options than The High Line Hotel.

To start, the hotel is deceiving. Because of its name and location, you are left with the impression that they are going to live up to the price tag they are asking. You would expect, for example, for the hotel to be clean at a minimum. You would also expect the hotel to be well managed and friendly. Unfortunately, they are neither clean nor accommodating. In fact, this is one of the strangest boutique hotel environments I've ever been in where everything just feels off from the smell to the vibe to the entire experience starting with even the check-in process. It was so bad that I ended up checking out of the hotel early even though I was charged a penalty fee. 

Plus, if you are looking for an evening of rest while you are on your trip that is free of barking, then steer way clear of The High Line Hotel.

title: High Line Hotel
text: This charming hotel is in the heart of the Chelsea district in Manhattan and the minute we walked in we felt at home. Our room was spacious and decorated with antiques and it was so clean that it sparkled! The delicious coffee bar in the lobby turned into a craft cocktail bar at night. We enjoyed using both of them and visiting with locals that lived in the neighborhood.

title: Great service and beautiful hotel
text: My experience at The High Line Hotel was phenomenal. Elizabeth (if I remember her name correctly), who checked me in, was extremely helpful and made my stay very enjoyable. The area is quaint and in close proximity to great food and the high line. The rooms were charming and the beds comfortable. Definitely will stay here again next time that I am visiting!

title: Cozy perfection during a long business trip.
text:
The High Line Hotel is my favorite spot to stay on the West Side of NYC.
It's like a little bit Hogwarts with an elevated charm.
The BEDS! I always sleep like a baby here.
And I love strolling the neighborhood after long days at work.
One of my favorite coffee shops is in the lobby and creates a warm family vibe with all the "locals" stopping in with their puppies. :) 
Can't wait to be back.

title: Business Traveler
text:
Only a couple of complaints. 
1. When I checked in the key card marker was not working. My keys were delivered about 2 hours later.
2. On the 2nd day of my stay my room was not cleaned during the day. I had to call guest services and request for my room to be cleaned once I returned from training at 4pm.

title: My favorite hotel in Chelsea/Meatpacking!
text: Great location.  Beautiful, historic building; large, clean comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  Great espresso in the lobby in the morning - nice bar in the evening.  My favorite place to stay in the area!

title: One of the Worst Hotel Experiences
text: This was tragic, from start to finish: street noise intolerable; felt like we'd booked a room in a kennel (dogs barking in the adjoining rooms most of the night); they charged our credit cards twice for one night stay; coffee was cold.   Avoid!

title: Great location, miserable lobby
text: The location and price can't be beat - right on the High Line and close to the Whitney.  Unfortunately the hotel has turned its small lobby over to the neighbors with their dogs, small children and noise.  Are they trying to be a coffee shop or hotel?

title: NYC hotel great espresso bar and dogs are welcome
text: Great location, vibe, check in only negative is loud outside noise from construction. Everyone is very friendly and look to accommodate your needs from restaurants, to things to do in the city. Not too sure why TripAdvisor makes you write 200 words for a review but this run on sentence will satisfy the computer software so this review will be posted;)

title: Great coffee, poor staff
text: staff does not take responsibility for what goes on at the hotel and treats patrons poorly. for instance, I tried to take a seat on one of the couches in lobby, and the staff standing there did nothing when another patron yelled at me his gf had that seat. They simply looked on, directly, without saying anything,

title: Hostel above a crowded coffee shop
text: The profit center of this establishment is clearly it’s Intelligensia coffee bar. Locals were packed in the small lobby/coffee all day long. It was difficult to scoot by to get to the stairs/elevators. At $600-$700 per night, it felt like a hostel more than a hotel. There isn’t even a front desk.  Very bad room acoustics—it sounded like another couple on our floor was having sex in our room. Room was large and reasonably clean, with the exception of dusty curtains.

title: Terrible Rooms, The worst customer service
text: The rooms are dirty and badly designed, and the hotel has no concern for customer satisfaction or service. There is no reception, room service and many times when we called we couldn’t even reach a person. We had a three day stay and the whole experience was awful. Will never stay again. Much better to spend the extra money and stay at the Bowery.

title: Not Great
text: Like others have said, The High Line is more of a popular local coffee shop that rents rooms than a hotel. My guess is that it’s better in the summer when the coffee shop customers can sit outside but now the small area you might expect to be for guest to relax in is full of young people on their laptops. We tried to have a glass of wine before dinner and again, no place to sit.  What makes it worse is that our room had no where to relax either. Only a very cool to look at but impossible to sit in antique love seat. We love quaint little coffee shops and we love quirky boutique hotels but this combination doesn’t work. I’d look elsewhere.

title: to cool for school
text: not a hotel in any way shape or form - i think i upset the staff buy booking a room and staying there - i thought it was a hotel but seems it was not - no room service , no service , no interest apart from taking my money - dont pay or stay

title: Great Stay!
text:
quirky, fun, friendly, super dog friendly oasis in Chelsea. Enjoyed every  moment. 
Fabulous coffee at Intelligentsia in the lobby  that folks were flocking to!
Amazing location: High Line, Chelsea Market (crowded!!) Whitney Museum of American art. Artichoke Pizza.

title: Worst Hotel Stay Ever in NYC
text: We paid over $600/night at the hotel. It looks cute online but we had nothing but issues. The lobby is filled with non-guests having coffee with their dogs (I'm a dog lover); but we couldn't even make in through with our suitcases to check-in. Check-In? There is NO reservation desk. Just a cash register. No one to assist with baggage. When we got to our room it was on 10th Avenue. Noise and sirens all day and night long. There was no dresser or drawers anywhere to unpack. You can barely close the bathroom door. The bathroom is so small, they don't even have a towel rack. The waste basket had to be placed behind the toilet it was so small in there.No counter space either. The vent up above was caked with dust and debris. There was no filter. Wires were hanging down and the worst is it never shuts down. Try and sleep through that. The thermostat couldn't be adjusted. The walls inside were slanted like an attic and my husband hit his head twice. There is no bar, restaurant nor room service available. The final straw was we were in town for a vintage champagne event and brought back 2 vintage bottles (empty) with  valuable labels that we purchased. They were in a bag on the desk. Yes, housekeeping threw them out. They are invaluable. Complained and they shrugged their shoulders. HORRIBLE!!!

title: Good but not super clean
text: Overall stay was nice but room cleanliness was not up to par. Shower did not drain and there were gross stains on the curtains near the bed that made us uncomfortable. Staff was very accommodating and friendly but wish the room was cleaner. We checked in late at night for one night only but had it been a longer stay we would have asked to move rooms or a refund.

title: Super comfy...ultra friendly...
text: The rooms that face 10th Ave can be a bit noisier naturally. The hotel itself I find quiet and peaceful. The people I have encountered on my stays have been warm and welcoming. The rooms are super clean and the beds and pillows I find comfy. The hotel has a great vibe and I find it comforting to come back to after a busy NYC day. An awesome boutique hotel!

title: A Fine Unique Hotel In Chelsea
text: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay at this 10th Avenue location in Manhattan's Chelsea neighborhood. We were in town for a wedding, and our experience found this boutique hotel a real pleasure.  Distinct, comfortable, and feeling very much an organic part of this upscale urban location, the Highline greets you with a fine outside courtyard, perfect for coffee and socializing in good weather. Once inside, a low-key friendly check-in process introduces you to their personable staff. In the best sense of the word, this hotel has a casual (but professional) tone that makes for a nice decompression from the busy dynamics of Manhattan. 'Warm and cozy' are two words that come to mind. Is this a shiny, high-tech, officious wham-bam experience? Hardly. I do know I've never slept in a hotel bed as comfortable as the one in our room. Ever. The weekend we stayed there was a sweet Dog Parade/Halloween morning event that saw both local toddlers, parents, and doggies in their best Halloween finery(I wish coming back in the next life as a pampered canine living in Chelsea).  If you want a comfortable alternative to larger, busier, formal toned places, in a neighborhood made for visiting , The Highline gets my 5 star review.

title: Best Hotel in Manhattan!
text: We LOVE The High Line Hotel. We have stayed here a few times now and never want to go home! The staff are second to none, the ambience of the hotel is perfect. It's a great chill-out space away from the busy day. The Chelsea area is gorgeous - perfect location. The rooms are so stylish, quirky and luxury. The beds are the comfiest beds in the world (I'm convinced!) - you will not have trouble sleeping here!! Visit the coffee bar in the day and the cocktail bar at night - Mike will serve you some killer drinks! Aaaannd... if you love dogs, this is the hotel for you. Thank you for having us - we hope to stay again.

title: Kinda magical
text:
Didn't expect the hotel to be so cute and charming, even done up for Halloween with pumpkins and twinkle lights. Pretty courtyard, cozy lobby with a cafe bar for coffee in the morning and drinks in the evening. Old manual typewriters sit on the lobby coffee tables, which you should use to bust out an impromptu poem. Beds were cozy, the room was clean and nicely decorated, and the shower was strong. Each room is different. Wooden floors creaked in places, which you could hear occasionally from room to room, but that only added to the charm for us. They have bikes you can borrow, and the hotel is only a block or two from the Greenway bike trail, which is amaze-balls. Runs all up and down and around he revitalized Manhattan riverfront (both rivers!).

The staff couldn't have been sweeter or more helpful, from recommendations to bike borrowing to a friendly smile. Extra special appreciation goes out to Emily, Tidi, Joan (jo-ahn'), and Christian.

Only a few blocks from Chelsea Market, and right next to the High Line trail. A couple of spots we loved were the Cookshop right next door and Bathtub Gin (which is set up like a speakeasy, so enter at the address and don't try to look for a sign). Wanted to hit the Empire Diner but ran out of time. Also bummed we ran out of time to hit the Sullivan Street Bakery. 

Other trip highlights: Nix restaurant (vegetarian) in the East Village, Palma in Greenwich, Osteria 57, Becco, and a tour of a small, indoor vertical farm (the future, people!!!) that grows microgreens called Farm.One in Tribeca. And oh my sweet lord, Tacombi Mexican restaurant just west of Washington Square Park.

title: Disappointing
text: Dark room, dark bathroom, old uncomfortable furniture, can hear overhead noise in particular, overall noisy.  Refrigerator has no room for personal items; your stuck with expensive minibar.  No room service.  No coffee maker.  Impersonal.  The lobby has so much public traffic of people purchasing coffee and using their outdoor spaces, that guests are overlooked.

title: Smell of toilet
text:
The room was always filled with smell of toilet (a.k.a pepper mint).
The hotel's ambiance was so great and felt about the history of the High Line.
Internet connection is healthy but all room lamp is not controllable by the wall switch.

title: Loved this hotel
text:
Great location with "greenspace" on both sides of the hotel that felt like a little oasis in the city.
Loved the Intelligentsia bar in the lobby and the patio bar out front.
The courtyard views out the back were a nice treat.

title: Do not stay here unless premium room
text: Lovely aesthetic in outdoor space and indoor public area as noted elsewhere (though close very early if hotel guest and no room service) this review is for standard rooms (e.g. 57 and 37 1/2 etc) -- worst hotel experience in over 30 years of staying in nyc hotels since I lived here. Rooms were tiny (closet was a nasty garment rack just inside the door, bathroom size of powder room with no counter space), no seating outside of a chair at the desk, no dresser, furniture stained. Requests seemed to go into a black hole -- an acknowledged request via email was not executed so staff thought it a good idea to wake us up the morning AFTER we had checked in -- at dawn our time (6am - they knew we were coming from west coast) to ask about unanswered request. Beyond absurd. Never again. Except a drink during daylight hours and if you have a pet they love that FYI.

title: High Line Hotel- Beware not all Suites are worth it
text: The Hotel is attractive looking, but the quality of the food and drinks at Ingo's is poor.  The rooms very wildly, in particular  the High Line suites are not all the same, and some do not have the facilities mentioned in the description (at least room 5 does not meet the description) .  Some are attractive and worth it (room 3) others are actually worse than a regular room at nearly twice the price (room 5)

title: Gorgeous, dog-friendly hotel
text: This place is amazing. The staff are superlatively trained. They are super-helpful and friendly. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. As is true with EVERY hotel in Chelsea, the rooms are on the small side, but the way they've been decorated makes these smaller spaces work really well. I didn't feel claustrophobic or penned in the way I have in others. They have beautiful, eclectic furnishings and a gorgeous sense of design. The linens were spectacular, and the bed was crazy-comfortable. The entire place is really dog-friendly: treats in the lobby, a huge garden, and an onsite bar that has a "yappy hour" where you can order your dog a bowl of non-alcoholic ale! Plus, the coffee bar is stellar, and I met more "real" people and their doggies in one hour reading in the lobby than I ever have in all of my combined visits to The Big Apple. If you like big, corporate, impersonal hotels where you can hide, this won't be your place. However, if you like boutique hotels, if you prize living in a world of beautiful design, if you want your dog to come to the city with you and actually enjoy the experience, and if you like warm interactions with lovely human beings, this is your place.

title: Character and comfort near the High Line
text:
A hotel that is full of character and interest.  In a great location very close to the High Line and Chelsea Market.

Very well furnished room with one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in - had amazing quality sleep.

Good choice of restaurants nearby, so lack of hotel restaurant and room service didn’t matter.

Room had the biggest “minibar” - almost like a full scale bar!

Also very convenient to be walking distance to Sleep No More.

title: This is a real find....
text: I have stayed in dozens of hotels in NYC, but this was a first for me at The High Line Hotel. It is great. Unique. Very hip, but with absolute class. Great service. Nice people. I would recommend it highly.

title: Unique small hotel in Chelsea
text: Loved this hotel overall.  It is a very beautiful old property at a great location in Chelsea.  The rooms are big and the staff is very helpful and friendly.  Hotel is like a neighborhood cafe where people come to hang out usually with their dogs as it is super pet friendly.  Only comment is the lights are all very dim around the hotel and in the rooms, but probably part of the ambience.

title: my review
text: Chelsea is one of my favorite NYC neighborhoods, so the Highline Hotel is a welcome hub. Staff are exceptionally helpful and welcoming. Neighborhood bistros are fun to sample and staff share the mission of the Highline Hotel staff to make visitors feel welcome.

title: Hotel for real New Yorkers
text: Having recently moved out of the city, we've tried several hotels on return trips to get the same neighborhood feel we enjoyed as longtime residents of downtown Manhattan. The Highline Hotel felt like having our own apartment in the city again - this time with outstanding service. Christian made our stay exceptional! Thank you!

title: lovely hotel, huge room
text:
great place - adorable ambiance, well thought-out refurbishment of rooms
no front desk (check in at a PoS station by coffee bar), no clocks in room, housekeeping lacked a bit during my stay
can use the highline to get to google nyc office
no onsite food, ice or gym
room could have used one more lamp
wifi, room size, and hotel patio were amazing

title: Friendly and laid back cool in the heart of Chelsea
text: A big thanks to Christian and ALL the staff for making my wife’s birthday weekend so memorable. It’s a great place to just hang and it’s location is perfect to explore Chelsea and the Meat packing district. Grab a coffee and delicious jam donut from the cafe in the foyer and go for a lazy stroll along the high line!

title: Loved it!
text: Loved it! Would definitely suggest staying here. Upon arrival we contemplating just staying in the room instead of going out because they’re so comfy. Super cute, too! Great location for NYC, at least for first timers.

title: Cozy oasis in Manhattan
text: I was traveling for a business event and this was the closest hotel to the event.  I have always passed on this hotel due to the cost, but this time I decided to go for it and was so glad that I did.  The staff was welcoming and helpful.  The bed was extremely comfortable with nice cool sheets.  I loved the vintage-ish decor. This was the quietest and most relaxing hotel room that I have ever had in Manhattan.

title: great staff at check in but not so clean
text:
great staff but need a big fresh clean- curtains rugs were really unappealing and looked old and not clean.
we took room 36 so by the courtyard nice and quiet 
you can hear upstairs guests walking back and forth and trash in early AM.
bathroom i nice and clean for a king room.

title: Too Dark Rooms
text: The bedroom and bathrooms were too dark, even with curtains open. The furniture was crummy, but the beds were comfortable. The sheets and towels were clean. The receptionists were sharp and excellent. The location was excellent .

title: Groovy Hip Hotel..
text:
We stayed in room 12 which was right about the cool coffee shop in the lobby and so was worried it would be loud but it was not. The king sized bed was incredibly comfortable and the room while small was very efficient.
I loved the location and told my husband this will be our new hotel when visiting our daughter in Manhattan.

title: Quirky
text: Loved staying at this quirky hotel in a nice part of Chelsea. Dog friendly / no, it positively encourages wet noses. Nice room with all amenities including mules and robe. Friendly staff operate from a single Apple MacBook Air to check in/out but manage admirably

title: Perfect retreat spot in the city
text: We loved this hotel, wished we could stay longer! We are NYers and needed to be out of our apt for the day for work to be completed. The High Line Hotel is on a beautiful, historical street, be sure to wander the neighborhood. We took a lovely bike ride on their complimentary bikes on the river in the morning and when a downpour came and drenched us... we laughed like children the whole way back to the hotel.  We accidentally left a valuable watch in the room and the staff found it and held on to it for us.Lovely customer service. Thank you.

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text:
The Highline is special. It’s physically lovely - inspired really. Beautiful outdoor spaces and a cozy lobby. High quality Intelligentsia coffee every morning Is an amazing way to start the day. The property and excellent staff make you feel welcomed and supported during your stay. 

I stayed at the Highline in their first month after opening. I have great memories of that trip too. I travel so much and it’s rare that a place stands out anymore. The Highline is one of those places that makes me inspired and energized about being on the road. The staff, the visionary art and warm atmosphere make the Highline an absolute standout. Special thanks to Christian at the front desk who made me feel welcome every day.

title: Overpriced and under serviced
text: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in September 2019 and although I would say the decor and location of the hotel was excellent I found the experience to be sub standard.Considering the 6 night stay cost me in excess of $2000 there was no breakfast put on by the hotel and any coffee wanted in the morning had to be purchased downstairs for $5 per cup. Added to which the coffee shop was not open early so I had to walk round the block to purchase a cup from a take away.At the least I would have liked coffee making facilities in the room considering the cost of the accommodation. Also soon after checking in I had a hold of $900 put on my credit card for mini bar and damages. Despite asking for the minibar to be removed from my room I wAs told the hold would still stay which I find extortionate especially considering the $2000 I had already paid in full for the hotel and not to mention other expenses that I needed to pay with my credit card.. on balance I would not stay here again...

title: Big Disappointment
text: The room was big, bathroom was small and I'm over the old, tired furniture look.  It just looks old, tired and dirty.  The hotel is very dark and reminiscent of the NYC housing apartment building I grew up in.  I know that the decor was supposed to be part of the "charm", including the old school elevator (beware if you're claustrophobic!), but it didn't work for me.  Service was meh, at best. Delivered very little for the price.

title: Great first night out in New York
text:
We were walking the High Line and saw this hotel all lit up wit its fairy lights etc. A group of us walked in and we were warmly welcomed and shown to a table in the garden area. The drinks waiter was very friendly and accommodating and ensured we were catered for with drinks and any questions we had.

Great area with all the garden set up and the big red bus. Lovely setting and fantastic night out.

title: Truly Improved my New York Experience
text:
y wife and I traveled in for business and then stayed over the weekend.  In the past few times, we stayed near Broadway or some of the more tourist locations.  The High Line Hotel is located in an area called Chelsea, located on the east side of Manhattan, just north of West Village.  The location turned out to feel similar to my travels to some of my European trips.

Located only blocks from Hudson River, I found myself strolling "quieter" streets of New York, having a nice breakfast at several local cafes and mingling with the locals at a beer garden just down the road at night.

The Hotel offers free guest passes to the fitness center at Chelsea Harbor, which was an experience in its own!  I had a nice walk to the fitness center early in the morning and found top of line fitness equipment in a HUGE facility.  

Later, we walked across to the High Line Park, which is almost like being in a different location all together.

The hotel decor is very nice and the coffee shop on the first floor is a popular place among locals.  Always full of people inside and out.  The rooms were large compared to other hotels in New York.  Sleep was peaceful and the beds were really comfortable.  

It is going to be hard staying anywhere else when visiting New York in the future.

title: No Parking/No Warning
text: No parking, find your own on the street (with all the alternate side issues) or find a garage. There is one across the street but i'm told they don't always have space (they did for us). We would have been happier if they warned us of this on their website, where there is no mention one way or the other. The receptionist was rather cool on this issue, noting she would have assumed there is no parking if the website didn't specifically state having it.Perhaps she would, thinking like a New Yorker working in a hotel.  Being from out of town we had different assumptions. We really do like the hotel, however, and will go back.

title: Great little gem!!
text: First time staying here and chose the hotel because it was five blocks from the office. Loved my stay!! Amazing service! Comfy beds! Great water pressure and bathroom products. The staff remembered my name every day and went above and beyond to make my stay perfect. Thank you!!

title: Deceptive description, photos
text: Just returned from 2 nights in Manhattan.  A getaway stay-cation. Our room on top floor.  Though quiet as faced rear courtyard claustrophobic in feeling as small gothic windows (not large as described) with sloping ceiling.  Dirty appearing ripped area rug that one couldn't even give away at a garage sale.  Comfortable bed ruined by sheets overstarched or not washed with sufficient fabric softener producing a rough, scratchy feeling not conducive for sleep.  Took air conditioner all night to finally cool down to comfortable temperature however air still felt humid.  Dark bathroom with insufficient wattage.  Yes nice to have good coffee bar in lobby and outdoor seating in front of building with bar and courtyard seating in back to eat breakfast (no breakfast restaurant).  And stairway to High Line park across the street.  But probably won't stay here again.  And definitely not in room 56.

title: Love at the last minute
text: After a disastrous check in with an Airbnb apartment, I used the Hotel Tonight app to find a place to lay my weary head. The High Line Hotel popped up and I went right over. Immediately changed my reservation to two nights. So glad I did. Very spacious room, extremely well curated decor that did not in any way appear to be trying too hard. (Lots of that around the city.) All of the staff I encountered were genuinely happy to help. And the shot of burbon suggested by the barkeep was exactly what I needed after a hot, busy day running around town. I’ll always check for a room here first.

title: Hipster vibe
text: Outside bar was cosy, but please be more upfront if you charge 13USD for a bottle of still water. Waiter was not clear at all about this. No need for these kind unpleasant surprises. Your staff is missing out on deserved tips because of this, looks like this hotel/bar doesn’t need this kind of shady upselling.

title: Great stay at High Line Hotel
text: Wonderful service and great atmosphere! Christian was extremely helpful with all aspects of the stay. Recommended to my partner. Is now working to secure space for L'Oreal senior managers meeting, including rooms and conference space!

title: Quaint and beautiful
text: The high line hotel is a nostalgic trip to the 1950's when you enter the guestroom.  Its charm is so warm and relaxing it blends the modern conveniences very nicely. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

title: Great Location
text:
"Chique" pricey boutique hotel in old Episcopal Seminary well located  near Chelsea  Piers and walking distance to new Hudson Yards and 34St shopping.
No restaurant in hotel.
A charming, acquired taste.

title: Anniversary Stay
text: We had a wonderful time. Emily, who checked us in, was extremely helpful. She assisted us in getting to our cruise that evening. Also, I had mentioned it was our anniversary, and we were so touched that, when we got back to the room that night, there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us along with a lovely note. So thoughtful! Thank you for making our stay so special.

title: Charming respite in Manhattan
text: I loved everything from the tasteful decor to the quirky books in the room.  Lots of good restaurants and bars in walking distance with the hotel being this charming, lovely bit of old manhattan.  Def coming here again.

title: JRH
text: We absolutely loved the High Line Hotel, everything! Firstly the iconic old seminary is fascinating, beautiful architecturally and full of interesting nooks and crannies. The furnishings are what one would search out at brocantes to furnish one’s own home. AND the biggest plus are the dogs! all the neighbourhood dogs head for the High Line, they know where the dog action is!

title: Very helpful staff
text: My wife lost her ring during our stay and the hotel staff was super helpful.  Excellent room and location near fun things in Chelsea, including Highline; Hudson Yards; Chelsea Market; and Starbucks Reserve.  Highest recommendation!

title: LOVE The High Line Hotel!
text: The vibe at this hotel is simply amazing!  Great city location bustling with activity but still feels quiet and relaxed.  Staff rocks and I will definately be back on my next visit to the city.  Well done High Line!

title: Beautiful hotel - must stay here again
text: I stayed in a standard king room. Everything was very nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. Great for a romantic evening. I will definitely be staying here again, and will recommend to all my friends and family.

title: High Line Hotel
text: Great casual and fun atmosphere & great location!  Love the history of the hotel and the proximity to the High Line, Chelsea Yards, Chelsea Market, great restaurants, museums and the Starbucks Roastery.

title: Great Hotel
text: Lovely hotel, in a nice part of the city. Close to Chelsea Market and lot's of nice bars and restaurants. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Cafe in the lobby that turns into a cocktail bar in the evening. Very much enjoyed the week I stayed there.

title: Hipster vibe
text:
Great location with a hipster vibe.  We were comfortable in the room and slept well. Pets are welcomed with open arms. Minus one star because the lobby is so small and was packed with people on their computers & phones at times. Lots of outside seating for guest. The room was clean and basic but very stylish and spacious. 

PROS: location 
           Fast internet 
           Spacious room
           Good shower pressure 
           Service 
           Pet friendly
           
CONS: Very small lobby area

title: Still wonderful but starting to need some attention
text: I have long loved this gem of a hotel hidden in Chelsea, and have stayed here a number of times. It has such a wonderful, different feel, like an old friend’s home. The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable, and although there is no room service or food, there is an excellent espresso/coffee bar in the lobby. The service is friendly and warm. The hotel’s charm is in large part due to the shabby chic decor. But of late, the chic has been giving way to shabby, and it does need some work. The frayed stair carpet off the lobby is now in tatters so that you almost trip on it, and the oriental rug in our room was similar. The door to our room stuck so much that a Herculean effort was needed to push it open, and my wife couldn’t do it.  A little sanding would easily solve the problem.  I will definitely return, but I do wish they would devote a little to stemming the deterioration.

title: Waiting 1 1/2 hours for my room to be ready...
text: But the staff is polite.  Hopefully the room is nice.  I have stayed previously, thought it was nice. Comfortable.  I arrived early, planning just to leave my bag and go on to my plans.  They said it would just be a short while, so i thought i would freshen up a bit.  Hot in nyc today. Not so pleased that they could not find my reservation and then kept me waiting.  Only had one free afternoon. If they had told me it would be such a long wait, i would have gone ahead to see the things I had planned.  As it ended up, they just kept saying a few more minutes, gave a steady stream of guests their rooms, and let me sit.  Maybe it was because i used Booking.com and did not book directly through the hotel?

title: An unusual hotel but would stay again
text:
Lobby is primarily for neighborhood residents and cafe users. Had to wait there while room was getting ready. Many dogs, all seemed well trained.

Room is purposely old fashioned including breaking wooden floors. At first was concerned primarily about noise and comfort but it was dead quiet despite definitely having neighbors. Had two queen beds and one was perfect the other had a mattress that needed work. Shower pressure is awesome. Couldn’t figure out how to drain the sink. Plenty of space in this room considering it is Manhattan.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is my first choice of hotels when visiting NYC/Chelsea....charming, well-located, great coffee bar and cocktails. The beds are plush and comfortable, room was more than adequate. Staff is welcoming!

title: New York get away
text: The High Line Hotel offers that bespoke original New York Getaway. From hip coffee to sexy cocktails, experience the real West Side like a local. The rooms are stylish, comfortable and quiet. The staff are first class and couldn’t be more accommodating. Located feet from the High Line and a short walk to the Village, Chelsea market or the pier . Near enough to the tourists but still offers a real feel for what local life is like.

title: Great hotel - super cute
text: Great staff and love the downstairs lounge (very hipster vibe). Christian was very helpful and everyone there was a pleasure to speak to every day. You can't beat the location as well - walking distance to so many great restaurants and shops.

title: Uncomfortable and kind of rude. Big disappointment.
text:
I had high hopes for this hotel but in retrospect I honestly would have preferred a Holiday Inn Express. It was bizarrely uncomfortable physically and interpersonally. 

I arrived when a magic show (?) was getting out in the tiny lobby so it was essentially as busy as Times Square at rush hour. No one helped me get my bag inside and I had to wander around getting buttressed by the sea of magic show (??) attendees before someone realized I was trying to check in. At that point the bellman took my bag and had me sit on a couch, where I waited in a chaotic rush of people until someone who worked there finally arrived to check me in. She was distracted and not terribly nice, mainly concerned about telling me what the hotel does not have (food, room service: no; magic show: yes (???)). When I called down later to ask if they would let a delivery guy bring takeout to my room (a fair question, i thought, since the tiny elevator requires key-card access) the front desk snapped at me that they don't have room service. (Which, yes, I know, that is why I am ordering takeout to my hotel room after a 12 hour travel day at 10pm, thanks SO MUCH for your help). Which is a long of saying: frictive, claustrophobic atmosphere, where you are made to feel like a problem. Not a good vibe from a hotel that seems to mainly offer vibe as its primary amenity.

During the daytime the lobby turns into an Intelligentsia, and since it is tiny, it is just as rammed as when the magic show (????) is happening, plus full of dogs, one of which I tripped over trying to get up to my room. The front patio was closed for some reason, the back patio is tiny, the bar closes at 1030, there is no restaurant aside from the coffee shop. Our room was fine, deliberately shabby, kind of like if you stayed at the clean, bland guest room in your rich friend's parent's pied-a-terre, except they would at least have a kitchen and their living room would not be filled with dogs and a magic show (?????)

If this hotel were not charging $500 a night I would be more tolerant of its "quirks" but it is actively unpleasant getting in and out of, there is no lobbyish space to unwind, and they could be a lot more charming or at least less confrontational about offering zero percent of the basics i could get with a smile at the denver airport courtyard marriott. 

but i hear the magic show (???????) is just great.

title: A Very Comfortable Unique Hotel in a great location.
text: When we arrived it was raining and the tiny lobby was filled with people and dogs.  There is a small bar there for eating and drinking.  Reminded me of the Algonquin Hotel but smaller.  I was told they are interesting people from the neighborhood who gather there to socialize and use their wi-fi. Our King room was delightful.  A throw back to a more formal time. Beautifully appointed with things from years ago.  Black dial phone, king bed, oriental rugs and a fabulous huge bathroom that had been updated for modern times.  We loved the place and were greeted by the friendly Rose who mans the check-in desk.  We stored our luggage before our room was ready and stored it again when we left since we planned on spending the whole day on the Highline, Chelsea Market and the new Hudson Yards.  Would love to stay here again when we are in town.  When we left people were engaged with each other at the outside tables.

title: Great Location
text:
I remember walking past the hotel a few years ago and saying that on my next trip that I wanted to stay here - so this time I did. 
As I’ve visited New York a few times, touristy stuff wasn’t the plan this time so The High Line was the perfect location. Walking distance to Chelsea Market and Greenwich where there are so great places to eat and drink at. The bed was INCREDIBLE! 
We arrived at 11pm and check in was great. The service was also really good when we checked out. 
The room was nice. It was clean. It was pretty shabby chic. 
Overall it was good and the location definitely is great if you’re looking to explore NYC yourself to find what you stumble upon.

title: Very friendly Hotel
text:
Lovely friendly hotel in the trendy Chelsea area of NYC.
Staff very attentive, quirky coffee shop in the lobby, dog friendly too which is always a major positive 👍
Very convenient for The High Line
Highly Recommend

title: Historic, well located, friendly but quirky hotel
text: If you have walked the High Line in Lower Manhattan you have probably seen the Hotel which is just east of the High Line between 20th and 21st.  It is a in a striking building and is very convenient to many trendy Chelsea spots.  It's a small boutique with an exceptionally friendly staff.  They really made me feel welcome.  The hotel does have some quirks. The Lobby is a coffee shop. The trendy decor is a version of shabby chic.  The beds and bathrooms are nice but some of the rooms are pretty small.  The elevator to my room was of a type I had not seen since staying at a 100 year old hotel in Rome.  Overall though, I enjoyed my stay.

title: We will be back!
text: It was my husband's first time to NYC and we absolutely fell in love with the High Line. Staff was amazing and so was our room. The only confusion we had was when we were told two different times for checkout but it wasnt a big deal.

title: High Class Vintage Style
text: Super nett, persönlich und entspannt, sehr freundlich, familiäres Team, ungewöhnliches Ambiente für NewYork City, für Hundefreunde, ruhig: eine echte Wohltat in der Großstadt. Tolle Lage -  Nähe Hudson Yards, Highline und Galerien. Ein echter Geheimtipp!

title: Cozy and Homey
text:
I love the Highline Hotel. It feels like a warm blanket wrapping around you. I love the coffee bar in the stylish lobby. I stay at The Highline for business and the location is perfect. The neighborhood is full of great restauarants and the Chelsea Market is right nearby.
Love it!

title: Home away from home
text: I've been staying here since it opened, and love it more every time.  All of the rooms are a little/lot different, with lots of old charm due to the building's history.  I LOVE seeing dogs in the lobby and courtyard on my way in and out, and having the option of amazing coffee in the morning.  There is no room service but it's New York - you can have everything delivered!  It's right in front of the High Line park, and just a few blocks from Hudson Yards, Chelsea Market, etc., plus they have bicycles available, but the best to me is that I can walk to where I'm working.  It's my home away from home.

title: We love this charming place
text: My husband and I stayed here when it first opened on a date and now we come back for our Aniversary! It’s a charming hotel with an eclectic feel! Nice beds great service and charm abounds! Plus they love our pooch that goes everywhere with us! The patios are beautiful, service and location are great as well lots of great things to say about The High Line!

title: Quality and Style
text:
I travel to New York once every couple of months, so I've stayed in a LOT of hotels. A lot of great ones, too, but none has had the allure or the unique style of the High Line Hotel. It's my favorite place to stay in the city, to the degree that it became a prominent location in my novel "Ghosts of Gotham." Excellent service, vintage comfort, it's a winner.

The location is top-notch, too. You're within walking distance of all the charms of Chelsea; good food, plenty to see and do, and a great home base for excursions into the rest of the city.

title: Try it!
text: Daniel Arias was extremely helpful to us during our 2 night stay at The High Line Hotel. He addressed any and all concerns that we had and was extremely thorough in following up with us. The High Line Hotel is in a great location and very quaint

title: A great home base for Chelsea and the High Line
text: The High Line Hotel brings a sensible charm to a city stay. In the morning, the hotel lobby feels like a friendly neighborhood hangout, with old friends stopping by to say hello. The location is perfect for a Chelsea / West Village visit. If you want a hyper-hip New York experience, this isn't it. But if you want a base while you temporarily make New York your home, you won't be disappointed.

title: Great atmosphere
text: Great atmosphere, very cosy, great service!   We have our son living in your neighbourhood, and, while there are many hotel options, we will certainly keep coming back to yours.  On our last stay, we forgot our passports in the rooms safe, and were most happy to have you retrieve them for us.  Thank you!

title: Great getaway!
text: Check into this gem and ask for Christian. He will go above and beyond to take excellent care of you! He made sure that we had a quiet room with everything that we needed. Don’t miss The Enigmatist show!

title: Great Time at The High Line
text:
We've been meaning to stay at The High Line Hotel ever since we ducked in for a coffee several years ago. The hotel is in a repurposed religious seminary, occupying a magnificant old building. Our room was quite large by NYC standards, and featured a view of the quiet courtyard at the rear of the building. Everything is done in dark wood tones, especially the lobby, which is luxurious, warm and welcoming. The hotel lobby, and its espresso bar, appear to be a meeting point for the community (and their dogs!). It helped us feel like we were part of the community and not just tourists passing through. 

We found the hotel to be well situated near the High Line itself (well, obviously!), as well as Chelsea and the Meat Packing district. We walked down into the West Village quite easily. We are in NYC quite often, and we are always looking for hotels that are away from the traditional tourist areas. This fits the bill.

We went in the winter, so we couldn't take advantage of their bicycle rental, but I definitely will take one out on the west side bike trail next time we are there in better weather. 

One heads up: there are short flights of stairs that join the various wings of the old building, so I would think that you should let them know ahead of time if you need an accessible room. The staff was really friendly, and the espresso bar in the lobby made really great bevvies.

We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Lovely weekend!
text: My husband and I had a delightful weekend. Wonderful room, gracious staff. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to NYC. Close to so many fabulous restaurants, too. A real gem! Coffee bar was cozy with delicious pastries. Will recommend to all my friends.

title: Exceeded expectations...and I never say that!
text:
My husband and I stayed at the High Line for a special birthday (we had dinner in the Village). We treated another couple so we got to experience two rooms. I cannot overstate how delighted we were with every aspect of the hotel. First, the rooms were larger than expected and especially compared to usual boutique NY hotels that are less than $500 a night. Both the king room and queen rooms had a walk in closet and plenty of room to move around. Another amazing thing for an old quirky building: silence. We were on the 4th floor over a semi busy road and never heard traffic or even sirens. Lovely bath with good shower/water pressure. And (see other reviews) we had zero issues with HVAC. 

Next, the vibe. The coffee shop which turns into a bar at 6pm is happy and a mix of residents and locals and lots of dogs. We were there on a cold winter weekend, so it was a tad chilly, but it was warm in spirit. If you come in the summer (we have been for drinks) there is lovely outdoor space, all ok for dogs. The bartender gave us good ideas of where to go for an early breakfast, and the person doing the check-in/out was just warm and friendly. My husband said this is so not a “corporate” hotel! 

The coffee and pastries were first class and love the cocktails. 

Highly recommended! We are looking for the next excuse to spend the night at the High Line Hotel.

title: Perfect night at The Highline Hotel
text: We had an amazing stay at The Highline! The staff were so kind and welcoming. The bed in the room was very comfortable. The room and bathroom were crisp and picturesque. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Manhattan!

title: NYC Staycation
text: Our small NYC getaway was fantastic, and the property was superb as always. The High Line Hotel has always accommodated my staycations with top-notch service and hospitality. Our room was comfortable and embodies the look and feel of this quaint and charming neighborhood. Thank you again Nicholas D. for all of your attention, we had a fantastic stay!

title: Chelsea Neighborhood Gem
text: This is our favorite hotel on the West Side of Manhattan. Great neighborhood, across the street from the High Line, a few blocks from the Hudson River Park, great restaurants, and super fun in the Spring with the outdoor bar. Best of all, it's an amazing hotel for dogs as you can hang in the coffee shop with all the neighborhood dogs. Be sure to request floors 3 or higher as it can get noisy on the ground & first floor.

title: Friendly staff and lovely ambiance!
text: The High Line Hotel is a true gem in a land of myriad boutique hotels! The check in was easy and very personable. The room was charming, full of light (room 59 feels like you’re staying in a Parisian garret with fantastic views north and west), and with just the right amount of style and comfort. The bed is to die for. Like literally I would die on this bed because I never wanted to get up. The bell staff made it easy to store bags after check out time so we could take a walk down the High Line, have a leisurely brunch and walk around the Whitney Museum.

title: Disgusting
text: Their coffee tastes amazing but this place is plagued by mice! I was there for a maximum of 20 minutes and saw 3! One of them even slid under a door (I’m assuming of guest room), I know this is Chelsea but I don’t think a coffee shop/hotel should have them running rampant like this. It’s a bit shocking. The rugs in the lobby also look very cruddy, I’m not sure how a hotel can claim to be a 4 star establishment when it looks this dingy. I will be leaving this same review under the coffee shop page.

title: Consultant
text:
Fabulous place for business or pleasure. Great location and staff. Hotel has tons of character and charm
Best coffee in the neighborhood and a fun place for dinner in the warmer months. No room service which I think is a plus

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This was our first time staying at the High Line, and the hotel did not disappoint in terms of location or style. Every employee of the High Line that we encountered was pleasant and efficient. Our room was clean and spacious, however the lighting was not sufficient for such a big room. The only other recommendation we would make would be for the bar to be open longer as we did not return to the hotel most evening's until after 22:00 by which time the bar had closed.

title: Wonderful staff!
text: My wife and daughter had a weekend away in NYC.  They loved this charming, dog-friendly hotel.  The location was perfect for walking in Manhattan and walkable to many attractions including PennStation, Times Square, many restaurants.  Unfortunately, we ran into issues with Booking.com, but the staff at the hotel (Caesar, Brenda and Monica and others) were amazing at helping us make this birthday trip for my daughter a special and memorable one.  We will plan to visit this hotel next time in NYC!

title: Wonderful Staycation
text:
This hotel is wonderful and quirky. We live only two blocks away but I surprised my boyfriend with a staycation as a gift this December. Everyone who works there was super friendly and helpful. 

The room was delightful -- luxurious robes, great towels, soft sheets!

Would stay here again for sure! And would suggest this place to any family or friends.

They don't have room service or a pool that some require in a hotel. But its in a great area where you can order delivery and go to the Equinox for a workout. Really really wonderful.

title: Needs more thought
text: The hotel itself is very pretty, if a little creepy inside, the elevator feels as if it’s powered by a person lol. The room was big and very comfortable large bed, it wasn’t the cleanest though, hairs in the bath tub etc, but the biggest problem for me is the lack of room service or tea and coffee facilities. I’ve stayed in plenty of places where there is no tea and coffee making in the room but I always order room service instead- this isn’t an option here, the barista bar downstairs closes very early (around 6 I think) and they won’t provide drinks to your room, there are limited amounts of coffee makers available on request apparently but none were available when we were there. It was fine for one night but I wouldn’t stay again based on that factor.

title: Great location, keep an eye on the receipt for charges.
text:
I stayed here on a business trip. Location was great, rooms were cozy and clean. It's a historic venue to spend a night at.
Only issue I had was on billing. I saw an unexpected room charge for a mini bar. I had not even touched the minibar. There was an extra charge which I could not opt-out of. I had to call the hotel to have them removed. Staff was great and apologetic. I would stay here again and would check the receipt prior to leaving the hotel.

title: Would have been a 4, until we met Brenda
text: Beautiful hotel, a bit confusing when we walked in as there was no official check in counter. Friendly, homey, huge rooms especially for NYC. first room we had one first floor was stunning but due to large amounts of rain, became somewhat stuffy as the night progressed (it is an old building). We reluctantly told the overnight staff and their manager Brenda about the room. Because there was another room available by chance, without hesitation, Brenda and her staff moved us carrying our dog bed and suitcases up to another gorgeous room on the 2nd floor. Brenda gave our dog treats, offered to help with the dog and overall is the type of person that makes you feel better about the world. The coffee in the cafe was amazing and everyone was super accommodating. The beds were also very comfortable. Definitely will return again.

title: Beautiful hotel, idyllic rooms
text: Had the pleasure of staying here in early December with my fiancee (we're both veterans of NYC and used to love it). The architecture is stunning and worth seeing (evidently it used to be a former seminary and there is still one next door). The rooms are like being in a warm ski lodge. Cool restaurant next door but can't remember the name. Will be staying here again.

title: oozes character and charm
text: Loved our stay in this out of the ordinary hotel. All rooms are different, very comfortable beds and very nice large bathtub. Although there is no restaurant the coffee shop in the lobby has delicious croissants and great strong coffee. It was fun to see all the locals from the neighborhood pop in for their take out coffee when going for their morning stroll with their dogs. Great Courtyard and lovely outside spaces. But most of all we loved the hotels you can take and we cycled all the way to the Trade Centre memorial and it is a stone through away form the High line. Staff were super friendly. Great price and great location, simply oozing charm and character!!! We will be back!!!

title: A lovely new hotel with excellent staff and one (large) flaw.
text: The service at this hotel is delightful, the rooms are comfortable and pleasant with excellent beds. The location is good, though a room facing the garden rather than 10th Avenue will give a significantly better experience. The flaw, however, is that there is no breakfast available. There's an Intelligencer Coffee in the lobby, which is lovely, but a hotel of this caliber needs to have a room service breakfast option. Barring that, they need to at least put a decent coffee station in the rooms.

title: 4th of July
text: Our first stay there and it was wonderful. Great staff, room  and look forward to doing a return! Lovely place for a coffee in the morning and sit out back in the garden. Later in the day a great restaurant out front.

title: Súper buena estadía
text:
Muy lindo lugar,
Muy buena atención 
Muy buena estadía 👍🏻
Fuimos con mis hijos y mi esposo y nos sentimos muy cómodos 
La atención de primera volveremos sin lugar a dudas !!!!! 
La comida 🥘 muy buena !

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff
text:
Beautiful hotel with thoughtful design, exceedingly accommodating staff, and romantic atmosphere. Large rooms with full bath (rare in NYC hotels), very clean. The fact that locals often frequent the hotel coffee bar speaks to the atmosphere and aesthetic.  Very welcoming place. Surprisingly quiet location, it’s a true oasis in a busy city, yet close enough to access transit easily. 
I’ve read reviews that comment on the lack of a traditional ‘front desk’ as a negative. I couldn’t disagree more. On the contrary, the staff use a butlers pantry to check guests in and save the desk space for an Intelligensia coffee bar.  It’s a not a cookie cutter hotel, each room has its own character while still maintaining excellent amentities.  You will not be treated as simply a reservation number.  For the area, price point, and quality, it is hands down the best hotel.

title: Stylish
text: The outside area and lobby are fantastic with lots of fun outdoor space.  The room was very big but uncomfortable—- there has hardly any furniture... a sofa or armchairs would have made a difference to add to the comfy bed. No tea or coffee making. Faulty ac meant we couldn’t sleep as it was too warm and blasting out by one side of the bed.

title: Just so/so...
text:
I booked the High Line because it was close to where I needed to be for work.  Overall the stay was just ok... with both hits and misses.  
PROS:  Cozy and comfortable overall look and feel.  Small/intimate lobby with a coffee shop that turns into a bar for a few hours in the evening.  The suite was a good size and the bed was comfortable.  Nice minibar selection. I also understand they allow dogs in the rooms which seemed to be a draw.   Friendly staff.  
CONS:  The room and hotel is decorated with what looks like bad 70's antiques.  I'm not talking midcentury modern or glam traditional - I'm talking the stuff in your grandma's parlor that no one used.  Pink vinyl chairs (sounds cooler than it is).  Beat up case pieces.  Fireplace without a fire but with a terrarium.  Obviously some think the decor is hep - I don't get it.   No food on premise - although nice choices nearby.  And the bar closes early (10 I think).

title: New York
text: With all the choices out there, it is good to spoil yourself with better quality of service. The High Line offers you this and much more. All your needs will be met with a genuine smile; every time. Great Job!

title: Very nice location!
text: Very nice location, I loved the uniqueness of this place. I stayed here on an unplanned trip to NYC. Will definitely stay here again and I recommended this place to all my friends and family. Thank you for the great service.

title: Holiday
text:
Lovely place, everything exceptionally clean. Would recommend.
Not long enough stay though.
Enjoy looking through the photos. Love trying different hotels, wonder if anything will be as meticulous as this.

title: Not air-conditioned
text: Who would think it would be so warm in November? However, expecting s hotel guest to sleep in an oven is unacceptable. Our room is 80 plus degrees. We opened a window but now a mosquito is attacking us all night. I know a hotel cannot do everything but the basic human need to have a comfortable temperature to live in is pretty important. The desk did not offer any help. They have changed the system to heat for the winter so that is that. I would never have a guest in my home miserable all night because of the temperature, screens on the window would have solved the problem, so the bugs could not join us in our bed. A fan would also be a good idea. Looks like it is going to be a very long night, shame because I really like this place. It has a cool laid-back vibe, coffee shop, great outdoor seating but perhaps too laid back.

title: Too expensive for what you get
text: Location. Location. Location. It’s got it for sure if you’re interested in Chelsea galleries, the High Line, etc. the hotel just doesn’t warrant the high prices. The staff doesn’t seem to care too much that you’re there. The building is an old convent which makes it quaint, quirky, and quite difficult if you’re of limited mobility. Not me, but I would be aware of a lot of steps that are required to reach your room. The elevators are not quick and I question their safety.  The room we had for $549 was a postage stamp. One of those where only one person can move at a time. The bathroom was nice and clean and the shower was good.  The bed was too soft for my taste but that’s a personal preference. The lamps didn’t work correctly and there are no easy plugs for electronics. There’s no restaurant in the hotel, only a coffee bar. Right next door however is Cookshop Restaurant which is great for breakfast and lunch (they do dinner too). There is no valet parking and the lot they direct you to is often full. It’s a trendy Chelsea hotel that lives mostly off its location.

title: Great Location &  Great Service
text:
Highline Hotel never disappoints. The staff is incredibly helpful, knowledgeable and always willing to go the extra mile to help. 
Every time we visited they remember our names and ensure we have everything we need. 

Rooms are charming & spacious, great amenities and feels like you are home even when you travel.

Thank you!

title: From the lobby coffee shop to the charming rooms - A+
text: Such fun to stay at this historic hotel a stone's throw from the High Line. I loved the bikes available to guests as part of the nightly rate, the creatively illustrated neighborhood map that I used to get around, the proximity to the Whitney Museum and more.

title: Great stay
text:
The hotel staff went the extra mile to make sure we were happy. The hotel has a natural charm and a great patio where you can enjoy your favorite drink.

The bed was very comfortable and the room layout pretty spacious with a nice coloring book should we have been bored!

title: Definitely worth staying here
text: We had a deluxe king room (300 sq ft) which was large, especially by NYC hotel standards - really, it was spacious. Nice bathroom too with Bigelow amenities. There's maid service twice a day which is nice when you want to have fresh towels. The bed & pillows were very comfy, and the air conditioning was excellent; also a nice flat screen TV. The rooms in this hotel are all vintage style which means there's an old fashioned telephone, & vintage furniture but all in very good condition so you don't feel like it needs to be updated. The shower was excellent too with plenty of hot water. I asked for them to fix the drain in the tub & it was corrected almost immediately. Really my only complaint was the lack of light in the room - brighter bulbs & more light is definitely needed, as is a light in the closet. There's a very popular coffee bar in the "lobby" which has some indoor & outdoor seating - it gets a big crowd & since it's a dog friendly hotel, there are lots of pups around too. The hotel staff was very friendly & helpful. The location is excellent, especially if you want to go over to the High Line or to Chelsea Piers. There are some excellent restaurants in the area (shout-out to nearby Toro for tapas). There's also a big Edison parking lot 1/2 a block away. We stayed on the 1st floor - I'd recommend asking for a higher level floor just so you can avoid the clattering dish noise from the lobby area. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Charming hotel -- a little pricey for the experience
text: There is much to love about this hotel.  It's in a fun location that's a little quieter than other places we've stayed.  It's also a wonderful old building with a great history.  The lobby feels more like a coffee shop, but it's fun because they allow dogs.  The attached restaurant is great when the weather cooperates (it's outdoors).  All this said, it's not really a luxury experience, though the price puts it in that category.  The hotel is a bit dark and feels a little like staying in someone's guest room (though a very nice guest room).  Glad we gave it a try, but I doubt we'll return.

title: NWFW
text:
We spend 5 day in this beautiful hold building hotel and it was really nice! 
The hotel looks kind of dark even during the day and the restaurant section is not so good compare the standing of the hotel! 

The terrasse in summer is great for lunch.

Really nice area and close to the best stores

title: Unique Accommodations, Good Location, with a few Eccentricities
text:
I prefer unique, boutique type hotels so I've stayed in many - The High Line hotel is in this category so is a fun place to stay - however, you need to manage your expectations as the experience is missing a few things that most of us frequent travelers have come to expect.  Here's what I liked:
- Good location - can walk to great sites, restaurants and clubs
- Comfy bed, Good water pressure in shower and windows that open 
- Nice amenities in the room:  robe, slippers, nice soaps, etc - even a coloring book!
- Bikes to ride
