Decor of the hotel has had such care applied, location was perfect for Chelsea gallery going, walking the High Line thx to an incredibly mild couple December days, and the staff at HLH was always generous and smiling. A perfect stay!

title: Cozy and charming hotel
text: This hotel is special.  Beautifully appointed rooms, friendly and helpful staff, and an amazing lobby bar that serves great coffee during the day, and cocktails in the evening. It was our home away from home for a week in December.  Highly recommended, and we hope to stay there again.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: First time staying at this property and will NOT be my last.  Thinking I have found my home away from home.   Son and fiancé moved to the area earlier this year and we've tried other (pricier) accommodations.  The High Line Hotel, has been the best!   Staff was pleasant & helpful, the room was immaculate, airy and comfortable.   Parking in the lot directly across the street was very convenient too.   I would deffinately recommend the High Line.

title: Simply the best
text: Had a wonderful, warm and luxurious three night stay here. Excellent staff and service. The atmosphere was particularly nice at christmas time. Great proximity to the Chelsea market where you can pop down for cupcakes and crepes for dessert.

title: Warm & Cozy
text: Best hotel for warm & cozy feeling. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Nice to have Intelligentsia Coffee in the Lobby. Walking distance to Chelsea Market and the Meatpacking District. Lots of restaurant choices. Love this place!

title: Excellent stay!
text: The High Line Hotel was the perfect place to stay in NYC!  Across the street from the High Line was ideal but also enjoyed the numerous wonderful restaurants and neighborhood feel to the location.  The staff was excellent, the hotel design was comfortable and inspiring, and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience and stay at the hotel for our next NYC visit!

title: Best hotel in the city!
text: I can't say enough about our wonderful experience at this hotel. Not only was the hotel itself absolutely stunning and charming, but the staff was some of the best I have ever encountered. I want to especially sing the praises of Alvin - he saved us as we were incredibly late leaving for the airport. He also welcomed us at check-in and made us feel right at home. All of the staff deserves all the praise we can offer! Any special request we made was met almost immediately. Our room was very spacious and had a lovely view of the Christmas tree out front, and even on a busy avenue and a lower floor, we never once noticed the street noise. I am an interior designer and can say this is one of the most tastefully decorated hotels I've stayed in, and does not sacrifice style for comfort. Thank you thank you thank you for a fantastic stay. We will most certainly be back!

title: Not impressed by the service
text:
Second year in a row that we stay at the High Line Hotel. It is a beautiful piece of urban renewal, it is in an old monastery. So, if you like anything ambience and don't care a lot about space, light and yipster, this is the place for you.
We arrived after Noon and our room was not ready yet. The check in is somewhat uncomfortable, you are in a middle of a very cramped space with a crowd-dy feeling (not good if you are somewhat claustrophobic!). Check out was as messy, with their system "frozen" and the employee writing down on a pad my email to send my receipt... that she never did, so I had to call back to ask for it.
I would say, for the price, I am totally unimpressed with the service. If you want the same feeling, for that price you can easily travel to Spain or Italy and stay one night at one of the old converted monastery there... better service and better views!

title: High Line Hotel
text:
This is a great place to stay! Beautifully done old building! Love the old brick, old tile and wood floors but new baths and fixtures. Great neighborhood off the tourist route. Great rooms. Great people. Stay here!
I love the coffee bar in the morning too.

title: Warm and Welcoming.
text: It is like walking into a friend's home, so warm and welcoming! Very different experience from other New York hotels where we have stayed. We chose the hotel for the location and loved the neighborhood and access to the High Line.

title: What a surprise!
text:
Just returned from a 3 night stay at the High Line Hotel.  We booked here based on TA reviews and were very pleased with our choice.  This hotel has an old, classic feel to it (looks just as pictured on their website).  Stately and tastefully decorated, creaky floors, yet they somehow avoid that "old smell" common to such establishments.

Pros:  Upon arrival, Alvin had our bags out of the taxi before I could even make it back to the trunk.  Danny was friendly and had us checked in promptly.  We were upgraded to a more spacious room (gotta love that!).  The rooms were a little larger than I imagined - definitely roomy for NYC standards.  Excellent toiletries and good quality towels.  Two umbrellas & two robes with slippers provided.  There is no password required for WiFi and there are lots of outlets available for charging.  Everything was kept very clean and the bed was wonderfully comfortable.

Cons:  Although the rooms were of comfortable size, there was not a lot of space available to put things.  Spouse and I had to dance around each other to get ready and had to get in and out of our suitcases a lot.  The room got a little too warm at night (even with our heat off), but the windows opened to cool things off a bit.  The coffee shop in the lobby stays pretty busy.  The line was too long one morning (and there is no coffee available in the room) so we had to venture out a few blocks for coffee.
Overall, we were charmed by this place and would definitely recommend the High Line to friends traveling to NYC.

title: Highline Hotel, Great Location, Kinks to Work On.
text: This was my second time staying at HH. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are superb. On this stay there was some really quirky things going on with the plumbing/water: it took forever for hot water to come out of the faucets on our first night and on our last day (#3) there was only tepid water in the shower. I did tell the front desk person on duty about this as we were checking out. My only other issue is that the coffee in the lobby is good but is so expensive: $4 for a small cup, wish they might have a complimentary cup for guests. That'd be a great touch!!

title: Business trip seemed a vacation
text: The staff was eager to serve and efficient. Courteous, knowlegable of the sorroundings, maje you feel at home. The decoration reminded me of the time I lived for many years in Old San Juan, every detail had embroided a piece of history. An Oasis in the big city. Certainly my first option when I return to NY.

title: Terrific Chelsea Delight
text:
Discovering this gem in the middle of Chelsea was a wonderful thrill for this  New Yorker. This was a surprise romantic getaway weekend and this sweet boutique hotel was perfect in every way. 
This historic setting and charming unique and super comfortable interiors are alone worth the trip. And to be able to bring out family pup without issue was a joy. You might wonder if a dog friendly hotel would show tell-tale evidence of canine inhabitation - in fact, the rooms were some of the cleanest we have ever stayed in, dog or no dog. Impeccably clean. 

The staff are wonderful and so friendly.   

One of my favorite hotel experiences ever. And I've been around. :)

title: Charming repurposing of historic building
text: This Chelsea hotel was once a seminary for training Episcopal priests.  In converting the building to a hotel, the designers have saved quaint antique features and added whimsical period decorations.  Our bedroom, bathroom and closets were spacious.  The lobby and bar are quite small and most of the seats are usually occupied.  There is no restaurant; other eateries are available nearby.  The hotel is leanly staffed but it all seems to work smoothly.  I chose the hotel for its convenient location to visit family.  I would stay there again.  Don't expect tons of service, luxury, cutting-edge technology or amenities, but enjoy the rather austere ambience and sense of history.

title: Hip scene and nice stay
text: This is a very fun place to stay if you are young or young at heart like my husband and me. I think we were the only people over 50 staying there. The place has a hip eclectic style. The lobby is always lively as they make great coffee. Cozy bar at night too. The young staff couldn't have been nicer. They tried to change our room when requested and offered us free wine and coffee as a way to smooth the hiccup, which actually turned out to not be a problem. The bed is super comfy, bath large and clean. Used furnishings artistically assembled made it feel homey. Would stay here again.

title: Well below expectations
text: We were here for 3 nights to see the Adele concert at MSG and were disappointed with the upgraded room and the so-called room service.  We were on the second floor above the coffee bar.  The closet was tiny, lighting was dismal, bathroom had no place at the sink to store toiletries except precariously balancing along on the edge.  Housekeeping came by the first day to replenish the fridge and never returned.  Great location in Chelsea but not worth the VERY pricey cost.

title: Kitchen/ coffee shop noisey early morning noise and no call back for left jewelry
text:
Great location to hop on highline park and it has a beautiful courtyard. 

We got a free "upgrade" to the second floor. The room may have been bigger but the second floor has a small hallway and the when the coffee bar sets up at pre dawn hours it makes a hell of a racket. Don't stay on the second floor if you don't want to be startled by loud pans and baking/kitchen equipment in what felt like the middle of the night. 

The door man was very pushy the next day to take the hotel car saying it would be cheaper. I almost got pushed into it and then used both uber and a taxi app to guesstimate the airport run. Both were 20 bucks cheaper. When you're spending $800/night it's not the $20 it's the principle. 

Finally, my wife left some jewelry there. It took some time to call them back because my wife went on another work trip immediately and didn't know that she left it there. Anyway, two calls and one voicemail and no return call. 

As someone has stated, it's a beautiful outside, rooms are tasteful, but not really set up as a hotel. It's downtown manhattan so obviously the location is fantastic. It would be 3.5 stars if it wasn't for the noise and then the no call back.

title: Beautiful but not fully set up to be a hotel
text: We picked this hotel because of the historic character and it didn't disappoint. The room had many interesting features and was furnished with beautiful antiques. The bathroom is huge. However the bed was lumpy with a very uncomfortable mattress. And the toilet ran the entire week we were there no one came to fix it.  Housekeeping was erratic sometimes there was turndown service sometimes there wasn't and on several occasions we had to call just to get the room serviced.  Everyone we met in the hotel was extremely polite and helpful. Since they have no restaurant they helped us get food delivered and when the food delivery arrived without forks someone ran to a distant part of the hotel since there's no restaurant to find a couple of forks for us. wonderful staff

title: Great place to stay
text: We always love staying at the High Line.  It is a very clean and quaint hotel and we love the décor.  Since our family is in Chelsea, it is also a perfect location.  The staff is always friendly and ready to please.

title: Always love the ambiance here
text: This is my number one preferred hotel in NYC. The location is great, I can jump on the Highline to get in some exercise and get to many locations easily, and it has unbeatable charm and charisma. There is a fabulous coffee shop on the first floor, /'d during good weather you can't beat the patio.

title: Lovely, lovely, lovely
text:
This is a story with a happy ending. Last year, we stayed at the High Line and were tremendously impressed by the High Line's style and by its terrific staff. But, to be honest, we had a problem with noise from the coffee bar. 

Well, we brought it to management, and they could not have been more responsive or more anxious to make things right. So when we returned to New York last weekend, we gave it another chance. And we are so very glad that we did. Wow. 

The location is great. (If you haven't walked the High Line already, it's amazing -- and right across the street.) There are lots of great places to eat within easy walking distance, including Cookshop right across the street.

The property itself used to be an Episcopal seminary, so it has that high Victorian, brick-y, solid, slightly Anglo-Catholic feeling to it. (You wouldn't be surprised to run into the cast of Grantchester lounging in the lobby with G&Ts in hand.) 

We were upgraded to a deluxe room, and it was heaven. Heaven. The room was beautiful. (I guess the decor would best be described as "eclectic, but not quirky.") The lighting was soft and soothing, the room was quiet, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the bathroom was elegantly appointed. 

Sometimes when I read reviews of a "stylish" New York hotel, I worry that my midwestern husband and I are going to feel like we accidentally walked into a Chanel photo shoot by mistake. But the staff could not have been more gracious and welcoming. 

This is my new favorite hotel in New York. It's not inexpensive, but they definitely deliver comfort, style, and hospitality.

title: Perfect!
text:
Perfect, quiet location (although within short walking distance to several sights, restaurants, bars and other attractions...) 
Spacious and comfortable rooms, great lobby ambience, cool bicycles that guests can use foc.
Will definately stay here next time I'm in NYC!

title: A concierge and a coffee
text: I had one night in the city and the Highline was the perfect place to spend it. The concierge arranged theatre tickets, dinner reservations and loaned me a charger for my iPhone. The Intelligensia coffee on arrival and departure was perfection. The nearby shops and park are both worthy of exploration. Thanks for making my stay memorable. I will be back.

title: Dogs, dogs, dogs!
text: The High Line Hotel has a lot going for it: Great location, not the least for an art buff, an interesting historic building and spacious rooms. Regarding the latter it was rather odd though, that there was no wardrobe in our room - only a clothes hanger in the bathroom. The lobby/espresso bar serves excellent coffee, BUT it is constantly invaded by dogs! Several times I counted up to 10 dogs at the same time in this rather small space! As I happened to be allergic to dogs, this was a major drawback. I could not use the lobby - and even less have breakfast there...

title: Very impressive
text:
Very well located, beautifully  English looking furnished Large rooms . Spacious  bathrooms.   The bed Was  super comfortable. The mini bar  was super well stocked
   Good looking people all around. The service Was impeccable.
  It has an excellent cafe in the lobby
  There is No doubt  that this is my favorite hotel in ny.

title: An absolute delight
text: My husband and I stayed at The High Line hotel for 10 days and we could have felt more at home. From the beautiful rooms, the happening terrace, helpful staff and fabulous coffee, this hotel is a must stay. Being a lover of all things vintage, I am so glad they have preserved the convert and kept the beautiful old school charm. Cannot wait to stay there again when we are back!!!

title: Eclectic and kitschy fun!
text: This hotel is a former dormitory for the Episcopalian theological seminary, which apparently is still operating next door, but I hear is about to close (according to the locals). The hallways are narrow, the elevator is an old classic Otis, and the decor of the hotel appears to be inspired by the play "Sleep No More" playing a few blocks away (if you haven't seen that play, get to it!). The room I had was small, but typical for NYC, and was on the top floor in the eves, but was extremely comfortable and pleasant. There is a 1930's rotary dial phone in the room (it works), along with assorted theological books on the desk, and a well stocked mini bar. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom had that wonderful period subway tile, the provided toiletries were excellent. The lobby and coffee bar are much smaller than I would have imagined, but comfortable and well run. The staff are all very friendly, and I stayed during Halloween weekend. A dog/kid Halloween party began in the morning on the terrace/patio outside and was a delight to watch. Obviously, the hotel is also loved by Chelsea residents, who came out with their dogs and strollers and carved pumpkins with their kids and costumed dogs. Great place, can't wait to stay again!

title: The High Line Hotel was fabulous
text: It begins with a fabulous old seminary converted to modern hotel.  The service was spot on and the lobby is also a coffee shop/evening bar.  The hallway is narrow but leads to a very oversized New York room.  A decorative fireplace with leather stools, a few reading selections and puzzles on the mantle.  The corner room had six working windows to allow the fresh fall air into the room.  A big comfy king size bed,  a mini frig stocked or room to store our beverages, and a big clean bathroom with CD Bigelow toiletries and glass water glasses.  This place is within walking distance to everything. We hadn't planned on but walked a bit on the High Line just because it is right there. And the pressed coffee from the lobby is the best I've had in years, and i love coffee.  We will stay here again and I hope soon.

title: Business Trip in Chelsea
text: I chose this hotel because it was the closest to where my client meeting was, and I could not have been more pleased with my stay. The check in staff meet you face to face in a small, quaint, lobby which smells of the most amazing coffee! In <1 minute after showing my ID and credit card, I was off to my room AND I received a free upgrade. The rooms were completely spotless which is amazing considering the property is historic (could not find a single speck of dust). The TV was HD, and the bed was very comfortable (down feather sheets). The rooms are well appointed with snacks, drinks, and booze (for a fee!) as well as two robes and slippers. You are very close to Chelsea market and Chelsea Piers. The only complaint I had was the noise. I had a room facing 10th Avenue, and, as it is a dog friendly property, I had to listen to the dog next door barking and crying while trying to go to sleep. It is expensive but was priced competitively with other hotels in the area. In spite of the noise which is forgivable since you are in NYC, I would definitely consider coming back for a second or third visit.

title: lovely lovely hotel
text: ok  I've stayed in a lot of places for business and this gem of a hotel in NY was so lovely. Here is what I loved: the  service - perfect,  décor perfect, puppy friendly, good coffee, I had a croissant it was delicious....  can't say enough about the concierge & front service other than it was perfect.

title: Vintage Charm
text: If you prefer vintage charm over sleek modern or posh uptown hotels, try The High Line Hotel in Chelsea. This is my favorite hotel in the city to date. The taxi deposited me at the curb in a rain shower, and before I could blink, their bellman had an umbrella over my head and my bag in tow. Very welcoming check-in staff. I had booked a Standard Queen room, some of which are reported to be VERY small, but because the hotel wasn't full and I was staying for 3 week-nights, I was upgraded to a beautiful suite on the top floor, #5, at no additional charge. I was so impressed with the very personal service. The small lobby is warm and clubby and incorporates a cute coffee bar/liquor bar (depending on the hour) where you can lounge and people watch. Public areas and rooms have vintage Oriental carpets over wood floors, eclectic antique decor, shabby-chic done well.  Super-comfortable beds and pillows. Outside the front entrance is a large park-like area with lots of tables and a coffee truck. (I believe this area is a full service restaurant during warmer weather, but it had just closed for the season.) Several fun restaurants/bars within a block or two (CookShop and Tipsy Parson), and the beautiful High Line elevated park just steps away. It's a $42+tip cab ride from LaGuardia, FYI.

title: Cozy historic boutique hotel in prime spot
text: Loved our long weekend at the High Line Hotel.  Daniel and all of the staff went out of their way to accommodate our requests and always with a smile. Rooms comfortable and quiet.  The location couldn't be better, charming Chelsea and the nearby Highline park provided us with beautiful evening strolls.  Enjoyed having access to the bikes and finally an excellent Sunday morning brunch with our daughters in the front courtyard.  See you again!

title: Excellent
text:
Situé à Meatpacking nous venons depuis 3 ans dans cet Hotel atypique avec autant de plaisir . Très bien situé en face de la High Line , restaurant en plein air et bar chic très bien côté. Pour les chambres plus grandes que la moyenne New yorkaise il faut demander sur l'arrière et non sur la 10éme.
Avant nous allions au Waldorf mais celui ci est plus cool et agréable

title: High is the operative word
text: The hotel is very well located and allows easy access both up- and downtown. There are bicycles for use, free of charge, which is a huge plus. Going around Manhattan on bicycle is something everyone should do! Finally, the staff is exceptional and make every effort to make sure your stay is perfect.

title: Perfect stay
text: The room has many small nice details antique furniture, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Great location in Chelsea. Look no further. The coffee bar turns into a cute cocktail bar at night but closes at 10 so there isn't any wild noises. The exterior is just gorgeous.

title: Awesome Chelsea Hotel
text: This glorious restoration of a 19th Century seminary is a unique and attractive place to stay. But it's the excellent service, the spotless rooms and common areas, and the community interface that make it a must-visit. My suite was spacious and charming; the coffee bar downstairs was welcoming and staffed with friendly folks; the outdoor areas were a welcome respite from the street. And I loved that the community is welcome -- folks come with their dogs for a bite to eat, a morning coffee, or just a comfortable interlude with their laptops. This is now my favorite NY hotel!

title: Super cool hotel, awesome location
text: The hotel is really cool, and our room was great.  It was a corner room overlooking 20th and 10th.  I'd never stayed in Chelsea before, and the location is awesome.  Such a cool neighborhood, and access to the High Line is just across the street.  It's a great hotel and I'd definitely recommend it.

title: Cosy Hideaway in Chelsea
text:
Cosy, different tiny boutique hotel. Plenty of outdoors space to relax and enjoy the weather.  
Great coffee Shop. Courteous staff. Perfect location away from the busy side of Manhattan. 
A bit noisy at times with kids school nearby. Some rooms are small.

title: Outstanding, great ambiance!
text:
Staff was superb, caring and helpful but not overbearing.  If you want the cold glare of a chain hotel, this is not it.  But if you want charm, interesting architecture and very nice people then this is it.
Room super clean, mattress so comfy....overall fantastic!

title: Impractical hipster charmer
text: There is no front desk and what lobby and bar areas exist are overrun by locals. We had a standard room which was cramped with an uncomfortable misshapen sofa.  The walls appeared substantial but lots of noise comes in from neighboring rooms and the street.   No coffee in the room.  The staff is wonderful and the location is phenomenal but at these prices I expect better

title: Not without its charms, but I wouldn't stay here again
text:
This is a very idiosyncratic hotel, and I can certainly see its appeal to tourists looking for a place that captures old-school, low-key NYC charm. Although I don't think it warrants the price, the rooms are more like mini-apartments with a lot of original detailing, and the bikes available for use are a nice touch. But the first room we were given, a supposed "upgrade," was on the first floor directly above the restaurant with a wall-unit AC that made the place smell mildewy. Thankfully, our request to move was accommodated.There is no room service, often times there was no answer at the front desk (which is only a person at a computer in a cute ground-floor coffee shop), and I chose to walk up several flights of stairs rather than use the elevator, which was old and which seemed to break down frequently (at least judging from the alarms I heard throughout the day).The bed could have been better appointed. I found stains on the feather bed underneath the sheets, which was also molting feathers. 

That said, the location is beautiful, on the far west side. NYC is very walkable, and you are near the High Line, the Whitney, Chelsea Market and loads of good restaurants (like Del Posto). You could even walk to the theater district in nice weather. As a native New Yorker, I'm often in town related to business so I prefer a hotel with a few more amenities, including room service. The Bowery manages both charm and comfort a little better for about the same price.

title: Muy bueno
text: Este hotel es una gran opción para viajar tanto en solitario como acompañado de amigos o familia, súper recomendable. Se encuentra muy buen ubicado, con fácil acceso a puntos turísticos de la hermosa ciudad.

title: great escape in NYC
text: soon as you walk in the courtyard the hotel has a relaxed feeling that is so different than many of the chains in NYC.   Very relaxed and "Paris" like vibe, with a cafe and free bike rentals.     Hotel staff is eager to please and knowledgeable of the area.   With Chelsea, the High Line and the Hudson River Park all within blocks, what more can you ask for?

title: A classic boutique hotel in a great location next to the High Line. Very attentiintelligentsia coffee and Shinola bikes.
text: A classic boutique hotel in a great location next to the High Line.  Intelligentsia coffee and Shinola bikes!  Very attentive service. Recommended for business and pleasure. Room furnishings were museum quality but there were the needed modern updates.

title: A wonderful ambience: Cool, hip, and also friendly
text: The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The two I met, whose names I do not know: The woman at check in was so warm and offered me a choice of available rooms. Each time I saw her she remembered me and asked how I was doing. Other staff members were similarly friendly without being obsequious or servile. I love this hotel. So relaxing with a cute little park nearby and still only blocks from all the jazz and buzz of NYC!

title: Love the High Line, It will be our "Go To" Hotel for all stays in NYC
text:
My husband and I stayed at the High Line, and we just loved it.  We felt home, cozy, the bed was amazingly comfortable.  The room and hotel are filled with antiques giving it an old world charm, however, the technology in the room is all spot on.  

The staff were superb, and went out of their way to make you feel at home.  They paid attention to every detail.

The neighborhood is amazing, and the Hotel offers free bikes for touring the area.  Highly recommend eating at the "cook shop" which is right next to the hotel.  Super brunch there on Sundays.  Little bit of a line, but very well managed.

This will be our go to hotel going forward!

title: Loved it
text: Had my engagement night here. Staff couldn't have been nicer and the room couldn't have been better. Would highly recommend it for anyone looking to have a romantic evening. We live in NYC and we'd still come back again.

title: Great Experience
text: Loved the ambiance.  The hotel has kind of a older funky decor going on which I liked. I would consider the room large for NY.  The bartender was great!  Location is excellent and close to great restaurants.

title: Tiny rooms with crazy cool style
text:
As you approach this hotel you see the outside diners under the umbrellas and think "i can totally chill here!"

It's truly a gem of a hotel: the staff is so chill and there are so many details. It's probably one of the most intricately designed hotels I've ever stayed in. I do about 60 nights a year at Marriotts so when you stay in a boutique it's a completely different experience.  It's quaint; it's cool; it's very hip.

Check in was different too. it was handled by a female in the small lobby on an ipad. it was different. The lobby is small. it's more like a large living room.  with a bar tucked in the corner.  it's cool. 

The room I stayed in was a king room on the 3rd floor street side adjacent.  It was VERY noisy.  You can hear people having conversations, cars, and the annoying sirens NYC is famous for.  The AC unit was loud and the room was tiny. maybe about 2-300SQFT?  I don't know if every room is that small.  That was my only set back...

I really like the neighborhood. Cheslea market is like a 5 minute walk. And the highline park is like right there... it's a great place to be.

I'd totally recommend this place.

title: Hands down the best hotel in NYC
text:
I don't usually write reviews often, but this hotel takes the cake for hotels in NYC. I have been staying at various hotels each week in New York for 4 years now. This is by far my favorite. I request to stay here whenever I possibly can. 

Rooms - Each room in this hotel has it's own charm. The styling and decor really give this hotel a very special ambiance and aura. The styling is elegant and traditional. Every room has a terrarium and an eclectic selection of books. There are also crisp TV's and bluetooth speakers as far as electronics go. The bed itself is also very comfortable. 

Staff - Since I frequent this hotel, I have gotten to know the staff very well. Danny has always had great recommendations for local restaurants and entertainment. He has always been very accommodating and helpful.  

Amenities - The hotel is also home to the best coffee in NYC. Intelligentsia is downstairs in the lobby and they also have a courtyard too with an Italian restaurant and coffee truck. The hotel does not have a gym, but they have something better. They give you a complimentary guest pass to Equinox which is a few blocks away. This premium fitness center in itself is a great value as day passes are normally $30. 

All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. If you have the opportunity to stay here, please do. You will not regret it.

title: Good location, big room, poor service for the price
text:
Beautiful building with nice comfortable rooms. Spacious, clean room and bathroom, bed is really comfortable and relatively quiet. Location is good, near Chelsea markets, the high line and good restaurants but a bit far from metro stations (15 min walk) and other tourist attractions. 
The reception area is a coffee shop which makes it very casual but also useful for a quick bite and coffee before heading out for the day. Free bikes are great and the ride along the river is lovely. 
Concierge personnel was generally unfriendly and unwelcoming and while they got their job done, they did not add to the experience.

title: Delightful City Sanctuary
text:
I entertained a group of clients over Labor Day Weekend and our experience at The High Line exceeded all expectations.  
The ambience of the hotel is cool and comfortable.  Several of my guests commented on how comfortable the beds were in the beautifully appointed, generously sized rooms.  While enjoying all that NYC has to offer, my group was pleased to be able to relax and decompress on the outdoor terraces. 
The staff is friendly and approachable. I look forward the staying on my next trip to NYC.

title: Hot weekend, cool room, excellent location
text: New York could not have been more uncomfortably hot on the weekend before Labor Day, but my room was deliciously cool, very clean and very lovely. The HighLine is just steps away, so I took a long, early morning stroll the entire length--refreshed every step by a breeze off the river. So beautiful it brought tears to my eyes.

title: Perfect Hotel for NCY
text:
The hotel is very central located and has the very nice charm of an boutique hotel. 

The staff is very nice and helpful. We rented the bikes which are provided complimentary by the hotel and the staff adjusted everything quickly so that we were able to explore the city. 

We received an complimentary upgrade and I do have to admit that the rooms are very nice and large. Nice big bathroom and enough space in the room that you can spread out your luggage without problems. 

There is an open air restaurant and bar available with good food and drinks. The area is in front of the hotel also on the side of 10th avenue but is isn't disturbing in terms of noise. 

The high line park is 1 minute away and several other shops, restaurants are in walking distance. 

Perfect location for private and business trips.

title: Night away
text:
Absolutely loved this hotel! Staff is very attentive and friendly. Coffee bar makes some very yummy coffee. Room was clean and well kept. They turned down our bed at night :)
The room we stayed in had cotton robes and slippers...made me feel like a princess.
This hotel is close to the Highline. 
There was construction work out our window but hey it's NYC....the view of the streets was still very awesome!

title: Interesting, stylish and a bit kooky
text:
We were here August 2016, family of four with the kids age 19 and 22. We know Ny very well so wanted a change from midtown hotels. Hence the choice. What we liked - the location made it feel less stressy as an environment, the beds were super comfy, the rooms were original and a bit kooky but good and the staff were willing but it's not a smoothly run place. For example the bar and restaurant outside where we had a few bad moments has nothing to do with the hotel but you have no idea that is the case. So complaining to the hotel is futile.   The cook shop on the block next door is good as are the many places over on 9th for breakfast and cater to all tastes. 

The wifi was fine. But there is nowhere really to sit with guests. You can try and get a table outside but then you are subject to the poor service. Not to mention the thundering 10th ave traffic!  Those trucks blow their horns all the time and the noise was deafening hence having to leave and find somewhere quieter.

But the atmosphere of this old seminary is lovely and unique. I would come back here but know to do any entertaining elsewhere in NYC.   

Oh and they need more shelves in the bathroom. There is literally nowhere to place a toilet bag except on the floor.

title: We will definitely be back
text: Upon arrival, we realized I had actually booked the night for the next day(Sunday)on accident. The hotel staff, Daniel in particular, was very accommodating. They got us a room and even honored the price that I had booked for the incorrect date (about 200 dollars cheaper than the Saturday rate). They got our room ready immediately. As if the hotel staff wasn't reason enough to stay here, the hotel itself was great. The rooms were very clean. Th decor was somewhat vintage. With a (not usable) fireplace in the room, and even small batch soap in the bathroom. There's a coffee shop and a bar downstairs so there's plenty to do. You are literally steps from the highline. Can't wait to come back here!

title: Fancy coffee is not enough.
text: Unique appearance and style, but - the furnishings etc are more run-down than pictures suggest. Very little storage space (no dresser) and  minimal bathroom space for your items. Good, convenient AC control. Very friendly and pleasant staff. You trade off location and style for as much comfort as you'd like. The courtyard restaurant is crowded and slow.

title: First class
text:
Couldn't ask for a better hotel in Chelsea.
Excellent location.
comfortable hotel bed along with darkening shades provided an excellent nights rest 
Bikes available on premises.
Excellent coffee bar with seating.

title: Really great NYC hotel
text: I've been travelling to NYC for work over the past year. I mostly stayed at the Sheraton but decided to try the High Line based on a colleagues recommendation. I was VERY happy with my decision! The hotel is in a great area, has a very nice historical ambiance while still being modern in amenities. The coffee shop in the lobby is great as well as the free gym pass for the Equinox two blocks away. I will definitely be staying here again for my next trip in a few months.

title: The High Line Hotel
text: It is a beautiful boutique hotel with smiley personnel! Nice gardens, very close to good restaurants and other places. 4 min away to Hudson river for jogging, bicycling. Delicious coffee served inside. We have stayed in deluxe king room, comfy and nicely decorated with traditional furniture.

title: Our default hotel choice in NYC
text:
The High Line Hotel ticks every box we look for as seasoned travelers & visitors to New York for business & pleasure. 
- Rooms are Huge by NYC and well-appointed with high end products & luxury amenities one expects at this price point. 
- Location is fantastic & back courtyard is truly a hidden gem - 'storybook' perfect oasis to retreat to with our Intelligentsia coffees/pastries. 
- HL Hotel offers the amenities we actually use - amazing coffee shop/bar + courtyard restaurant, without excessive options that tend to inflate rates.  
- On repeated stays, we have always found bell/concierge service staff to be welcoming, always super-friendly & responsive.  While some are not as formal or polished as can be found elsewhere, they're always courteous & warm, making us feel at home. 
- & the Bikes!! We love this touch & book them always - bike lanes on west side make getting around to up/downtown safe & easy. 

In a city full of choices, we don't even look at other options at this point.

title: Fantastic place to stay in the city
text: Great location. Fantastic staff. And always delicious coffee. I can't think of another place I'd rather stay when I'm in NY. Luckily, the last time I stayed at The High Line, I was upgraded to one of their suites and found the experience spectacular.

title: Peace near the High LIne
text: I happen to like a pre war feeling, and I don't need all the bells and whistles when it comes to technology, so the High Line has become a favorite for me.  The rooms are lovely, but not first class which is why the average rating.  Having said that - it's clean, neat and well-located.  There's a soul cycle a few blocks away, yoga across the street, great restaurants and the high line! I love the coffee bar inside and the coffee truck outside - great place to meet friends.  The restaurant offers some really good options for all diets and the service is terrific.

title: Boutique hotel
text:
Boutique hotel in Chelsea, not far from high line and about 12 min walk to subway. Could be brutal in humidity. Nice outside bar and courtyard area. Staff very friendly and helpful. Inside coffee bar makes good coffee but service is quite slow. 
Our room (36) was very quiet overlooking the internal courtyard. Good decoration with tasteful furniture. Robes, slippers fluffy towels. Good air con.

title: High on High Line
text: Classic dog friendly hotel in Chelsea area that has the charm and attitude to make you happy to be staying there.  Great coffee bar, rooms are cozy and elegant, and I just keep going back there every time I am in New York.

title: It's the little things, in addition to everything else.
text:
We came at first because of the Chelsea location and have been back a number of times because of...
* the warm and welcoming ambiance, where one feels enveloped in the building's history
* the feeling that this is a true neighborhood gem, used by locals too
* the comfortable renovated rooms, which retain the charm of their history as a seminary dorm
* the fantastic specialized coffee shop in the lobby
* the free bikes one can borrow
* the wonderfully friendly staff
* the dog friendly policy
* the great outdoor seating
* the convenience to the high line and other Chelsea attractions and restaurants

title: Intelligentsia Coffee Shop
text: Delightful & charming -- good spot for coffee & conversation -- welcoming & genuine. Good seating in the lobby area & a garden.  Envy the guests ... bikes are free for them.  Will be returning for lunch or dinner at the outside restaurant -- looked delish!

title: Definitely not a hotel for business but A+ for hipsters
text: The staff at the hotel is great. The hotel however is not meant for a business traveler. The hotel does not offer room service, desks in room are very small and they don't start serving coffee until 7 am, at the ultra hipster coffee bar, where it takes 15 minutes for a plain coffee, and each cup ordered is an individual pour over. The line of people and cups gets longer and longer as each cup is ordered. It's was so absurd, I had to laugh. Deliver me from hipster hell. Also review your bill at check out, the hotel adds a donation to a charity without your permission.

title: Elegant hotel
text:
We stayed for our son's wedding, and this hotel made the event most memorable.  Upon visiting
Our  children in the future, we will always stay here.  The coffee bar is fantastic, and the rooms were  better than any other in New York.

title: Would like to stay here again
text: Great renovated hotel, helpful staff, terrific restaurant/bar and great coffee (for fussy Aussies).  Location near the highline is great, close to Chelsea markets etc.  The room was slightly small for 2 travelers with large suitcases, but I guess you cant have everything!!!

title: We love this hotel!
text: The High Line Hotel doesn't feel like a NYC hotel: the rooms are bigger than typical and our room looked over a tree lined area, quiet enough to open the windows, and yes! the windows open! Lovely coffee shop downstairs and a nice open area for coffee and drinks outside  when the weather cooperates. Nice vibe, feels welcoming and not cookie cutter.

title: My favorite NYC hotel
text: The HighLine is a charming Old-World style hotel and my favorite place to stay. It has a great location and convenient to activities and entertainment. The personnel are very friendly and seem to enjoy their work. It has great outdoor spaces - lovely outdoor patio at the back and comfortable street side seating for lunch plus a bar. They even upgraded my room. The rooms are spacious with great beds.

title: still great...
text:
use to stay here when it was the tutu center, it was such a great deal and nicely done decor. little more money now, but worth it. rooms are even more superb than before. fresh, comfortable, beautiful furnishings. a lux bathroom is always the icing on the cake and you get one here. love coming through the door every time. instantly feel at home here.

intelligentsia coffee shop downstairs is excellent. having bicycles available is convieniant and oh so nice to toodle around the neighborhood on.

highly recommend.

title: A hotel that feels like home and staff that makes you feel welcome
text: I live in NYC and I had to stay at a local hotel for a few weeks during a home improvement project. I chose the Highlan hotel based on location, West Chelsea and the ambiance, not corporate but personalized and the amenntities including a very chill out door space, bikes and more. The hotel attracts people from the neighborhood with its coffee bar, restaurant and outdoor space. It's very relaxed and the staff is more than welcoming. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. I highly recommend the Highline hotel to anyone visiting NYC who wants an authentic experience.

title: Carefully check your bill
text: I hate having to write this because my experience of the actual hotel was great. Beautiful hotel and rooms, great service and location. Then I got my bill and was charged over $90 in erroneous charges.  When I called they did remove the charge but it definitely left a bad taste in my mouth and I'm not sure I would stay there again because of that.

title: Great stay, charming rooms, good location
text: Loved it. The room was spacious and well-decorated; older, but very charming. Great location, just a block from The High Line. Quiet at night, and we loved being able to get such great coffee right downstairs.

title: Great location
text: I truly enjoyed my visit to New York and the hotel was really nice. I am planning my next trip soon and I will be returning. It was close to the event that I was visiting so that made my trip stress free.

title: quaint-used-to-be-a-secret-but-not-anymore
text: I often stayed here when it was the Tutu Center. Now the rooms are more $$ but the ambience is wonderful, kind of early flea market with French sinks and great, comfy beds. Super helpful staff and immaculate. Much more lively these days.

title: Stains on the bed sheets... the Hotel representatives do not care
text:
The Hotel is expensive and you would expect great service. However, dispite the charm and standing of the hotel, I have to share a very bad experience. 

I spent one night in the hotel a few weeks ago and realized that the sheets had disgusting stains. 

Not only I think that this is not acceptable for a hotel, but when I noticed it to the staff. The lady made me pay full price and write to the manager. I wrote immediately and didn't get a reply until I called the hotel a few days later. 

I spoke to someone who notified the manager. This one replied to me saying that they thank me for the notification and will "make it up" next time I come. 

I've never received such a casual reply. I live in Manhattan and therefor, I don't come often. The manager should have done something immediately and better, something should have been done at the check out. 

Terrible costumer service.

title: This hotel is AMAZING!!
text: My husband and I stayed here on a very hot summer weekend.  Upon our arrival, we were informed that we were being given a complimentary upgrade to a suite!  Obviously, we were thrilled about that; but aside from that news, we loved pretty much everything about this place.  The room was of course beautiful, spacious, and well appointed (we love the quirky, antique-y, mismatched furniture!).  Bed was super comfy.  Bathroom was big and very clean.  When we arrived, the toilet was running continually in the room - I called the lobby and they sent up an "engineer" pretty much immediately who fixed it right off.   We were presented with Ice and turn-down service each night.  Bathroom was freshened up each night while we were out.  The lobby is great - the Intelligentsia Coffee bar in the lobby is fantastic.  The patio in the back is lovely and quiet, with beautiful plants.  The restaurant out front is terrific - great food and service.  Lovely spot.  Location could not be better - across from the High line, easy access to the stairs up.  The people who work there seem to genuinely love their jobs.  Also - it's clear that folks living in the neighborhoods surrounding the hotel like this place too - they come here for coffee and to eat at the restaurant, which I think is a great endorsement.  All in all - we love this place!!

title: I fell in love with the High Line Hotel
text:
We were warmly welcomed at the curb, led into the lobby (more like an anthropology/urban outfitters  designed living-room/parlor. Jevar led us to our room on the 5th floor.  It looked out to the street, above the Alta Linea restaurant (highly recommend). All of the staff was kind & helpful,(Especially Emily,when we added one more night because we did not want to leave yet.  The rooms are simple, formerly the dormitory for the Seminary that still exists next door. Bathroom shower had excellent water pressure & great tub for soaking.  Cozy robes & monogrammed slippers to wear. Great variety of drinks in the mini bar & snacks.  Great stationary (you can use the typewriters in the lobby to type a letter).  On the lobby level there is a coffee shop all day until it transforms into a bar around 6pm. There is a lot of outdoor seating both in the front (Alta Linea Restaurant) and in the back on the patio.  There are great bikes to borrow, we rode up the Hudson River Parkway up to 
Central Park.  I highly recommend using the bikes. The proximity to the High Line is perfect.  Chelsea has so many restaurants & shops.  The Cookshop just across the street was delicious. We only ate dinner there but friends also enjoyed their brunch. Walking distance to Equinox Health club, you just exchange your room key for a health club card in the hotel lobby. I cannot wait to return.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: My favorite in all of NYC!
text:
The High Line is a safe haven to me, a secret and comfortable hiding spot, for when I'm in town working long days / sometimes nights at our partner's offices down the street. It's one of few hotels in town here I feel at home, where I don't feel monitored, but rather, encouraged to relax and kick back. 

I also travel with my Aeropress for good coffee, and the High Line has me beat in this department too, where the hardest part of making exceptional coffee in the morning is putting pants on and walking down the little staircase next to Intelligentsia. 

My only regret is not staying here longer, I'm looking forward to my next trip. Great AC in the Summer, warm and cozy in the Winter.

title: Great 4th of July
text: Very nice room. Staff was friendly. Went here for fourth of July for one night with my boyfriend and was very satisfied with the room. It was modern yet classic. The hotel was located near Chelsea Piers, the highline and numerous other restaurants and landmarks.

title: The Highline continues to be a great place to stay in New York City
text: We continue to stay at the Highline whenever we are in New York as the hotel and staff continue to offer great accommodations, friendly staff and wonderful ambience for its' guests.  Love the outdoor seating/dining/bar areas and the Intelligentsia coffee bar in the lobby.  Great location for Chelsea/Meatpacking....we walk to some wonderful dining spots and residential areas.  Our room this stay had a wonderful view of gardens and greenery and one of the most comfortable beds we have experienced along with a large bathroom with amenities....will definitely stay at the Highline again!

title: Best Hotel in Chelsea
text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoy staying at the High Line Hotel. Even though we're both architects (who can geek-out on things like the High Line's cloistered courtyard, or its collegiate gothic style), everyone can enjoy the charm of this former theological seminary turned hotel. Fans of Wes Anderson films will appreciate the eclectic interior design which utilizes vintage wallpapers, Victorian antiques, Oriental rugs, taxidermy, vintage typewriters and rotary phones in the rooms and main floor lobby.  Although there's no dining room for breakfast, Cookshop is amazing and just a 30-second walk away. Intelligentsia Coffee is located in the main lobby and also serves out of the coolest-looking 1963 Citroen van parked in the front courtyard. On warm weather evenings, that same courtyard turns into the pop-up restaurant, Alta Linea (but don't eat there without trying their frozen Negronis--they're so lit!). The hotel offers guests complimentary Shinola bicycles that you can take over to the Hudson River Greenway or after dinner or brunch at Alta Linea, go for a stroll along the High Line Park. But the best thing about the HLH is simply relaxing in the private rear courtyard where you feel totally removed from the cacophony of the city. Can't wait to return.

title: Gorgeous...
text: This is a truly unique hotel, located in a historic building alongside one of NYC's most beautiful parks. Loved the design and decor. Incredible attention to detail. Smooth ipad check-in, bluetooth speaker in room, complimentary bikes, Intelligentsia coffee bar. Highly recommended.

title: An oasis in the city
text: The High Line Hotel has become our go-to place to stay for long weekends in NYC. It's wonderful to have a downtown hotel that doesn't also house a nightclub that thumps into the wee hours. It's perfectly situated to walk along the High Line park and easily to the Whitney Museum, Chelsea Market, the shopping and restaurants in the Meatpacking District, and the West Village. The rooms and the building itself are absolutely beautiful and full of character and the front courtyard turns into a wonderful cafe/restaurant/bar in the warmer months. So it's super cozy in the winter yet feels like a European resort in the summer! All the staff are warm and friendly and we always feel welcome from the instant we step onto the sidewalk out front. My one and only complaint is that the bathrooms are a bit small but all the pluses far outweigh this one minus. I think with any building of this age, pedigree, and character, a somewhat smaller bathroom can be expected. We'll be back again and again!

title: Loved it!
text: I'm a native New Yorker, but traveled to NYC with my family for the first time in June. I wanted a quiet hotel, a bit off the beaten path, and the High Line delivered!  It was absolutely beautiful!  And there are both front and back patios that make you feel you've been transported away from the City.  After a full day of sight-seeing, it's exactly what we needed!  I met a local New Yorker one day reading the newspaper on the front patio, and she said, this is one of the only outdoor places in the City that's quiet and very clean!  Stay here - don't fall into the tourist trap of staying anywhere near Times Square - you'll be glad you did!  And a shout out to Emily, Kim, Alvin and Mike (at the coffee bar) for their friendliness and exceptional service.

title: Loved staying here for four nights!
text: For a long weekend in New York, this was a unique and wonderful hotel to make as our base! The location is in the Chelsea neighborhood near the High Line and within walking distance of the new Whitney Museum of American Art, Chelsea Market, and lots of restaurants and bars.The staff was very friendly and couldn't be more accommodating. The lobby is cozy and inviting with a bar that serves coffee and snacks in the morning. Everywhere you look, there are interesting details and the original brick seminary building is gorgeous inside and out. We stayed in room #10 which we accessed by taking the elevator up one floor, or the stairs behind the bar. Our room was very spacious, had old wood floors and a fireplace, and two (!) large closets. The bath was also roomy with a shower-in-tub, lots of thick white towels and toiletries. There's a very well stocked mini-bar and snack tray. The king bed was comfortable and the linens super soft. The flat-screen TV was conveniently placed on the wall across from the bed. Our window was one floor up overlooking the popular Alta Linea garden restaurant near the restaurant's "food truck" but we simply closed the curtains when we wanted to be sure no one could see in. It didn't bother us at all since we got up early and went out each night, but very light sleepers may be troubled by noise from the restaurant. (We had a fabulous Sunday brunch there with five friends and one well-behaved Pug!) The back of the hotel has an inviting, surprisingly large garden and grass area which is great for everyone to use. We loved that the hotel is dog friendly! It was an unexpected retreat in New York City and we'll definitely stay here the next time we visit.

title: Among New York's best
text: I am a former New York resident and frequent New York visitor for both work and pleasure (I am a train ride away now).  I've stayed at a number of places across the range, but the High Line immediately won my heart. It felt from another era in the best sort of way. The place had character. It was understated but elegant. The room was well designed and tidy.  And the staff was just great.  It's become an instant favorite. I'd highly recommend it.

title: Classic Hotel
text: We decided to spend the night in the city since we had dinner reservations and a walking tour the following day. Our room was beautiful, the bed had a pillow top which made it very comfortable. The shower products were high quality. The room was immaculate. Coffee bar the next morning was excellent and the courtyard was quiet and relaxing. We would definately return! Thank you for attentive service.

title: A perfect New York weekend!
text: We had a fantastic 20th-anniversary weekend at the High Line Hotel. We loved the old seminar building, the excellent coffee bar in the lobby, and the very helpful staff. Walking on the High Line and enjoying the views, the gardens, and the reclaimed industrial cityscape was a great pleasure. We'll be back!

title: Vintage Hotel totally Updated
text:
Situated next to the mid point of the High Line this hotel is in a great location for meat packing and Chelsea restaurants and bars. Not that convenient to subways so we cab bed it for the weekend.

Comfy beds in a good size but not large rooms. Very nicely decorated rooms, good towels and nice toiletries are provided. Hotel Bars close early and we were shut out on both Saturday. 11 PM and Sunday 9 PM. 

Good value for a NY hotel.

title: Great Hotel; a little complacent, however
text: Really charming and comfortable. Cool old building. However, the staff is a little untrained. Check-in was terrific; after that however the very green staff could not complete simple tasks and at times rude, especially the coffee people

title: LOVE
text: I personally am most impressed with all of the people who work at the hotel! They are friendly kind and very helpful. We stayed for business and now are coming back for a vacation... love the outside areas and the bikes!

title: High Line Hotel is perfect
text: Beautiful large room with excellent bath. Extremely friendly staff--everyone was very upbeat. Great bar, quiet back garden, lively outdoor dining. Delightful barristas serving up very good coffee before hopping on a bike or heading to a complimentary session at Equinox. Charming.

title: Comfortable, beautiful, roomy, quiet.
text: I wasn't sure about booking this hotel since the reviews are mixed.  I loved this hotel but if you're into ultra-modern glass and steel this isn't your jam.  My room was amazing - brick accents, giant tiled bathroom, fireplace (not working but lovely to look at), and the people in the hotel were all helpful without being intrusive.  I had a 3rd floor room and the street noise was muted (an important consideration in NYC).   Will definitely stay here again, this is now my favorite hotel near the office.

title: Great for family gathering
text: Family gathered from around the US for a funeral. At our request, we were all situated on the same floor, making room-to-room visits easy. The concierge team was great. The High Line Hotel made a difficult gathering much easier.

title: Central location for lower West Side
text: We had a large room overlooking the courtyard, it was very quiet at night plus the room was dark at night.. One small complaint the lighting in the bathroom was far too dim, impossible to read labels under the shower. The room was well appointed.  The hotel is very central for the Chelsea area, SOHO plus most of the lower west side, subway a few blocks away.  We were surprised that the bar closed so early at night, once we knew that we had a drink on our way home at one of the many bars in the area.

title: Come for the scene, not the service
text:
This place has a great scene, from the moment you hit the sidewalk. The inside lobby is full of quirky decor that makes you feel like you're hanging out in the antique-filled mansion you wish you owned.

However, with that, this is the first time I've walked into a hotel and not known where to check in. It's a unique idea to not really have a front desk given their look, but someone should be there to greet & direct you. Overall service was just sub-par, I'd expect more for this caliber of hotel. 

Location is great, close to Chelsea market, great restaurants, and of course the high line! 

This would be a great option for someone who wants to see & be seen and isn't looking for anything above & beyond in the service department.

title: Always a great stay @ the High Line Hotel !
text: This has become one of my favorite hotels for when I am in the city I could be there for personal or business, and its just a great home away from home. The service is great the employees are always so pleasant and accommodating.  Beautiful and vintage feel to it.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: I absolutely adore the High Line Hotel. You don't feel like you're checking in to a hotel in Manhattan, you feel like you've arrived at a large country house and the Lord of the Manor's staff are greeting you. The staff are professional, friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are gorgeous and I would move in tomorrow if I could. The Intelligentsia coffee shop in the lobby (that turns into a bar in the evenings) has the best coffee and pastries. The hotel is truly doggy-friendly and staff are always on hand with treats. The location is great - mere minutes from The High Line, Chelsea Market, Soho House etc., I stay nowhere else.

title: Comfortable luxury
text:
We chose the hotel following the advice of a friend with impeccable taste and were not let down in the least. 

The High Line exudes comfortable luxury, offering service that's attentive but not unctuous and rooms that feel like a guest room in an elegant country home.  We arrived for a weekend getaway to learn that we'd been upgraded and enjoyed a King Size bed in a beautifully appointed room overlooking the front patio area. Despite the proximity to the street, the room was sound proof and completely dark thanks to formidable curtains.  My only complaint regarding the room was the dim lights in the bathroom that made it difficult to see whether I was brushing my teeth with toothpaste or body lotion. 

The ideally located hotel is close to the Village, Soho, and mid-town without their hustle and bustle. A few steps from the front door is the entrance to the High Line Park which is an absolute must see. Within one block there are divine breakfast places including Cook Shop and La Bergamote. 

Do yourself a favor and take advantage of the Shinola bikes they have available. The hotel's proximity to the West Side Highway Bike Path makes a great launching site for a day of cycling around town.

We are not fancy folks and staying at a 4 star hotel could have made us feel like Kay Jewelers'  shoppers at Harry Winston. The High Line, while luxurious in amenities, is not snobby in attitude. We would stay here again and I recommend it highly to anyone looking for comfortable luxury in a convenient neighborhood.

title: Quirky
text: Loud street noises and no room service - but wonderful staff and it's NY!  Food is everywhere.  Crank the AC up and the street noises disappear.  Great coffee and pastries in the lobby for purchase. Beds were soft and fluffy!

title: Another great stay!
text: One year ago, we had a great stay here and were hopeful that this repeat visit would yield the same satisfactory result.  Happily, we can report that this visit exceeded last years!  This hotel represents a bygone era with all the modern requirements of a first class hotel. It has a special feel that I've not found in any other NYC hotel along with a staff that's totally in sync with your needs. Add to that a great Chelsea/High Line location and you're primed for a wonderful stay.  Enjoy!

title: Fun New York Getaway..
text: We arrived at 10am and were happy to find that our room would be ready at 11:00.  We stopped next door for some breakfast at Cookshop and indeed our room was available as promised.  The Staff was polite, welcoming and courteous.  We happen to like the "vintage" vibe of the Highline Hotel and found our room to be spacious and very comfortable.  The room comes with an extensive minibar that could get you into trouble and the bath products were plentiful.  The courtyard in back is nice and quiet while the front courtyard is busy and "happening".  A nice place to unwind when the bar opens at 5:00.  a fun vibrant atmosphere.

title: The best amenity was a dirty towel
text:
Walked into the hotel and was thoroughly impressed. Then I went up to the room and the cleanliness was well below what anyone would expect for $600 a night. Even for NYC. It was pouring down rain so the next thing we looked forward to was ordering some room service but of course this hotel has no food. I don't know why it says they do. Coffee and a sugar packet don't constitute breakfast for me so I have no clue why they say the provide food and breakfast. 

Seriously, there is nothing to this hotel beyond the lobby. Go walk in, see it, and then leave.

title: It's a great hotel with a prior history as a seminary
text: The hotel has a young, international clientele. Outdoor eating and an indoor coffee bar. In the heart of the Chelsea with art galleries and the Highline available for visiting. Cabs and rental bikes are available in the area.

title: Do not go !!!!
text:
Paid a fortune for absolutely  the worst hotel I've stayed in New York.

No service at all,ghastly dark rooms. 

No one cared about the paying guests .

Keep away. COULDN'T HAVE BEEN MORE DISSAPOINTED. Go anywhere else.

title: Summer in the City  -- High Line Hotel
text:
Stayed for two nights over Memorial Day weekend to celebrate a special occasion.  

Property is beautiful, in a great location steps from the High Line, with lots of great art, shops and restaurants nearby, and the West Village and subways a few blocks away.  The hotel fully lives up to all photos on the web site, and the services was friendly, personalized and efficient -- special thanks to Emily, Alvin and Romeo for making it so. 

I look forward to staying again.

title: Love this historical boutique hotel
text: Not cheap, but a beautiful boutique hotel in a historic 19th century building.  Our room faced a peaceful courtyard, we woke to the sound of birds chirping  -- a rarity in a Manhattan hotel room.  The location couldn't be better, literally steps away from the Highline  There's no room service, but dozens of excellent restaurants are within a few blocks.  And the coffee in the lobby is simply excellent.

title: Tiny rooms
text: The hotel is well located for Chelsea, whitney museum, art galleries.  It is small and dark inside and the two rooms we saw were not good ones.  The deluxe king on the ground floor abutted the outdoor restaurant and was very noisy.  The queen room we were offered instead, #27 1/2, (twenty-seven and a half), was tiny.  There was 20 inches between the bed and the wall with windows.  There was a clothes rack for a closet, along with a desk chair.  The bathroom was very small.  I am surprised that the NYC lodging administration allows rooms that small to be marketed as 'queen rooms'.  A most 'down' experience in the most wonderful city!

title: Wonderful hotel with amazing customer service.
text: Our bedroom and bathroom were both large and spacious which is very hard to find in NYC.  The atmosphere was unique and the staff very friendly and efficient.  Our daughter was in need of a wheelchair and to our surprise the hotel located one for us and let us use it during our stay.  "They were a trip saver!"

title: Awesome experience at the High Line Hotel
text: The history and ambiance of the building took us to The Highline Hotel, however the over the top service will take us back!  The entire team did their absolute best to make sure that we were well taken care of.  From arranging transportation and suggesting restaurants to making sure that our room was in tip top shape and ready to receive us every time we went out, the service was incredible.  By the second morning the concierge team knew us by sight and called us by name for the remainder of our stay.  This hotel is the perfect place to experience all the best that the Chelsea Neighborhood has to offer!

title: Not ready for primetime
text:
I stayed at the High Line recently on a long weekend trip with my husband that was part pleasure (a wedding) and part work (my husband had meetings scheduled on Monday and Tuesday).  

He had stayed at the High Line once before and had liked the hotel enough to suggest we try it together.  Unfortunately, our experience soured him on the hotel so much that we checked out early and found a room somewhere else.  In fact, he emailed the GM of the hotel before we checked in to introduce himself as a repeat guest who had, in fact, recommended the High Line to a celebrity client who stayed for a nearly two-week visit.  He never heard back from the GM, before or after our stay.

Last time he stayed there, my husband was in a small suite, which was more than enough room for him.  This time we had a standard room, which was tiny, even by NYC standards.  There are no drawers in the room at all, literally none.  Two people, four days' worth of luggage, no drawers.  

The drain in the tub was slow and clogged.  We asked the young man at the front "desk" (there is no front desk in this tiny lobby and the people who greet and check you in are clearly not polished in the ways of luxury hotels) to call engineering.  Nobody came.  We checked in on a Thursday afternoon.  Upon leaving for dinner we asked the same young man to call for turndown service.  Nobody came.

The poor service and cramped quarters weren't enough to make up for the good things the hotel has to offer so we left the next morning.  Like the Gaansvoort Hotel down the street, the staff seem more concerned with the hotel's hip factor and self-importance and less concerned with delivering a first-class experience.  

We won't be back.

title: What awful choices!!
text: Just checked in.. Offered a choice of two bad options for a room.  We could have a king--nice large room BUT next to the bar which by their own admission is noisy until 11 PM.  Or a Queen that is so small that it only has a light on one side of the bed and you have to turn sideways to get into the bed.  Our choice was the queen BUT the price stays the same because they showed us the king and we opted for the queen

title: I only wish I could have stayed longer!
text: What a wonderful hotel! While it looked beautiful online, it was even better in person. The lobby is small but charming and houses a coffee bar by day (with delicious coffee and baked goods) that  transforms into a bar in the evening. The rooms are amazing. I was in a spacious corner room with windows on two sides that let in plenty of light. Hard wood floors and high ceilings made it feel even bigger. I was so enchanted with the vintage furnishings and light fixtures I sent photos to my friends and family. The beds were very comfortable and I woke up feeling happy and well-cared for. Wish I could have stayed a little longer!

title: Great weekend at the Highline
text:
Housed in a former seminary, this hotel retained much of the buildings 19th century charm through its restoration of architectural details and the creative decor.  Vintage typewriters on each table in the lobby are an interesting touch as someone always seems to leave a cryptic message typed out on the paper. 

The Intelligentsia coffee bar in the lobby and in a 60's coffee truck in the front courtyard kept me very well caffeinated. And there's a really nice rear courtyard where one can escape from the street noise. 

We had a small but comfortable room on the third floor. Again, the attention to detail on the decor made it a terrific break from my Hilton business travel. Bathrooms are small but nicely appointed. Beds were very comfortable. And the pencils and paper on the small desk were a nice touch. There's a bit of street noise if your room is in the front of the building. However it is NYC after all. 

Had two meals at Cookshop across the street. Both were fantastic. Reservations needed though as the place is popular. Hotel has an outside restaurant during warmer months but it wasn't open yet during my stay. 

And an entry point to the Highline is just across the street. Try an early morning visit as it does get really crowded. Well worth walking the entire length and back. In fact, the new extension ends right at the Jacob Javits Convention Center.  I wanted to stay at the Highline Hotel for a recent conference so I could walk the Highline to the conference center but it was booked. 

Also a couple blocks from Chelsea Market and the new Whitney.  

If you like creative spaces with a historic feel, this place is for you.

title: Loved this place
text: Absolutely Gorgeous hotel and fabulous staff! We stayed in May and the restaurant outside had just opened, I was tempted to stay another day just so I could sit outside and drink Rose all day!  Mathew recommended a fabulous place around the corner for some fun on Sunday night called Bathtub Gin which was a Blast.  We walked to Chelsea market, fabulous and ate at The Red Cat.  All suggestions of the hotel staff.  We will definitely stay here on our next visit.  We stayed in suite 3, which was Gorgeous!!

title: NYC Traveler
text: This is my second time at this historic, hip and well located hotel. Really fun when the weather is good, as the outdoor spaces expand the hotel public spaces. But don't let them give you room 47 1/2. Yes, you got it, it is only half a room. No space to unpack or turn around for $700 a night. Our other room at the same price came with closet, large bath, sofa and table lamp. None of which was in #47 1/2. Did not seem at all fair or equitable.

title: Style over substance
text: Impressive building, small lobby with 'hipsters' cradling their ipad's to check in guests.  Perhaps it's our age.  Great location, interesting neighbourhood and close to the fabulous High Line, too.Never did sample the coffee since too crowded and impossible to get served.  Spacious room with comfy bed, huge windows giving lots.of light, Wooden floors with Persian style rug underfoot, room overlooked side street so quiet.....unique in NYC!  Lovely toiletries in bathroom.  Poor lighting throughout room, impossible to apply make-up and no power socket close to a mirror to use hair dryer. A large fireplace dominated the room.  No closet just a rack beside the door and not enough hangers either.  This was room 43. No room service, apart from ice, so a tea or coffee machine should be offered in the room.  Fridge in room was a bonus.

title: trendy hotel convenient to javits
text: great location, friendy and helpful staff, decent sized rooms, wonderful outdoor locations, a cafe intelligensia coffee shop in the lobby, a pop up restaurant ourdoors at the hotel, and the restaurant COOKSHOP next door. had a fabulous stay.

title: Absolutely fabulous!
text: Wonderful hospitality, charm, tons of character, great part of the city, Highline within a block, quiet, extremely luxurious bed, sheets, awesome shower water pressure, toiletries, fabulous courtyards for outdoor seating away from crowds

title: Wonderful to find individuality in hotellerie especially in Manhattan
text:
Something in this brilliantly located well appointed hotel reflects the whole vibe of bobo hipsterdom which has taken over Manhattan. The reception is a random laptop, managed alas by equally random check in staff. There is no formal breakfast bar but a truly excellent coffee shop with a standing bar and sofas in the lobby if you can grab one to savoir your drip coffee or matcha latte. Coffee bar service is not altogether speedy or charming although the cool local regulars who come in and out which their dogs are hailed heartily and make for great NY voyeurism. My room was vast, as I would imagine a Boston country house with books from bygone ages which I wanted to snugggle into the huge bed and read. The only drawback was being first floor if I drew the curtains in my bedroom or lifted the blind in the bathroom to get light I was in direct sight of all those who flock to the front courtyard pop up bar of an evening. 
A huge hurrah for Valerie Coelllo who after a series of annoying staff errors was faced with a spitting mad client  (an overtired me) and listened with respect and thought and set it all right. That is service.

title: loved it
text: Loved it, front desk agents was very friendly. coffee was good and  there is a tall gentleman with a heavy Caribbean accent therein the lobby, he was very professional and helpful, room was great location was prefect ..... i loved it

title: Fantastic location, comfortable surroundings
text: The High Line is in a fantastic location, just blocks from Chelsea galleries, and of course, The High Line itself--an urban amenity like no other. Staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby scene with an Intelligensia Coffee and Tea bar was a great plus. It was a bit cold for outdoor dining and the patio, but they both looked promising for our next trip.

title: Avoid the Ground Floor Rooms
text:
I, unfortunately, had a poor experience at this hotel.  

While the rooms are large by NYC standards, the room I had was right next to the lobby cafe, which becomes very loud early (4-5a,) in the morning as the staff begins to prep for the day.  Additionally, guests lounging in the courtroom can see directly into these ground floor rooms, which necessitates having the shades drawn almost at all times.

Sadly, the staff was not very helpful with issues that arose during the stay, and not particularly apologetic.

title: Atmospheric, well situated & rustic
text:
This is a fine hotel, set within a dramatic period building. Quirky, moody interiors that match the interior perfectly. I believe the hotel used to be either an old school or hospital and this is reflected in the size of the rooms which are not on the large size.

The beds are extremely comfortable and very luxurious. The bathrooms are stocked with C Bigelow products which is a pleasant and welcome touch. The lobby area/reception area is unusual in that there is no reception desk and staffing is kept to a minimum. It has a real 'new york' feel with people on laptops, talking to each other. I did notice that technically this hotel is short on facilities (no sit-down restaurant, no bar, no pool, no gym) but if you are design-orientated and love a boutique hotel this would be a great choice.

New York is the city that never sleeps and it is likely that you will only really be in the hotel to sleep, and sleeping and bedding is certainly a strongpoint at the Highline.

title: Great boutique hotel near the Highline
text: Very much enjoyed our stay at The Highline Hotel. Good atmosphere, friendly staff and comfortable rooms. We were unlucky with the weather so didn't get to try the outdoor restaurant or sit in the pretty courtyards so we will have to come back. Room was comfortable if a bit on the small side.
