Egregious pricing for bottles of water in the room ($8.00 for a small bottle) but the coffee bar serves excellent coffee and cakes.

title: Great Destination Hotel
text:
This is a great hotel with a lot of character.  The rooms are so comfortable and unique, that you hate going out -- it is only the temptations  of NYC that break the pull

Away from the usual tourist traps, this hotel is located in the Chelsea Neighborhood of Manhattan.  This is a building with history and character, but updated with a demanding well travelled guest in mind. The "experience" starts with a lobby check-in unlike what you may have ever experience - not the sterile lobby with a formidable desk here -- you check in with iPad carrying hip staff in an area more like a active living room.  The access to room is thorough relatively narrow passages and small elevator, which has it's own 1880s New York charm.  The restaurant is outstanding and bar is as good as any I have seen.  It is easy to understand why the Negroni is so highly regarded.  I also like the way they converted the restaurant into a café in the morning.  Certainly worth a visit for a special occasion (ours was our 30 year anniversary -- gifted by our New Yorker son)- or if your budget allows -- multiple visits.  Not sure what they called it, but I also enjoyed the back yard.

title: Totally overpriced
text: The most standard 3-star-feeling hotel you can imagine, for a crazy high price. Old carpet, old-looking everything, and 'old' not in the good antique way, but just plain old, needing replacement. My room was extra noisy because it was close to the reception and coffee/alcohol area. It was also extra dark, even in a sunny day with all curtains open, because it was half-in-the-ground level.

title: Loved it!
text:
Loved the room. Great location, staff was helpful and the coffee from the coffee bar was excellent. I'll be back.

The rooms are furnished nicely. I love the rustic feel, makes for a peaceful ambiance.

title: Charming hotel but no room service
text: All was perfect except no room service and no restaurant in the hotel, just a tiny cute bar at the entrance. Not enough for a 4/5 star hotel. Perfect location if you like Chesea and Meatpacking district in NYC.

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel muito lindo, com atendimento maravilhoso, todos atenciosos e queridos. O quarto em qual fiquei era espaçoso, aconchegante e com uma decoração linda. Adorei o hotel que por si tinha um ambiente bem calmo.

title: Paying guests V drop in dog walkers
text: Had a fantastic 7 day stay in Feb/March 2016 for our youngest daughters 21st Birthday. Party of 9 stayed so very expensive but didn't mind as just the accommodation we like. All staff were very good especially door staff and Alvin. Only suggestion to improve would be to make more communal areas for relaxing as only facility is coffee bar, but no food to speak of. Didn't mind this as we always prefer to try out multi eateries, but breakfast would have been welcomed as an option. Sometimes thought that cafe staff treated regulars better than paying guests and not always room in communal area to sit. I love dogs and my own 14 yr old dog died a few years  ago but they do take over reception a bit ? There is plenty of room to offer these options so not sure why the hotel doesn't consider this. However excellent experience. Will be in New York next Feb/March 2017 so choices to be made ???

title: Delightful stay and a great neighborhood!
text: A friend and I stayed at The High Line Hotel for a quick trip to NYC. I used to live in Brooklyn and it was a pleasure to stay in a great, residential part of Chelsea that is in walking distance of the new Whitney, Chelsea Market, Madison Square Park, etc. The Highline park is amazing in any season and you can access it by stairs a half block away or walk a few short blocks to 23rd and take an elevator if you or your companions have difficulty with stairs. Cookshop next to the hotel is a great breakfast venue and no doubt great for other meals. I love the laid-back vibe of the hotel, its front courtyard, and the delicious coffee to be had in the lobby. The Voysey wallpaper in our room (bats and poppies-- super cool) was a design touch that won my friend's approval in a heartbeat. Very comfortable beds. This is a laid back place-- no fuss, no muss. Easy to pretend to be a local and blend into the fabric of the neighborhood. Not slick and modern-- but with ample amenities. My new go-to in NYC. Would be great for solo as well as couples. Hidden gem.

title: Unexpected Charm
text: I stayed in a room on the 5th floor, and it was perfect!  The street noise that some others mentioned wasn't an issue on the top floor, and the room was huge (which rarely happens in NYC!)  The location is great, just a few blocks from Chelsea Market.  They did a great job with maintaining the original nature of the building.  Will definitely book here again!

title: A real gem in NYC
text: Stayed 3 nights here and really enjoyed it. After the bustle of the city, it is a great place to come "home" to. Our room faced the courtyard and was very quiet, especially for New York. The bed was modern and comfortable, and the bathroom well-equipped and clean. The staff was informal, but very attentive and friendly. Kim was especially helpful with reservations and questions. Would definitely stay here again and hope to give the bikes a ride and enjoy relaxing in the courtyard.

title: Expected more
text:
One of only a few hotels in the neighborhood.  Bones of historic structure suggested great possibilities for a boutique hotel, but we left a bit underwhelmed.  

Hospitality offered was friendly and adequate but not special.  Be aware that there is no food service (other than a coffee bar in the lobby) and nothing nearby for an early breakfast.  Lobby area is tiny and constantly full of neighborhood folks, who were sitting in the small number of seats and using the free wi-fi.  Room was OK.  Bed was comfortable.  Very convenient to the High Line Park and Chelsea Market.

title: We found the hotel to have the rustic feel in the concrete jungle.  The vibe was perfect
text: We had a nice big room and the decor is excellent. It felt very relaxed with a hip and rustic feel.  We enjoyed the options to purchase in the room and the bathroom was huge.  The bed was very comfortable and we had nice views of the courtyard. We loved how the coffee shop becomes a bar in the evening and the bartender made a great old fashioned.  The staff was attentive and accommodating and attentive to questions we asked before our stay.  The location is wonderful if you want to check out the high line and go fro a stroll.  This stay was for my wife's 40th birthday and both of us could not have been more satisfied.  We will be back.

title: Comfortable overnight
text: This is a third visit.  The room was comfortable although being on the first floor was a bit noisy.  The advantage was location and reasonable price (for NY) since my business was in the area.  The disadvantage is a limited lobby/common area which rapidly fills up with guests.  There is no restaurant although there are a number in the area.

title: I would stay here again.
text: This was a beautiful hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was within easy walking distance of the Chelsea Pier. I was upgraded to a larger room which was very comfortable. I would stay here again.

title: What a relief!!!
text: So I booked a room for 3 nights at the nearby Gem Hotel. Disaster! Room was postage stamp size and hallway was cruddy, but what was worse - a heater that sounded like a truck. So I could turn it off and freeze or keep it on and be up all night. Not a great choice. After a completely sleepless night, begged  to Check out 2 nights early and finally got the okay, after making a serious fuss. Found my way to the high line hotel. Wow!,!!  So impressed, feel taken care of, the room is gorgeous. Love this place! Love, love, love.

title: Great design and great location.
text: Great ambiance and in an excellent neighborhood for food as well as immediate access to the Highline linear park. The historic charm and helpful staff made for s lovely stay. The coffee in the lobby is great but quite expensive.

title: Great design, great location
text: A beautifully designed hotel in a 19th century seminary building, in a great location near the Whitney Museum, the Chelsea Market, art galleries, the Hudson River and, of course, the High Line. I was thankful that the hotel doesn't have a lobby scene akin to a nightclub. Instead, and of more interest to me, the lobby features an Intelligentsia coffee bar. While the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, the excellent Cookshop is just across the street. The hotel also lacks a gym, but guests have access to the beautiful Equinox gym just down the street, which is better than any hotel gym. Or you can job along the Hudson River waterfront a block away.

title: What keeps us coming back?  The location, the rooms, the price, and most of all the staff.  It's our spot.
text:
The rooms are elegant and inspiring but also so comfortable.  The staff is helpful and friendly, but provide space and privacy when needed.  The concierge has everything at their finger tips.

This is THE hotel in Chelsea.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
I can't say enough good things about our stay at the Highline Hotel. Everything about it was amazing.  I love historic buildings and this was right up my alley.  My father grew up on the side street that our window faced which made it even more special.
Kim at the front desk was great.  She checked on our room a few times while we had a coffee at the coffee bar (very good) and when it wasn't ready we got upgraded to a better room at no cost.  Room was a great size and everything was very comfortable.
This location is fantastic.  My husband and I didn't want the super touristy aspect of NYC.  We did walk the Highline, but after that we just walked around Chelsea and the Flatiron to different bars.  We had a blast and we would come back to this hotel in a heat beat!

title: Great stay in Chels
text: Unique hotel experience for NYC! Small, beautifully preserved older hotel that is a former seminary., within a stone's throw of the Highline. Excellent location for food, subway, and walking to destinations south and north. We were upgraded to a superior king, which was positively palatial by NYC hotel room standard size in boutique hotels. Very comfortable bed, great shower, and I think most if not all rooms have nice light and views of courtyard or inset from the street and noise. A great plus - the windows actually open! The staff is very very nice, personable, and helpful.

title: Wonderful Experience at the High Line!
text:
We were in town for Easter and looking for a great place to stay in NYC and the High Line Hotel exceeded our expectations.  The rooms are wonderfully apportioned and outfitted; the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful; and the location was great - with so many outstanding restaurants close by.  Plus the beds are so comfortable!  

We enjoyed the coffee bar in the lobby and champagne garden in the afternoon.  Our experience was outstanding!

title: Maybe hip, but little else
text: I want to be as objective as I can. So...The High Line Hotel is well located in Chelsea and seems to be a hip spot for locals. Therefore, if you like that, and don't mind small or noisy rooms, give it a try. If you like well staffed, more convenient, modern, comfortable and truly luxury hotels, I'd try somewhere else.

title: Outstanding quiet place to stay for a NYC visit!
text: This was our first time to NYC and couldn't have found a better place to stay.  The service was absolutely great from everyone we encountered and I don't think it was just because it was their job to treat customers well

title: Great place to stay in the Chelsea area
text: Beautiful historic building houses a truly wonderful hotel.  Our room looked out into a quiet courtyard with a children's playground.  Wonderful to see the kids playing in the late afternoon.  Room was perfectly quiet at night, away from any street noise.  Room was large with a nice seating area with a very nice bathroom (bathroom also had a window overlooking the courtyard).  Lobby attracted an eclectic crowd, many with dogs, which added to the quaint nature of the place.  We had a wonderful stay.

title: Wonderful hotel in Chelsea
text:
We had 4 nights at the High Line in early March - it was a great experience. We were welcomed by Matthew who took our bags and speedily checked us in. He provided maps and lots of information about the hotel and the neighbourhood. Service at the hotel was excellent; the rooms were very comfortable and well appointed; the wifi never failed! There was always someone to ask questions of or to hail a cab for us.
It's a great location with the High Line park access across the street and several very good restaurants within a couple of blocks. The Cookshop on the next corner was open for breakfast if pastries and coffee from the hotel's coffee bar aren't enough. It is close to Chelsea Market and a reasonable cab ride from the theatre district.

title: Absolutely loved this place
text:
We stayed with our kids ( age 10 and 11) at this hotel for four nights and absolutely loved it. The location is great - opposite the High Line walk , close to the Whitney and five minute walk to Chelsea Market. The staff were very helpful and friendly. 

Our room was big enough for all of us , was light and airy , nicely decorated , had super comfy king size beds , great shower and we even got used to the traffic noise! 

We loved the lobby with fantastic coffee til 6 pm and great cocktails in the evening.  On our last day it was getting warm enough to have drinks outside in the courtyard. There are a lot of locals who walk their dogs and stop in for a drink in the lobby but we thought that that just added to the charm of the place.  

We would definitely stay here again!

title: gulliver's travels
text: we spent a weekend in nyc and i had accidentially booked the high line hotel...long story not worth going into. anyhow, after checking out the homepage, i was very much looking forward to our stay as it seemed to be quaint place with a very boutique feel to it. the staff were helpful and the general atmosphere is nice. few too many dogs in the lobby for my liking but i don't have to stay there so never mind. our room however did come as a surprise. the room number should have been a dead giveaway...27 1/2. one might wonder, will you get 1.5 rooms or only 0.5. it was the latter. the room size seemed to stand in direct corelation to the bed size and we had the feeling that they had built four walls around the bed. no closet, no drawers, just a coat rail. to get in and out of bed, you had to climb over each other or depart from the front part of the bed. i have never stayed in such a tiny room. so, good location, nice staff, nice atmosphere but make sure to keep your meals to a minimum or you might not fit in the room any more.

title: Could be so much more
text:
You cannot fault the location of this hotel - I love Chelsea because there is so much to do. Nor can you fault the design. The rooms really are very special with an exceptionally high standard of decoration. Whilst small - it was a seminary - they are very well equipped. The beds are also extremely comfortable.  Despite the traffic noise, I had a great night's sleep. 

So why not five stars?  Whilst the design is special, the hospitality isn't. The really top class hotels that I have stayed in have greeted me with a complimentary drink.  That would work so well in this hotel and would encourage guests to use the reception/bar area. The exceptional hotels that I have stayed in haven't filled the room with absurdly overpriced products like Fiji water. It felt like I was staying in an overpriced (though none of the prices were shown) 7/11.

With relatively little effort, this hotel could become one of the top choices for staying NYC. However to do that they need to deliver something more than just great design.

title: Birthday trip to New York
text:
I chose The High Line as I wanted to be in a quieter place in the city.  I wasn't disappointed.  My daughter had booked us the double queen bed room.  It was huge!
It was a friendly, professional chic hotel.  I would have liked more downstairs space to have a drink or coffee as the space was a bit like a corridor.  However outside was pretty.  The staff were great and we were in a great area with bars and restaurants close by.  
I would visit again.  Thank you for a great stay.

title: Great Hotel!
text: We loved this hotel so much!  Fabulous character.  Spotless.  Rooms are not huge and there is not a ton of storage, but we managed and it was so worth it.  Most of our activities were based in Chelsea so it was really convenient but we did easily take the subway to other parts of the city and Brooklyn.  And oh, the coffee shop!  Great coffee. I mean really great!  Nice for an evening drink as well.

title: By far the best hotel below 23rd Street
text: This is an outstanding hotel in every respect. The management is first rate, the location is perfect, the rooms are elegant. You can enjoy your morning coffee in a rear garden and hear only the sound of birds. You can walk out the front door and be next to the highline, the new Whitney, a wide range of small galleries, endless restaurants, movie theaters, great architecture, and much more. It is fun and hip without being too noisy or pretentious. The rooms have character, each one is unique, all are extremely comfortable, none are dull. If you are driving you have quick access to the Lincoln and Holland tunnels, if you are taking the train or bus the main stations are nearby. This isn't a big hotel, so it is personal; but it is not so small as to deprive you of your privacy. It isn't generic, but it doesn't try too hard to be different. In short, there are many great hotels in NYC, but I don't think you will find a many places that strikes the ideal balance. The High Line is a winner.

title: Girls Weekend
text: We girls loved the High Line Hotel as it is so intimate and friendly...there is no real front desk...it is in the lobby...so the staff just help everyone! From getting a car to the airport to giving me messages, making recommends to directions...so easy to deal with. The lobby was  also full as it was cold and  the coffee bar attracted guests and neighbors and their  dogs! Better rates in winter and we even had a 58 degree day in February...yahoo....

title: An unusual hotel
text: The hotel was aesthetically a pleasure-not a vulgar or ugly thing in it. The staff gracious, interesting people.   We would have liked to have juice as well as coffee in the lobby--and it needs a microwave so that I might have had my coffee warmed up.

title: My favorite Hotel in New York
text: The High Line is the only hotel I use on my regular trips to New York. The rooms are charming, elegant and a good size by New York standards. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the coffee bar in the lobby has some of the best coffee in the city. There is a spacious and serene patio in the courtyard which is a great place to relax with a drink. It's great to be on the West Side as 10th avenue is quiet compared to other major avenues in the city and besides being close to the high line the hotel is surrounded by a number of great restaurants including my favorite spot Tia Pol, which is an amazing spanish tapas bar and restaurant.

title: Great Stay
text: The historical aspect of this property was great!  The size of the room was awesome for a NYC hotel.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  I felt like I was in a private house instead of a large hotel.  It was great!

title: Great Night In The City
text: Stayed there night of Feb 27,2016 and truly felt like I was at home.The ambiance and the surroundings of the seminary make for a pleasant stay.Staff is top-notch and most accommodating.Very pleased indeed.

title: Best Night of Sleep in a Hotel
text: Amazing bed, great shower pressure, clean room, friendly staff...everything I look for in a hotel. I loved the wood floors - so much cleaner than normal hotel carpeting. Look forward to coming back when it's spring and I can sit outside with an awesome cup of coffee.

title: Cozy, quiet location
text: Keep in mind this was a seminary, so the rooms are small, and tight once you add a big cozy King-size bed!  It's a quiet area, but very convenient to the high line, short walk to herald square or the West Village.  There is a Spartan richness in the details: restored wood flooring, black and white tiled bathrooms, ancient rotary phones, clever wall papers.  The hotel is clean, and very comfortable, but my daughter and I are very small and were quite cramped in the standard room.  For larger people or a longer stay I might choose differently, but it's such a cozy place.

title: Special place will make your stay perfect!
text:
Very special place, not the standard anonymous hotel.
Excellent coffee and tea shop al lower level, very friendly staff.
Rooms were comfortable and with a touch on furniture and old style design. Bluetooth speaker available.

title: Amazing Stay at Such a Unique Hotel!!!
text: Got a room for 3 days for New Years and New Years Eve. Me and my girlfriend where taken away by the small things that make the stay unique. the vintage telephones, correspondence letters and furniture that seemed beckon the roaring 20's

title: Very cool old seminary dorm building. Great location
text: Was given a very cool small suite(#4) and loved it.  Great proportions, very comfortable, and very friendly staff.  The coffee shop downstairs attracts a young fashionable crowd, and has great coffee.  Good breakfast restaurant in Cookshop, and Story is a very cool and ever-changing store.  I will definitely stay here again. - JAG

title: 10th Anniversary trip for foodies who love NYC!
text:
We chose NYC for our 10th Anniversary because we love the city and we love the restaurants.  We brought two other couples of the same persuasion with us (we are all middle aged folks with children ranging in age from 3 to 15).  We also love the High Line - the entire concept and execution of this elevated park in the city.  So, when we went to find the perfect hotel to anchor this special long weekend, we decided on the High Line Hotel.  It was recommended by a cousin of one of our traveling companions.  This cousin lives in London and has discerning taste.  

We could not have chosen a more perfect hotel!  From the moment we walked in, I knew it was right.  The entrance with the outside eating area and espresso bus was a good start.  Then, when we walked into the dark, cozy yet sophisticated lobby we knew for sure.  Our room was lovely and well appointed.  We faced the inner courtyard and it was very quiet at night - wow!  Was not expecting that.  

We had espresso drinks (Intelligentsia) both mornings, and they were well made and tasty. One evening we also had cocktails at the bar, and these too were excellent.

Being an old building the stairs and elevators were a bit of a maze, but nothing that we couldn't figure out! We liked how they've adapted to the small reception area with ipads and roaming staff, nicely done.

title: nice hotel, nice peole, and friendly atmosphere
text: room super clean, and nice. warm welcome and perfect location. one of the best hotels in NY. I loved the style of the hotle and the rooms. During summer you can stay in the garden and have a drink. Have a nice stay!

title: Great location
text: Absolutely love Chelsea, and the High Line hotel is in the perfect location.  Staff was friendly and the coffee in the lobby was phenomenal.   Only complaint that I have was the room was a bit small and there was no closet for my luggage.  Other than that I would definitely come back and recommend to friends.

title: Weekend getaway
text: I spent the weekend here with a few friends from 1/29/16-1/31/16. We had an amazing time! This hotel is timeless with so much character! We had three rooms and each room was beautifully decorated with the most comfortable beds! The staff is beyond nice and helpful. There is a coffee shop in the lobby that is delicious! This hotel is in the center of the most exciting area in the city. Across the street you can walk the high line. If you wander left or right you will find yourself with tons of restaurant and bar choices. If you're looking for a hotel with a really cool vibe in the heart of Chelsea then this is a must stay! We can't wait for our next trip here!!

title: Perfection
text: Love this hotel and have stayed here at least 5 or 6 times since it opened.  Beautifully appointed rooms;  intimate homey lobby and public areas;  great location (across from, of course, the High Line) for food, art, shopping;  great coffee (Intelligentsia) bar;  and a staff that makes you feel welcome, whether new or returning.  We had not been there for at least 6 months, and yet the bellman, Alvin, greeted us with a warm smile and outstretched hand, welcoming us back.  Matthew, at the "front desk," was super friendly and efficient.  Perfect weekend stay.

title: Peaceful gracious comfortable absolutely wonderful
text: The Highline is my favorite hotel in NY.  I love staying in the old seminary housing--the rooms have old and beautiful wood moldings and windows, oriental area rugs on wood floors, and the rooms in the back overlook the garden.  The beds are phenomenally comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, the atmosphere is quiet and cozy. I love the Intelligentsia Coffee bar in the lobby area--great coffee and try the Turmeric Tonic Tea--and I also love the absence of a restaurant (there are wonderful restaurants right outside the door). You get a pass to a very high-end gym down the street that is much better than any hotel gym. Great location for getting anywhere. Spotlessly clean, lovely housekeeping staff. I was here for four nights in mid-January, and always stay here when I'm in NY.  Everything about the Highline is wonderful.

title: Consitently Great
text: Just had another enjoyable stay at The High Line Hotel in New York. Wonderful old world hotel with the aroma of Intelligentsia Coffee in the lobby. Perfect location for us in Chelsea. But it is really the staff that makes us return to what is now our first choice in the city. Daniel keeps things running in the lobby - and remembered us by name from our previous stay - and he is always ready to help in any way possible. This trip we also met Emily and Romeo who helped us with storing our luggage, getting a great room, and making sure we had a room for an extra night needed because of the snow storm that shut down the city.  Every hotel does these kinds of things - but the people at the High Line make the experience effortless and pleasant. Sometimes the rates get pricey - but always check because often the rates are really a bargain for such an outstanding hotel.

title: Snowed in weekend !
text:
Hotel feels more like being home with friends. Staff could not have been more helpful and inviting. 
Room was clean and cozy with fireplace . There is a great coffee lounge in lobby. The area around the hotel has many interesting restaurants and cool clubs to choose from . 
Will be back again !

title: Perfect for Mom and Daughter
text: Great location, amazing staff and just the right balance of elegance for Mom and hipness for me. This hotel has the friendliest staff, the most amazing rooms, and a world class coffee bar in the lobby. We stayed in December this time and had a great view out our window to the Christmas Tree outside. But I've also been in the summer and the Champagne bar out front is magnificent. Perfect in every way!

title: Elegant and hip
text: This hotel is so beautifully designed and appointed. Old world charm of a heritage building with modern and contemporary interiors. The rooms are very well appointed and the bed was perfection.  Walking into the cool lobby/cafe/bar on the morning we arrived smelling real and well made coffee was very welcoming indeed. The area is great with the High Line across the work and a short walk to the Whitney Museum, art galleries, Chelsea Markets, cafe, bars - you name it.  Loved every bit of our stay in New Year and will be back to the High Line Hotel.

title: Blizzard 2016
text:
I stayed here during this year's first blizzard and had an amazing stay. All of the staff were super friendly despite the inclement weather outside. It was the perfect place to experience cabin fever. In particular the concierge Matthew was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. 

My room was huge and I had a huge bathroom with windows. The decor of the room was super quaint. My room was clean. And best of all I had no issues with the free WiFi. 

I was able to get my morning coffee in the hotel lobby instead of trekking to Starbucks in the snow. Highly recommend!

title: Great Hotel with character and really great staff
text: I stayed here for 5 nights from 16th January 2016. The welcome was warm and the staff were super friendly and efficient. Special mention for Nathan  who could not do enough to help - either with restaurant bookings and everything involved in getting around NYC . Super lovely Tibetan doorman who always got me a cab. I loved the room and the cleanliness was top notch. I'l stay here again. Erica

title: Best of the Best
text: What a pleasant surprise and wonderful stay  on 10 ave and 20. Good location believe it or not. Hotel has maintained its old class style with simple but eloquent upgrades.  The staff is great , especially the dormmen , Tibet named Tenner? and the other bellman . All staff very nice and professional -mathew and Danny at front dest. Great coffee . Its a coffee scene with little dogs. I liked it. Will be back soon

title: Quick Stay
text:
We love staying at the High Line hotel.  It is an "nostalgic feeling" hotel.  The rooms are quaint and very clean.  It happens to be central to where we need to be, so it is a perfect location.
There is a great breakfast coffee bar in the lobby.

title: High Line Hotel employees and Catering service for the Webb/Matielli wedding 1/16/2016
text:
This was our first time staying at the hotel and totally fell in love with your beautiful hotel, but more importantly, your staff are top notch!!!  I have never met such accomodating and helpful staff before.  Please know that we have already recommended your hotel to several of our friends/family.  
The food catering  was exquisite for the Webb/Matielli wedding, 1/16/2016. NEVER have I been to a wedding where the food service was this perfect!!!  Please let them know how pleased we were and I truely hope you recommend this catering service to everyone!!  On a scale of 1-10 with 10 being the highest and best.....I would give the hotel a 10, it's staff, mostly the front desk staff, a 20 and the food catering service a 25!!!!!

title: Smart, elegant, original
text:
Spent 4 nights here in November with my husband. I loved this hotel, it has a great feel to it, as it's quirky, furnished in vintage but trendy furniture and decor, with fairly spacious rooms and comfy beds and plenty of lovely bathroom toiletries. Coffee shop on site is 'hipster' with great coffee but the result is that there's never any room to sit down and relax as it's open to outside guests and the area is simply too small, especially when it's too cold to sit in the beautiful courtyard. There is no reception as such which is also yeah, trendy but painful. You check in and out standing in front of someone with an ipad, with people walking past you and all. If you need to wait for a taxi, then again you have to share the space with trendinistas having loud conference calls all over, using the free wifi and drinking hipster coffee. Again, if you are a paying guest, would be good to have perhaps a separate area. One afternoon I waited for a coffee so long I gave up and went back to my room; the next afternoon it was so packed I went to the really nice coffee shop across the road. 
nevertheless I loved this hotel and would love to stay here again

title: Nowhere else I would rather stay
text:
From the moment we discovered The High Line Hotel online, there was nowhere else that we considered staying while in New York for the first time.  From the moment we arrived until the day we left we just kept falling further in love with the place.  The location is great – close to everything but far enough away to feel like you escape the busyness of New York.

The building itself is stunning.  The conversion into a hotel has been done extremely well with a lot of thought going into even the smallest of details – never have I stayed in a hotel where mouth-wash is one of the amenities provided and refreshed daily!  Our room was at the rear of the hotel and overlooked the courtyard there.  Spacious, light and extremely comfortable.  It really was a great place to come back to each day after a lot of exploring!

We were there for 13 nights and found every member of the team at The High Line Hotel to be brilliant.  Everyone was courteous, professional, welcoming and nothing was ever a problem.  A special mention to the Housekeeping team who do such a magnificent job keeping the rooms and the public areas so immaculate.  We were so impressed by everyone there!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The High Line Hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone going to New York.  The only thing that could possibly be improved on would be to arrange a charge-back facility with the bar and coffee shop businesses.  I know they are separate business from the hotel but can be set up very simply.  I include their teams in the above as they were all wonderful and happy to give advice as to what to see and do!

title: The Perfect Location For A NYC Hotel
text:
We decided to try this hotel and we couldn't be more thrilled.  Perfect location in the Chelsea area.  The Chelsea Market is around the corner.  Tons of places to eat as well as shop.  If the Market is too crowded for you there are other excellent eateries near-by.  Stella's Pizza on 9th Ave. is out of this world!!  The Cookshop is across the street and is fantastic.

The staff could not be more accommodating.  Very friendly.  We were given an upgraded room which was very nice and the bed was sooo comfortable.  

We will definitely stay here again.

title: NYC-Chelsea gem
text: This is altogether wonderful hotel. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel is stunning, full of cool vintage furniture and beautiful rugs, with lots of attention paid to details. The location is perfect, especially if you prefer the "local" side of New York to the touristy Times Square side. There are lots of great restaurants closeby. The Chelsea Market, full of food vendors and shops, is a treasure. And the High Line itself is amazing. You could spend a whole afternoon wandering around and taking in the views. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Home away from home
text: I would just like to say that I absolutely love love love staying with the Highline. I come about 6 times a year and now I have all my colleagues stay here to when they visit- you always go to every effort and in particular Alvin and Daniel are very accomodating. The staff know me by name and it makes me feel like I'm saying with friends and family.

title: Great stay
text: Cool hotel in Chelsea. Friendly, helpful staff. Neat decor. Upgraded our room without us even asking. Definitely will stay again on my next overnight in Chelsea. Also, great location. Tons of great restaurants and bars. Also, relaxing hotel bar.

title: Very unique European style hotel
text: This is a uniquely renovated property in Chelsea. I believe it is a former convent and the developers did a very nice job in maintaining the character of the property. The location is excellent for the lower west side. Walking distance to the Whitney museum, Cooktop and Del Posto restaurants. Depending on the time of year the rates can fluctuate a lot. Not unusual for NYC. But a room here can be $300 and then $500 a week or so later. Not sure if these rooms are worth $500+ but the location is excellent for the Meatpacking/Chelsea area.

title: Cozy and friendly
text: Excellent location. Enjoyed the cofee bar and an excellent restaurant across the street for breakfast. Attenton was very personal. Easy chek in and check out. Umbrellas available for everybody. Nice room.

title: Great stay in a lovely hotel
text:
I had the pleasure of staying here twice on business trips and had a lovely stay both times. 
The staff were great, very helpful, the hotel is beautiful and really well situated (looks out on to the High Line and close to great shopping in Chealse Market etc). There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel but lots of great places very close by.

title: I can only say good things about The High Line Hotel
text:
Our holiday/honeymoon didn't get off to the best starts due to our luggage arriving 2 days after us and our flight being 5 hours delayed. Matthew &Tidi were the first two to greet us and they were both brilliant in helping us with our predicament. We were made to feel welcomed and settled straight away. The following days Emily was also a big help with our luggage situation which I am pleased to say got resolved. All staff were very friendly in the hotel, but we made a bit more of a bond with the three mentioned. Throughout our two weeks stay we were given plenty of help and advice from everybody, nothing was to much trouble for them and we became very chatty with everyone. The hotel is excellent! very relaxing and we would say it felt like home. The dogs that are allowed to come in give it that homely feeling even more and the fact that a lot of locals use the coffee bar and evening drinks bar shows how good it is, considering the choices you have in NYC. We also became friendly with Mike that works behind the be in the evenings. A great guy that does a mean Manhattan! along with many other drinks/cocktails. I would very strongly recommend staying here for the perfect New York experience in trendy Chelsea. You can get to every tourist attraction if thats what you wish to do very easily via the subway only 3 blocks away. There are loads of choices for morning, afternoon and evening meals within a very short walk, and the famous chelsea market only 5 blocks away! I would go as far to say the best hotel I've stayed in (which has been a fair few) We will certainly return one day without a second thought. It has great character, unlike lots of the modern hotels in Manhattan and it actually has a history behind it.
You won't be disappointed staying here.

title: Deeply annoying - hipsters will love it.
text: Great location. Great staff. Comfortable bed. Huge bay window with a window seat would be perfect cozy spot to chill out and watch the world go by but...no comfy pillows and it is blocked by ugly and annoyingly placed "vintage" furniture that looks as if it came from a bankrupt Catskills motel. Every room I saw has the same vile and uncomfortable love seat on which no love could ever have been expressed. Wobbly and equally ugly wardrobe that might hold two hangers. Table crammed with vastly overpriced "artisanal" booze, kale chips, etc... Ragged threadbare vintage rug. Depressing fabric and color combinations. Small bathroom with classic white tile trimmed in black that I actually liked. Good bath products. Small lobby is jammed with annoying locals and their very annoying pampered pets as Intelligentsia Coffee bar in lobby allows pets. Take note - if you're hungover or impatient or both your cup of coffee will take forever 'cause hey it is Intelligentsia and they have zero sense of humor or urgency about their coffee... drip drip drip. Go to Joe's around the corner on 23rd at 9th - even with the walk you will get your coffee quicker. Summer and spring is better as you can sit in the actually very nice courtyard or out front and get a drink.

title: Intimate and comfortable
text: We thought the High Line hotel was charming and intimate.  Quite an oasis in this new "in" neighborhood which we are getting used to since our daughter lives in this Chelsea/Meat Packing district.  The rooms are very well stocked with amenities and refreshment options.   The weather was quite rainy during our stay and so we couldn't enjoy the outside area but it looks like a great place to enjoy breakfast or a drink in the afternoon.  All in all a lovely addition to this new happening area.

title: The Highline Hotel
text: I love the location.  It is close to where my brother lives, close to the high line, and Chelsea Market.  The beds are so comfortable and everything smells so good, even the fresh coffee that wafts up the stairwell from the main lobby. The staff is friendly and treat you like royalty.

title: Family Gathering for Christmas and New Years!
text: The hotel is beautiful, and its location- across the street from the High Line and a couple of blocks from Chelsea Market- is close enough to every place we wanted to go including the West Village, Canal Street, little Italy, SoHo.  My father needed a wheelchair a couple of times when we had a lot of walking to do, and the hotel supplied one when he needed it.  The staff is fantastic, especially Alvin (Thank you, Alvin!).  The rooms are clean, the shower is hot and has great water pressure, no long elevator wait.  The rooms have a lot of character and are comfortable.  The only thing that we didn't particularly like was the coffee bar, but that would NOT deter us from staying there again.  The High Line Hotel welcomes dogs- and they fit right in!

title: Family NYE
text: Our stay was excellent, friendly and knowledgable staff. My family loved the room with fabulous bedding and snacks! The high line park is directly across the street. Parking was convenient. The lobby was comfortable with a nice coffee bar.

title: Bonnie's Review
text: I really loved the staff at The High Line Hotel! The only problem was the unavailability of food and coffee. The Breakfast Bar was always crowded, and there were rarely seats. My walking ability is limited, so walking 2 blocks is tough. And the Cook Shop was mobbed always, or closed.

title: Great Stay-Charming Hotel
text: We LOVED staying at The High Line.  We had stopped in 2 years ago because it looked charming and enjoyed coffee in their lobby coffee shop so now we had the chance to stay.  Our room was on the top floor, each surface had interesting books, plants, other antique items. The room and especially the bathroom was very spacious compared to other New York City hotel rooms.  The lobby/front desk staff was welcoming to all -- especially the neighborhood guests and their pooches coming in to enjoy coffee and tea.  Will definitely come back as our stay was just for one night.  The location was convenient to both Broadway and Penn Station/Amtrak.  The neighborhood very fun with great restaurants and eateries.  Loved the walking/biking neighborhood map produced specifically for guests.

title: Vintage chic
text: Stayed for 5 days, amazing vintage items, comfy beds and big bath towels. Only downside is no closet or drawers but the cool vibe of staying in a castle in the city made up for it. Great coffee bar in lobby too!

title: Great spot
text: A quiet hotel of manageable size, good location. Nice neighborhood.  Room could have used better lighting. Less focus on selling snacks in the room. Nice lobby character and characters. Staff was a plus

title: Beauty and charm in a great location
text: I loved this hotel.  It is cool and chic and the opposite of the chain hotel experience. We had great service from the whole staff and the beds are INCREDIBLY comfortable.  There is no restaurant - just a coffee bar - but this neighborhood is stocked with great eateries, so it's not a problem.  My husband and I loved it and intend to return.

title: Best Honeymoon Decision
text:
Justin, our concierge at The High Line Hotel made our stay so special. When we mentioned it was our honeymoon, he upgraded our room to a suite and brought up a complementary bottle of red wine for us with a sweet note. Everything from the coffee bar on the ground floor up to the water pressure was luxurious. 
- We were able to find street parking quite easily (it was the day after Christmas so the city was quiet). 
- It would have been great to have room service for things like coffee but the mini bar was stocked really well.
- The staff was all very courteous and lovely. 
- The rooms had terrific lighting and the decor wasn't cheesy in the slightest. Plus, there was a fun antique letter embosser!

Overall, a wonderful stay.

title: Great stay !
text:
Amazing rooms !!..  Stayed 4 days back in Oct and enjoyed the hotel very much.

 There was no restaurant hence no room service and getting coffee in the morning downstairs could be a little hectic with the neighborhood folks stopping in with their dogs. When the truck outside is operational and the terrace in full summer bloom wouldn't think that would be an issue.

Nice size rooms, very comfortable, great decor, the overall architecture of the building is fantastic.  Super quick access to the High line itself, short walk down to the overly trendy meatpacking district, the new Whitney and the East river etc.  Certainly a best location if your gallery hopping.  

Would stay again in a heartbeat !

title: Unique boutique hotel
text:
I stayed here with my partner for a week as part of a 2 week summer holiday. We were warmly greeted on arrival and were swiftly checked in and taken to our room via an iPad wielding concierge. The room was not large but well decorated with several nice touches from the stationary to the art on the walls. 

We were very happy with the brilliant location near the Highline which made for beautiful summer evening walks. The staff were very friendly especially in the coffee bar in the lobby which made for enjoyable morning coffee. We also took advantage of the complimentary bicycles and had a lovely ride up the west side highway. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel for business travel or a short romantic city break. Leave the kids at home, read (or write) a book in the courtyard and explore the city from this great hotel. I would definitely stay again.

title: Unique property - a must-stay!
text: If you are looking for a luxe, boutique hotel experience in a great neighborhood, you will be very happy at the High Line! Comfort and service are at a maximum and the charm and character of this vintage building will be apparent the moment you step inside.  The staff will charm your pants off, too!  Every time I returned from an excursion I felt like I was returning home--the ultimate compliment!  Be sure to drink plenty of the wonderful coffee and custom cocktails and avail yourself of the beautiful grounds (and don't forget to stroll the High Line park, of course!).  I highly recommend this gem of a hotel!

title: Looking for comfort, charm, and quirkiness? Look no further.
text:
I spent four nights in December and combined a fun weekend with friends and business. The hotel worked well for both. As a traveller who stays in the usual 4 star chains for work, the Highline was a welcome change of pace. It has charm and style (spacious room, high ceilings, seating for friends, interesting books and artefacts) while still being functional. For example: Super comfie bed, &free and fast wifi. I liked all the dogs in the lobby and thought it helped everyone decompress. Watching dogs get treats is fun for everyone. The location is excellent as other reviews flag.

Also great were the staff. Everyone was friendly, relaxed, and helpful. Special shout out to Alvin who took excellent care of me. He got my work travel sorted, even staying after his shift to go the extra mile to get my stuff to me, and me to the airport. Can't say enough how that kind of personalized service with a smile stands out. Impressed!

 My one quibble is for anyone who needs a coffee to wake up (including my jetlagged self) having to get dressed and presentable before getting that first coffee from the (fun & friendly) lobby barista was painful. If coffee in bed is essential for you, bear this in mind. Next time I'll bring a bodum and kettle- but there will be a next time!

title: Boiling hot room !!
text: The property service and our combinations were fantastic. However, the air conditioning and heat system in the hotel made it very uncomfortable.   I would not go back to this hotel unless this was fixed.   I would not go back to this hotel unless  I could be assured this was rectified. I informed the staff on day one.  I informed the staff on day one and it was never rectified.  This is very unfortunate as it is a premium property in a fantastic part of the city.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
This hotel isn't for everyone - if you want new, pristine you should look elsewhere. That isn't to say that it isn't clean - it is, but it is old. So the rugs, the tile and the furniture are worn with character. You can tell that they were trying to stay within the bounds of the original space. The bed was new and wonderful - very comfortable. I loved the size of the room, which had a (worn) couch and writing table. I loved the little pieces that they had added, including an embosser, books and even an old fashioned phone. 

There is no restaurant in this hotel and no room service. They serve coffee and pastries in the morning and wine in the evening. It is a dog friendly hotel, which was fun for me, but might not be to everyone's liking. The staff were wonderful - there isn't an official front desk, instead you are greeted warmly in the small lobby and checked in on an i-pad. The mixture of the new and the old works well here.

title: Top Of the Class!
text: Stayed for five nights in November and cannot speak more highly about this hotel, which has a "boutique" feel about it.  Immaculate and very comfortably furnished rooms, each a little bit unique.  The most amazingly comfortable (and enormous!) bed.  Decor was very stylish and original.  Staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful.  There are no restaurant facilities, but there is a lovely bar/coffee shop in reception that also sells pastries, but this really isn't a problem in the Chelsea/Village area - it's overflowing with lovely bars, restaurants and diners within minutes' walk.  Hotel is immediately opposite one of the entrances to The Highline Walk and is within a five minute walk of the nearest subway station, which provides very easy access to the rest of Manhattan.  This place makes such a welcome change to some of the other very impersonal and overpriced hotels we've used in New York before and I won't hesitate to stay here again on our next visit.  Area is lovely and provides a welcome respite to the frenetic pace of New York life.  Basically, we loved it here!

title: Not up to par
text: It was average when I was expecting more. The concierge - Emily - was very helpful before we arrived. Check in was chaotic as there is no front desk per se. It also turned out there was no real restaurant. And the room was tiny and not that clean. There was no closet or bureau to put clothes do we used the floor. We were there over Thanksgiving, and I suspect a lot of the staff was grumpy about working or that I was traveling with a young child. Doormen mostly did not open the door. I would not recommend.

title: saving grace..
text: I'm not much for writing reviews so I'll be brief.. Was in New York at a friend's apartment when due to family emergency it became necessary to find a room nearby.  Not knowing the area well I walked into the Highline Hotel and was greeted by a tall guy, (I think his name was Danny but not sure) and he acted like we were old friends.  I told him my situation and he helped me find a room and get sorted within minutes. As the CEO of a mid-sized agency I appreciate when moments like these stand out and felt compelled to write a review.  So there.  And thanks..

title: Beautiful, Unique and Friendly Place
text: We had a wonderful weekend at the High Line.  Everyone there is so friendly and helpful.  The hotel itself is beautiful - we felt like we were staying with a hip relative - the decor is so cool, the coffee bar (turns to a real bar at night) is amazing, and with the Highline across the street, we felt like we were right in the middle of the happening part of the city.  The hotel has bikes for borrowing and we took a beautiful ride along the water down to Battery Park; it was such a fun perk.

title: Encore un excellent séjour!
text:
C'est de loin mon hôtel préféré à New-York, j'y reviens donc maintenant en priorité.
Les chambres sont superbes (literie très confortable, décoration soignée, parfaite propreté) l'ambiance est unique, le personnel est très sympathique et agréable. Pour la première fois j'ai testé la salle de gym accessible gratuitement à 3mn à pieds : elle est de haut niveau. Un détail qui n'en est pas un : le wifi marche parfaitement et ne nécessite pas de se reconnecter, c'est agréable. Je reviendrai en janvier à New-York, et forcément au High Line!

title: Great Staff
text:
The staff is what makes this hotel such a pleasure.

We stayed over Thanksgiving holiday. And we appreciated the enthusiasm and professionalism of every hotel staff member we came into contact with. 

Management, please take care of your staff as they are important to the well being of your establishment.

Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Thanksgiving visit
text: The High Line Hotel is a fabulous boutique hotel right in the heart of the city.  My husband and I spent the Thanksgiving Holiday with our son in NYC.  Typically we select a chain property, not any longer!  The staff and service were impeccable!  The room was clean, very comfortable and afforded us many treats from the luxurious robes to an out of the ordinary high quality mini bar.  Even the hair dryer was of high quality, not often found in hotels.  We had an exceptional time and oh my you must have a taste of the coffee, well worth the visit.  This will be our go to hotel when we visit the city in the future.  I don't often look forward to hotel stays; on the contrary, I can't wait until our next visit.

title: Great place to HQ the weekend!!
text: Plenty of restaurants and bars in the neighborhood, including at the hotel.  Great coffee in the morning and great staff, especially the folks who checked us in...very accomodating!!  Its a bit like staying in a museum and actually the entire block is similar.

title: if you like dogs, you'll like the High Line Hotel
text:
We were fully prepared for the fact that the High Line was quirky, hip and does not have a restaurant. However we weren't prepared for an inefficient hotel and the coffee/bar area being full of the locals and their dogs.

Fancy a quiet place to sit for your morning coffee?  Forget it unless you want to sit with the locals (clearly here for the free wifi which means they hog the seats for hours) and their numerous dogs.

Would you like your coffee served with a smile? Forget it, the Intelligentsia staff clearly think that is a step too far.

Butter with your croissant/scone? No chance - it comes dry and as displayed with no extras and a wooden throwaway knife to boot.

Fancy a cocktail in the bar which looks so lovely on the website? Forget it unless you want to be surrounded by friends of the staff and you want to stand up to enjoy your drink.

Comfortable hotel room?  If you like antique furniture, crooked tables that rock when you lean on them and sofas you can't sit on - no problem. And an air conditioning unit that is so noisy you can't have a conversation while it is on and is ineffective anyway so no point turning it on.

Comfy bed?  Yes absolutely  - that was the only saving grace of our stay here.

Friendly reception staff? Definitely friendly,  only they weren't very efficient - they forgot to book our restaurant twice, didn't send our laundry off so it took 2 days to come back and got our bill wrong with a significant overcharge which took us a week to get back - without much of an apology.

Location - brilliant with great restaurants nearby and The High Line park.

title: This hotel has some problems
text: This is a unique hotel with a charm of its own. You know when booking that you're in for something different and there are some real pluses to High Line: best coffee I've ever had outside New Zealand; cute hipster lobby, dogs welcome; really great location in Chelsea; pretty patio which must be fun in summer.  But this hotel has some problems that you should consider when booking.  First thing, my room while very quaint, was tiny and had no wardrobe or drawers and nowhere to put a medium sized suitcase.  Secondly, the check in system is chaotic. This hotel hasn't adjusted its processes for volume and the lobby doubles as the neighborhood coffee shop so is busy and confusing.  Third, this is a very old building with some old building problems - on my checkout day the hot water was out in the whole hotel so no showers for anyone. Also the heating and aircon is very antiquated so is also problematic.  All of these problems however (apart from the water - that's a red line for me) would have been minor irritations if the hotel was priced as a two or three star.  But with room prices equivalent to a Sofitel you do leave feeling cheesed off.  I think on balance the unique charm of this hotel doesn't outweigh its problems, at least not at that price.

title: Don't let the hipsters scare you away!
text:
The High Line hotel is hip and quirky. The lobby is a coffee shop, Intelligensia, arrayed with antique typewriters, oil cans and well-used paintbrushes on the wall. I guess that some people would think that very weird. I loved it! The front desk person just stands around near the entrance with an iPad and checks you in. There is no valet parking. After an initial kerfluffle, my husband calmed down and parked our car less than a block away.
Our room was charming and comfortable with a nicely worn oriental rug and several vintage pieces of furniture. We love the old books, bones and other wacky accessories that really moved the décor into a new zone. The bathroom is simply but stylish, clean and easy to use.
There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are many just a few steps away. The Chelsea location is great for gallery-hopping and checking out the new Whitney. Don’t let the hipsters scare you away!

title: Unusual and interesting
text: We spent a couple of nights there in October. It's an interesting old building - a former Episcopalian seminary, I believe, with twisty corridors and rooms tucked away in odd corners. The welcome we received was very warm, the room was well-appointed, and we really liked the system of being able to borrow the hotel bikes: there is a lovely cycle-run down the Hudson towards Battery Park, which we did as the sun was setting. Amazing! The reception and the welcoming staff were very helpful and friendly - one could not have asked for for - but we did find the staff behind the bar slightly off-hand and one of them serving breakfast was, if not exactly rude, let us say the least polite we came across during our trip to the USA. Perhaps he was having a bad day. The hotel is in a lovely part of town, next to the High Line. It has lovely courtyards front and back for al fresco refreshments and there are some good cafés and restaurants just along the street.

title: What a Lovely Hotel - Don't Wake Up Early
text:
The room was gorgeous; the bed big; the sheets luscious. And the little living room nook was inviting and comforting. Just a lovely stay. 

But the downstairs was a bit harsh: the lobby resembles a railroad apartment. Short and just a pass through. No feng shui consultant was brought in here. 

That's okay. We didn't want to hang. They've done away with a check-in counter: instead, it's just a small table with an iPad and a Square setup. If there were more enthusiasm from the staff, it'd have worked. 

In the morning, my wife walked downstairs to get coffee at 6:30 AM. Even though they were in the middle of making the coffee, they said they weren't open until 7 AM. She could walk to the Starbucks one or even two blocks away, said the barista, with a smug look on her face. "Hi, here's a cup to tide you over til we get fully setup" is what you want to hear from Alexandria, not "go to Starbucks." I mean, the Intelligentsia logo is everywhere. Wouldn't you think they'd want their staff to further their good name?

In any case, we did like it and would go back. But maybe not have coffee there.

title: Four night stay at the High Line
text: There was a good welcome at the hotel and the room was clean and comfortable with hotel style decor. This is not a modern, run of the mill, chain hotel and not for those wanting every amenity but is slightly quirky, full of character and popular with locals. Why, because it serves great coffee, is dog friendly and staff are helpful. There is no restaurant but places to eat are very close with great choice. The outside seating area is great and there is overall a really good ambience and feel to the place. I loved it!

title: AMAZING TRIP TO HIGH LINE HOTEL!!!!
text:
My partner and I have recently returned from our 2nd trip to The Highline Hotel.  I have to say the hotel and service provided by the staff only gets better.

I fully understand different travelers have different expectations but mine were fully met and can't wait to go back!!

I would especially like to thank Nicolas, Daniel and Alvin for all the help and advice the gave during our stay.

title: High Line is trendy and fun; but lacks amenities
text: The Highline hotel is definitely a fabulous place during the summer for drinks on their front courtyard or back patio ... But not the greatest as far as room accommodation and amenities. The staff is great-young and very very friendly and efficient --and the coffee bar/cocktail bar after 6 PM is also a fun hangout and well staffed.  However,  I was pretty taken aback when I walked into the "lobby" and found it to be a small room with a podium and a staff member with an iPad… but with a super cute coffee bar.   Another person checking in asked me where the lobby was, and I surprised them when I told them that "this is it."  There is no restaurant, and therefore no room service…and no wait staff after 6 PM for cocktails... You simply order your drinks at the bar and take them back to your table.  The biggest problem for us was the lack of air conditioning… As it is a refurbished seminary -  there is no temperature adjustment in the rooms. There are just two dials… One for warmer air and one for cooler air… We could never get the cooler air to work… Only warm air would come out of the vent.  Fortunately, the hotel has windows that actually open so we were able to sleep with the windows open at night to keep the room cool. At checkout, I mentioned it to one of the staff members and he said that during the fall/winter -- only warm air is available in the rooms. Fortunately, the hotel is in a quieter section of Manhattan so the noise level wasn't bad; and I stayed there in October when the evening outside temperature is not too warm or too cold. But for the price you pay for accommodations there… guests should have access to some sort of air conditioning.  I have stayed at other similar hotels-- the Bowery, the Marlton, the Nomad and Ludlow...and found that they offer more amenities (although the Ludlow did not have a restaurant attached either).   Overall, it was a pleasant stay in that it's in a great neighborhood, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the room was a decent size for NYC.  My daughter (who lives in Manhattan and moved into the hotel with me during my stay) and I would recommend staying there during the summer as they have bicycles for loan and the fun front courtyard and patio in the back for drinks...(but you might have trouble keeping the room cool). Bottom line, they really need to do something about their air/heating system.

title: Horrible service, tired rooms. zero amenities
text:
I frequently travel to NYC, and recently stayed at the high line hotel.  It tries to pass itself off as a unique, comfortable option in a neighborhood (west chelsea) that is becoming increasingly over crowded, with most other hotels catering to the party crowd (high line, dream).  However true this may be - it certainly *is* an option - it is a poor one.  In fact, I am very surprised to see the glowing reviews on tripadvisor - actually makes me suspicious given my experience here, and the fact I rely on this site for unbiased feedback on travel options.  

First, arrival is confusing and rushed - you find yourself competing for attention from a receptionist walking around armed with nothing more than an ipad, among crowds gathered in the lobby coffee bar.  The lobby is tiny, and multi-purpose ... which also contributes to extreme frustration - the last thing any of us want to do after a long journey is arrive in a confusing, tiny lobby, and search for a receptionist.  

After a terrible check in experience, I was led to the room, a "high line suite" (not a suite at all), bordering a playground serving a nearby school... cute but really noisy.  And while the furnishings attempt to be retro chic, they are just retro retro - AKA tired, including a very uncomfortable bed.  This bed, and the fact that somehow in the conversion from former monastery to hotel they managed to make the walls paper thin, contributed to one of the worst stays I've had in NYC.  

Nothing much else to report other than there's no room service, one day our room wasn't even cleaned, and in general I have no idea why I would ever be motivated to stay here again.  On top of the crowded lobby, poor service, bad furnishings, and uncomfortable bed (even lack of room service), I learned that most of the hotel business is via overflow from conferences that attend the nearby Javitz Center, so clearly no motivation to improve here.

The standard, the new edition, or even the dream are far better options. Stay away!

title: Hogwarts Realness in the Heart of West Chelsea
text: We recently stayed at The High Line Hotel for 9 nights while our NYC home was being renovated. We were drawn to the hotel because of its fantastic location and because they are pet friendly. Our stay was pleasant from beginning to end. Emily and Justin secured us a spacious room on the 5th floor. Willie and the housekeeping team were very attentive and were careful not to disrupt our pets. The lobby and courtyard is very cute, with excellent coffee; obviously a popular spot for locals too. While the air conditioning in our room was't perfect, and the room could be a little noisy at times, we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The complimentary Equinox Membership was a BIG PLUS too. We will certainly be back and can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. Cheers.

title: Great location, friendly crew
text: We were welcomed by a very accomodating pair upon check in and were continuously impressed with the level of service throughout our stay.  Our guest room was very comfortable-- particularly the bed.  There were some cool and unique antiques throughout the hotel and guest rooms.  The lobby area is a bit cramped, particularly with any hint of inclement weather, but there isn't much to do about that given the nature of the space.

title: A Gem in Chelsea!!
text: My husband and I stayed here last weekend to celebrate his birthday. This hotel was an old monastery..it has so much character! The bed is divine and the room is small but comfy. We loved watching all the dogs visit the lobby with their owners getting coffee in the mornings. And the coffee bar turns into a bar in the evening which we enjoyed as well! Good whiskeys!

title: 5th floor room full of character
text: Everything from check in to check out was perfect. You hold the solution to unhappy guests, a manager in a bow tie as cute as Justin welcoming you into the hotel. Such a sweetheart. The equinox was a nice extra and i had a great work out there. My room was interesting, I was on the 5th floor and it was as if I was in my grandmothers attic, I really appreciated the character. I was also excited about the coffee shop being right in the lobby, didn't have to go far for a good coffee. It was insane to come down and see nearly 100 people walking through the lobby though, the staff said it was for a wedding. Emily was such a gem helping me find places to eat. The staff is the best part of the hotel.

title: Night at the Hi Line Hotel
text:
We had a great one night stay at the Hi Line Hotel.....From our registration to our exit, it was excellent.  A charming setting inside and out.  The rooms are large and spacious and the beds are ultra comfortable.
We like the location in the Chelsea area.

title: Hip Hotel
text: My husband is attending a conference being held at this fun, funky hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a charming young man,Justin, who shared information about our stay and checked is in to this unconventional property. With our stay we have full access to the 'mind blowing' gym Equinox a few blocks away as well as free acces to the lovely bikes out front with bike maps and helmets provided by the hotel. The rooms are not large but we'll appointed and with comfy beds. Nice high ceiling gives a sense of space to an otherwise smaller room. We have a corner room,29, which has lovely windows facing the front of the building. If you are sensitive to street noise you should request a room facing their courtyard. Full disclosure...my husband and I raise the average age at this hotel as their target market is likely millenials. We are more Ritz Carlton on Central Park folks. With that being said, I'm finding the quirky charm of this hotel and it's wonderful Chelsea address a lot of fun for a few nights!

title: なぜかあまり好きになれなかったホテル
text: 最初に案内された部屋に変な匂いがこもっていて、またビジネスホテルみたいな感じでまったく値段にみあっていませんでした。匂いの問題を伝えたらすぐ変更してくれたので対応はよく、ただ、新しいお部屋もあまり居心地がいいという感じではなくて、くつろげませんでした。スタッフが若すぎる感じで、値段に見合わない印象です。このエリアは大好きなのですが、このホテルにはもう泊まらないと思います。

title: Fabulously Old Hotel...Must Stay!
text:
Michael, at the front desk, was very helpful.  He was very informative and supportive through all my little naggy questions.I did not know that when you stay at the hotel you also get access in the near by Equinox Gym, which is amazing! I was able to still work out and not feel bad about pigging out in all the tasty restaurant in NYC.

The Hotel in general is beautiful.  All the rooms are so homie and beautifully designed.  It was really a great hotel with a perfect location.

I LOVVVVVED IT!

title: Charming stay at the High Line Hotel
text: I enjoyed the feel of this hotel.  Being from the West Coast and terrified of NY except for what I see in the movies or on Sex and the City, this hotel stay charmed me into truly enjoying my NY experience.  I felt like Carrie Bradshaw because my room was HUGE and bright (room #17). (note: some are much smaller, but I lucked out!).  It was ground level so I kept my curtains drawn at night but it ended up being very cool; I felt like I was living in my own NY apartment in the Chelsea area.  Working from my desk one morning with the curtains wide open gave me a NY City rush as I typed away on my laptop and sipped coffee I had fetched from the hotel's very trendy coffee truck.  The experience was charming and I recommend that you stay at the High Line Hotel.  I wish I could have extended thru the weekend so I could have enjoyed tooling around the neighborhood and enjoying the Chelsea Market.  Overall, an A+ experience !

title: Great cozy place
text: So much enjoyed staying at this beautiful hotel. Gorgeous old building and pretty, comfy rooms. The Chelsea neighborhood is very charming and fun to walk around. Also good walking to Soho and other adjacent areas. Right next to the High Line Park and Chelsea Market- wonderful places. If you are used to staying uptown you will enjoy this quieter, but still quite vibrant part of the city. Back to hotel- nicest staff ever! Clean room and large bathroom especially for a NY hotel.

title: We really wanted to like the High Line Hotel more.
text:
We really wanted to like the High Line Hotel more. 
The hotel occupies a beautiful old building & is right next to the High Line. There is a lovely outdoor space where you can sit and enjoy yourself (but only when the weather is warm). We visited on a cool weekend so this space wasn't very appealing.
Unfortunately, there is no lobby, only a small common space which is completely occupied by Intelligentsia Coffee. Since the rooms are small and cramped, this means there is nowhere to sit when the weather isn't accommodating and we felt like imposters in the hotel lobby because the lobby was full of neighborhood people getting a drink & making themselves comfortable which meant that there was frequently not enough place for us to sit & relax.
Our room was clean and attractive but cramped for 2 people. That is probably expected in NYC although the price is so high that one might reasonably expect a slightly bigger room. Unfortunately, the room was also uncomfortably warm. We visited on a cool October weekend but the room was stiflingly hot. Despite opening the windows, we could not cool the room. The air conditioning was not working either, it put out hot air which worsened the situation.
The bed was very comfortable & the shower was great. The products that were provided were very nice. Housekeeping did a nice job of cleaning although one of our complementary robes was a bit dirty.
I don't think I would go back to stay there but I would definitely go back to enjoy the outdoor space with an Intelligentsia latte on a nice day.

title: Review of Highline Hotel
text: Although the hotel is well located and my room was a good size with adequate wardrobe and shelves for clothes, no room service or 24 hour restaurant was a weakness. For a 7 day stay it is inadequate and disappointing.

title: Great Location in Chelsea/High Line Area
text: We had to be within walking distance of Chelsea Piers and chose The High Line Hotel.  Staff was very friendly and accomodating.  Room was very nice, updated and comfortable.  Rates were a little on the high side, but I guess this is what's usual for Manhattant hotels.  Would definitely recommend this place.

title: A fabulous and seriously cool but welcoming place to stay in Chelsea
text: A great location - just across the road from the High Line walk and a hop skip and a jump from the Chelsea Market and Whitney Museum.  Friendly and welcoming staff who provided complimentary drinks due to a slight delay in availability of the booked room.  Various places to hang out - a great courtyard bar as well as a quiet (but busy) rear garden area.

title: Destination Wedding
text:
The High Line Hotel is an amazing venue for a wedding and the reason for my being there.  The hotel is an old seminary with a fabulous Gothic church across a courtyard.  The wedding guests could not only stay at this fabulously fun hotel with its very eclectic furnishing, but wander to the church as well.
Then there was the splendid Gothic dining hall also attached to the hotel which was like walking into another life.  The service and food was excellent and probably the bride did the most elaborate decorations filled with flowers and lit candles on these long trestle tables.

title: Heel lawaaierig
text: Een authentiek hotel in een voormalig seminarie. Mooie maar prijzige kamers van meer dan $ 500. Wij knapten af op de beperkte service (geen ontbijt, beperkte bar, geen restaurant, enzovoort) en vooral op de erbarmelijke geluidsisolatie van de kamers zodanig dat elke nacht het geluid van de toch wel drukke 10th avenue de slaap ernstig verstoorde. Al was het personeel best wel vriendelijk, toch is de prijs-kwaliteitverhouding van dit hotel absoluut niet correct.

title: Quirky little gem
text: My daughter just moved to Chelsea and booked us a night here and at first we were not impressed it seemed a little too cool for us, then our room was noisy, on the street and small, we asked to move but were told by the young lady they were sold out and can't move us, we booked the reservation in July and that wasn't acceptable. My husband went downstairs to see if he can talk to a manager,  after some magic on the iPad he agreed to move us higher in the courtyard. The new room was just great, quiet, and it felt like we weren't even in New York. The staff is such a delight and the manager was a rare kind of sweet, the kind you don't find anymore. My daughter already booked us a room for December. Nice save high line.

title: Fabulous hotel in the heart of West Chelsea
text: I stay at the High Line once a month while I am in New York for work. The rooms are so chic and stylish, beds are extremely comfortable and the amiable staff makes for a terrific stay. It's my home away from home in NYC!

title: Interesting historic place to stay
text: Very welcoming staff who efficiently check you in with iPads - no front desk and if you need to wait, you can plop down into a comfy couch in the lovely lobby. You can also can great Intelligentsia coffee there too - and a cocktail at night. The hotel was a seminary and still has many of the charming, historic details. Rooms are a nice size with cozy couches and super-comfy beds. And a hotel rarity -snowy-white, fluffy towels!! Clean, relaxing, quiet ...just a lovely, cool spot.

title: little gem in the city
text: How to begin? Fantastic location, beautiful hotel, great room, friendly staff and super pet friendly! Originally stayed for two nights but we loved it so much that we extended our stay for another night. Although the hotel lobby can get a little chaos with long line at the Intelligentsia Coffee shop. But everyone is so cool, relax and many of them bring their dogs which make our dog’s favorite place to chill and to be loved. The location couldn’t be any better, right next to the High Line and a short walk to Chelea Market. Our room is huge for New York’s standard. The staffs always greet us with smile and have a treats ready for our dog. The High Line Hotel is a little gem that hard to fine in a big city.

title: Hipster paradise.
text:
The bar closes at 10:30. Not restaurant. Dark and small bathroom. Noisy. No extractor in the bathroom. Poor room service. No reposition of amenities or bathrobe. 
A lot to learn to run this hotel. Not service at all. There are better places to go.
Good mattress.

title: Exceptional Stay and Always a Great Experience
text: Friendly service, extremly well appointed room with all the modern comforts, best bed in the world yet it feels like home, like the interior belongs to this majestic building. Attentive to details, with great coffee and pastries in the morning to start your day on the right foot. Truly a home away  from home while in the big Apple.

title: Great Experience
text: I had a great experience at The High Line Hotel.  I travel to New York quite often and was very appreciative of the thought, uniqueness, and creativity behind the hotel - truly one of a kind.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the outdoor restaurant was fantastic (try the frozen negroni), the amenities were great (free bike rides on Shinola bikes, Intelligentsia coffee in the lobby), and the staff was gracious and friendly. I'll be back.

title: Great Location, terrible service
