text: I know New York really well as I split my time between London and New York and was truly disappointed with my stay at the High line. My Partner and I had booked in for 10 nights at the end of a long stay in city and really did have high hopes for the hotel. The stay started off well, fast check in and the room was beautiful but on the ground floor facing the courtyard cafe at the back and the street on the side, so super noisy we asked to move but unfortunately they were fully booked but would be back in touch the following day, they did not get back to us. The bathroom was not properly cleaned with mildew in the shower, no toiletries and weird red stains on the shelf above the sink. House keeping did not come until 3 days later when we asked them to come, then on the 4th day after being out all day we come back to find house keeping had not come again despite putting the cleaning sign on the door which had been removed and replaced back in the room but without actually cleaning the room. I went to speak to the concierge staff who said they would alert house keeping, i had asked for clean towels so we could shower, 2 hours later no sign of anyone. I went back out to speak to concierge who again told me they would alert house keeping. After returning back after dinner we find a coupon for a free coffee as some sort of apology... The next 2 days were pretty much the same, no cleaning unless we chased, no products in the bathroom, the red stains still on the shelf the whole time but strangely had house keeping coming early to check the mini bar only. The location is great and the rooms are big, but the service is absolutely terrible, we tried to move hotels after 1 night but couldn't find anywhere at such late notice for such a length of time. The staff are very polite but utterly unhelpful. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

title: Great staff, great location
text: Great experience at a beautiful hotel. In town for a trade show at the Javits Center, so I grabbed a coffee at Intelligentsia in the lobby each morning and "commuted" via a lovely walk up the High Line. Rooms are terrific, and despite lots of historic charm, hotel is well-equipped for business travelers. Staff is very friendly and eager to please, with great attention to detail. Eager to return to the High Line Hotel.

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
I know very well nyc as I lived there for 4 years and have been in many hotels, more than I could remember.
My last stay at The high Line was one of kind, the staff paid attention to every details and catered all my needs. The room I was is was spacious, full of light and designed with the same style as that of Sohohouse, which I appreciate very much... but for half the price.
THANKS!

title: Four nights in New York
text: The High Line is in the perfect location for exploring the lower west side of Manhattan, where there is lots happening on the urban regeneration front. The rooms are characterful and extremely comfortable, best bed of our 3 week travels. The hotel has an understated reception, more like a cafe in a grand living room which is very nice to return 'home' to. Great staff and atmosphere.

title: Feels like home
text:
Spacious rooms- fabulous natural light-wonderful bedding & towels.  Feels like you are in an apartment!
Beautiful patio's for a.m. coffee or evening drinks.  Warm and friendly staff.
Hating leaving! loved it!

title: Unique and
text: Rooms very much in keeping with old world building: period furnishings, but good light, excellent bathrooms, funky phones (with world service!!), central location for food and fun near High Line Park which is the Best. Love quiet grounds at rear of hotel, and would have taken out the Shinola bike if I had time...next time....summer garden restaurant always full....

title: Nice people, nice location, but low service, and rooms to street much too noisy .
text: Avoid room no 41 and all the other rooms towards the 10 Ave. Windows don't close properly and the heavy traffic starts at 6am. It is not a Hotel, more an expensive bed and Coffeshop. Nice decoration, smart employees, but no restaurant, no breakfast, no real lobby, weak bar. Location is perfect. Atmosphere is good if your are a hipster.

title: Adorable Hotel
text:
My husband and I just stayed five wonderful nights at The Highline Hotel. The hotel is adorable & the staff was amazing!  Very friendly, helpful and always addressed us by name. The hotel is in a great location. Just steps from the Highline & Chelsea's Market
We enjoyed our stay so much that we are already planning a return trip to NYC and we will definitely be staying at this hotel.

title: worth It
text:
Front staff very accommodating, professional and interested in getting us what we needed. Everyone made us feel welcomed. Beds are very comfortable. Close to the High Line Park and walking distance to midtown shopping 

The restaurant is associated but not part of hotel. Difficult to get in no priority to hotel guests and no reservations. But once you're in great food, service and ambiance. 

Room doors slam difficult to control. Annoying from other rooms otherwise very quiet.

title: Loved it!
text: Very friendly, helpful staff, great location and our room was awesome!  Loved the coffee barristers that changed into a wine bar in the evening.  Great courtyard outside in the back and front area with wine bar as well.

title: Loved the High Line
text: Convenient to a wonderful neighborhood. Clean and staffed by very helpful and considerate individuals. Strongly recommend taking the complimentary bikes on a ride along the Hudson down to Battery Park for a sense of NYC we did not previously know existed.

title: Large Rooms and Great Neighborhood
text: Once a year I get together with three college friends at The High Line Hotel.  We chose this hotel because of the really large rooms (especially by Manhattan standards) and large bathrooms that very comfortably accomodate two non-related people.  The staff is very friendly and efficient, the rooms are full of character, the location can't be beat for enjoying the High Line, the Whitney and all of the fabulous restaurants and night life in the area.  We will be back again next summer if not sooner.  Great hotel, excellent staff.

title: Great stay at The High Line
text: We got married at Chelsea Piers and stayed at the High Line for our wedding night. When the staff found out it was our wedding they upgraded us to a suite. Beautiful room, attentive staff, great historic detail throughout the hotel.  We would highly recommend the High Line for friends or family visiting the city.

title: Great location, wonderful hotel.
text: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the High Line Hotel for one night in August, 2015. We had a great experience there -- the location is wonderful, close to the High Line Park, which was a treat, and in walking distance of a number of enjoyable restaurants and bars. Our room looked out on the open courtyard at the front of the hotel,  so we expected the room to be loud late into the evening, but that was not the case at all. The bed was incredibly comfortable, great shower, and included robes and slippers, which were a nice touch. I loved that the desk had a built in embosser to mark stationary with -- it had an old-fashioned feel which really added to the ambiance. We loved the complimentary bikes, and biked down to Battery Park. Great experience -- thanks!

title: Best place ever
text: I LOVED staying here!! We arrived sat eve. 8/15 and left 8/19.  The staff was amazing!!  They were so kind and helpful...but the big thing was EVERYONE was happy!  That is amazing!  An entire staff being happy and making sure we were too!  I have already  shown your online pics to 4 people !!  Awesome !!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We arrived at this hotel at 6:30 on a warm summer evening. A young man at the entrance came out to welcome us and bring our bags in from the taxi. The lush, tree-lined courtyard had twinkling lights and comfortable tables and a soft breeze was coming in. We sat down and had a nice cold drink. What a wonderful way to end a long day of traveling. The room was cool and inviting and had a kind of funky elegance to it. Very clean with a well-stocked mini-bar. The bed was very comfortable. The location of this hotel is excellent—the high line just a 1/2 block away and many other amenities close by. Great espresso greets you in the morning before you start your day. I will definitely come here again.

title: Enchanting
text:
The High Line hotel is like a visit at a cool friend's country home, but in an amazing neighborhood of New York. It is not for guests who expect "cookie-cutter" sameness, but for those who want dedicated,personalized service, historic surroundings and real comfort.

Entering the hotel to the warm greeting of the staff is like leaving the city for a tranquil country escape.

We stayed at the hotel last winter and returned this summer and it was even better. Our room was spacious and thoughtfully designed and we enjoyed coffee in the front and back gardens. We dined at Alta Linea twice and loved the food and the service.

Overall, a wonderful experience.

title: Unique Old Hotel
text:
We spent three days at this location and enjoyed the hotel. The location of this hotel is excellent, right across the street from the High Line Park. There are many places to eat in the area. However we had some issues with the hotel. The cold water tap in the bathroom sink was almost as hot as the hot water tap -- it never really cooled much even when left to run for a long time. The hotel automatically added a "contribution" to the High Line Association on my checkout bill without asking me or without giving me the option to opt in beforehand. I had to ask them to remove the charge when I discovered it in my review of the final bill. I think this practice is deceptive when charges like this are added without notice. 
Note also that many residents of this area of NYC own dogs and take them with them everywhere they go -- including in the High Line Hotel lobby, coffee shop and bar, in the hotel garden area, and in the hotel restaurant area. If you don't like dogs around you, you might look for another hotel that restricts dogs from their premises.

title: Service was top notch!
text:
I stayed at the High Line only one night, but it was exactly what the doctor ordered! The rooms was very comfortable, and filled with interesting furniture. There was almost nothing off-the-rack, or boring as far as decoration goes. The service was the best, I had flown in on a red-eye from the west coast and asked  when I arrived if they could accommodate an early check in. The host at the door, Danny, immediately set out to see if there were any rooms available with the hotel manager. They were able to let me check in early and the bed was heaven. Once I awoke, I grabbed  a coffee at the coffee stand in the lobby which was crafted with care. Just outside there are two public spaces. One, a courtyard in front, and a smaller, quieter patio in back. 

I would recommend the High Line Hotel without a second thought!

title: Excellent +
text: We loved the Place from the first minute. Boutique all over and an extra plus to the people that s been recruiting the staff, good job! Terrace, bar and coffeebus and the location is just great in Chelsea away from the crowds and Close to the Hudson River Walk/Run/Cycling.

title: A love affair that did not last....
text:
The High Line is one of the hotels where you think on first impression 'this is a great, I am in love' - Wonderful touches such as characterful rooms, replete with books, old style bathrooms, telephones and period furniture which harks back to the buildings former use as a seminary make the love happen. I particularly liked the reading list in my room #43, with a choice of the 'At the Court of Louis XIV' or 'Orchids for Mother' and 'A Long Desire' provided plenty of bedtime fodder. 

But, my love affair with the room quickly evaporated mainly because of the road noise, which was constant night and day, and the air conditioners, 2 for a smallish room which when operating generated 747 jet-engine like noise. The air con units looked as if they were purchased in the 1970s .... 

Beware ear plugs for the roadside rooms are essential. The bathroom's quaintness also waned because the water pressure was poor and shower pipe leaked. 

Overall, the hotel needs to do the following: (a) invest in triple glazing on the 10th Avenue side; (b) get more modern air conditioning units and (c) pay attention to the substance and not just the style. 

Despite this I would come back again to try and give love a second chance, but only in a courtyard facing room. The location is very good and the early morning running opportunities along the Hudson are not to be missed!

title: Stay at the High Line was TOO SHORT
text: I loved the High Line--and have been wanting to stay there since stopping for Intellegentsia Coffee 2 years ago. Finally got the chance last week. It started off great--and stayed that way. The gentleman who helped me out of the cab called ahead to have me checked in--while I was still waiting for the cab receipt. They had loaner bikes and helmets, which made running a quick errand so easy. The room was very sweet (my single disappointment was the too-soft bed). Free phone calls. In room speaker that wirelessly connects to your phone for music. Nice touches. I was so sad to have had to leave after less than 24 hours. I can't wait to go back.

title: Excellent boutique hotel in an old convent in the heart of the Chelsea art district
text: Excellent first time experience. Very friendly staff, nice terrace for drinks and food. The overall experience was just top. Excellent coffee also in the coffee bar at the lobby, probably one of the best of Manhattan. Will definitely come back.

title: A New Found Treasure in Chelsea
text: I've been coming to NYC since my parents brought me 40 years ago. I've had the opportunity to live in NYC for several years, however I return now for business mostly and pleasure a few times a year. I recently had the pleasure to experience the High Line Hotel this past week  What a treasure this is.  Not only is it hip, but the design of the rooms and the staff are absolutely amazing.  I had a great stay this week and I am so looking forward to my next visit to NYC and the chance to stay here. Staff are great - energized, professional and on top of it!

title: Great stay and fantastic service!
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here over the weekend, and it was a fantastic hotel!  The bed was very soft and I know people have said it is noisy, but we both slept great and didn't hear anything.  It is a really cool property and Paul at the front desk was amazing.  He was our goto for recommendations around us, and he helped us out with anything we could possibly need.  Thanks to Paul and everyone else, we will definitely be back!

title: So so much potential
text: Such a cool place with wonderful attention to detail throughout. The rooms are beautifully designed. While the furnishings were a bit old in style for my taste you have to respect the design. The rooms are also fairly large (at least the ones I've been in). If it were for the rooms alone this place would get 5/5 hands down. The exterior courtyard is well done. The interior one is pleasant as well although it's a bit plain as compared to others courtyards in the city. There are issues which to be fair I'm not sure are because of sub-par planning/layout or because the building is historical meaning certain things can't be adjusted. That being said they still exist. The primary one being noise. This is a noisy hotel, a bit is understood but the windows appear to be paper thin. I could hear everything outside. I was in the Thom Browne store on Hudson St (busy) in Tribeca that day and couldn't hear a peep. More importantly several of the rooms are right near the lobby. That is unquestionably a design mistake. These rooms should not be placed here and frankly to sell them at all is ridiculous. It's akin to having a room next to a bustling coffee shop. I would not stay here again for this reason alone. I gave it a 4 because in all other ways it's a very nice hotel, especially if you stay on the other floors.

title: Certainly one of the best places to stay in NY
text: Highline Hotel has been one of our best surprises of the year. Beautiful old building, beautiful large room and bathroom, warm hospitality. Perfect place just in front of the high line and the galleries district. A quiet garden (a garden in NY?!!!!). We felt at home, were sad to leave and thought we finally ended our 15 years search for our perfect hotel in NYC.

title: A rarity, an oddity
text:
I made my reservation at the High Line Hotel quickly, and assumed I was staying at The Standard High Line. Be warned that this is not that ultra-modern hotel perched above the High Line with views over the Hudson and up and down Manhattan Island. This is not that hotel. This is an old seminary, maybe 4 stories tall, about a half block from the High Line in the middle of Chelsea. 

But, my wife and I were game to try it after we realized our error. And I am happy to report that we had a fine time in this historic repurposed behemoth - it covers the block between two streets, almost!. It has a nice front courtyard, pleasant staff, a tiny lobby area with bar, and warm furnishings.

I read elsewhere that the rooms were small - au contraire! Our room was huge by NYC standards, perhaps because we asked for a room with two double beds. Spacious, comfortable, and a lack of street or lobby/bar noise even though we were only on the second floor. 

Now for the negatives - which were minor. The cold water tap and the hot water tap both gave only hot water. If you let it run for 15 minutes or so, the cold water tap gave water cool enough to shower in. How this could be, given that the staff must run the water whenever they clean the room was totally beyond me. And there is no room service. If you are a person for whom room service (even at the outlandish price you typically pay) is an important component of the hotel experience, skip the High Line Hotel. 

But it was a fine landing place for a combination business/pleasure trip for this over 50 couple making it back to Chelsea for some gallery hopping for a couple of days. And it is easy to find a cab and surprisingly close to the 23rd st 8th Ave subway, too.

title: Had a great time!
text:
I had a great time at The High Line Hotel. 

The staff were all lovely and welcoming. The room was a good size (it's New York, if you expect to ballroom dance in your room, you're outta luck). The hotel was very quiet and the bed was comfy. The coffee bar by day/ regular bar by night is a lovely touch.

The hotel was close to the train (23 and 8th) and there's a Citi bike share station  about 2 blocks away. But, most of the time I walked from Broadway theaters back to the hotel-it was easy and fun.

I would absolutely recommend The High Line Hotel.

title: Best hotel I have stayed at in New York!
text:
If you are looking for a relaxing atmosphere in a building full of character The High Line Hotel is a wonderful place to stay. All of the staff were knowledgeable and helpful, providing a great service that made my stay memorable and fuss-free.

The room that I stayed in was charming and very clean, which is something I am very particular about. The size of the room was perfect, although it did not have a wardrobe or drawers to store any clothes. The location of the hotel is also something I would recommend if you are looking for somewhere that is easy to get to, located in a cosmopolitan area full of boutique stores and bars/restaurants.

This was my third trip to New York and is by far my most preferred hotel so far. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others who are looking for something a little less corporate in terms of decor whilst maintaining a professional level of service and quality.

title: Great location with a lived in feel
text: This hotel was close to where I was working so it was very convenient for us.  I loved the old brick building and outdoor spaces. the interior seemed a bit too trendy. There was quite a scene outside at the bar we had to wait list to get drinks, that was irritating and we just walked away because the hostess was kinda rude.. The concierge was great. There is no food served at the hotel. The bathroom was sufficient and the room I was in was roomy enough, I guess for NY. I would stay here again if i was working in the neighborhood.

title: Our 3rd stay and the Highline Hotel keeps getting better!!
text: This was our 3rd stay at The Highline Hotel and each time we visit it gets better!  From the efficient and friendly check in to the helpfulness of the bellman taking us to our room the staff is obviously well trained.  The rooms are well appointed and each is a bit different...the beds are so comfortable and the bathrooms are a good size with great shower and bath amenities.  Love the Intelligentsia Coffee bar in the lobby and now they have a beautiful outdoor dining/bar area that is great.  The location was ideal for us as we could walk to great restaurants as well as Chelsea and Meatpacking Districts...will definitely return.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We have stayed at this hotel three times.  The history and architecture of the hotel is wonderful.  The rooms are cozy and clean, and staff are friendly and helpful.  There's an Intelligentsia Coffee bar on site.  The High Line Park is across the street.  I highly recommend The High Line Hotel.

title: One of the very best in NYC!!!
text:
From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted with a friendly, knowledgeable and professional staff. We enjoyed the ease of checking in and out and appreciated the bell person giving us an overview of how everything worked. 
Our room was extremely comfortable and relaxing! 
We enjoyed the outdoor courtyard, the staff helping us during an unexpected thunderstorm and the coffee that was brewed upon request!!!!
We will be back!

title: Better than I thought it would be!
text:
Excellent room and the Staff was the BEST!
      I found this room on hotels tonight and had not been there before, I had zero idea what I was getting myself into and was pleasantly surprised! I recommend this hotel and their wonderful patios to have coffee, wine or Italian Food at their resturant.

title: Very comfortable hotel
text: Small, but cozy, clean rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Great location. I highly recommend the Highline Hotel. Lovely architecture. My daughter and I and our French guests really enjoyed our two night stay.

title: A lovely hotel in a great part of New York
text:
The High Line hotel is a converted Theological Seminary located in Chelsea, an amazing, quiet and trendy area of Manhattan. The hotel is beautiful with loads of character. There is a busy coffee cart and seating area in the front courtyard, which converts into a relaxed bar in the evening. The decor is great with an eclectic mix of furniture and uber cool and very friendly staff. There is another cafe located in the lobby that also serves cocktails later in the evening.

The initial impression is of a sleek, funky hotel with a very friendly, relaxed vibe. The staff immediately engage you on entry and are very approachable.

My room was excellent. The furniture was in-line with the lobby of the hotel. A mix of modern, antiques, statement pieces and a wonderful bed. Similarly, the bathroom was beautifully appointed with amenities and remaining true to the overall eclectic style of the hotel, with antique fittings and great tiles. Overall, it felt very comfortable and relaxing from the outset.

The neighbourhood is delightful. The buildings are lovely. It is quiet but only a short walk into the heart of NYC. Additionally, the High Line park is around 50 metres away and is a brilliant way to see parts of the city.

I will hopefully be staying at this hotel again in September and don't hesitate to recommend it.

title: Charming, lovable hotel in a place I love
text:
Chelsea: My favorite place in New York. And this hotel is very nice. 

The rooms are fairly small (but not tiny) and very quaint, kind of like staying at your grandmother's place (assuming she had a place that was a converted Episcopalian seminary). 

Plus, free Shinola bikes, free wifi. 

I enjoyed this hotel. 

I only had a few (minor) issues: 

-Water pressure in the shower is atrocious. Very weak. 
-No early morning dining and evening dining ends at (I think) 9 pm outside. But hey, you're in Chelsea, great food is a block away. 
- Bathroom is a bit small, the challenge being "where do I put my toilet kit". Then again, I just put my toilet kit on the dresser outside and it was fine. 
- A lack of emergency amenities -- I ran out of dental floss, and most hotels have supplies for weary travelers. Not this hotel. No biggie, I took a walk down to the local CVS pharmacy a block away.

It is not a fully-staffed big hotel. It's a converted seminary that is being run as a boutique hotel. For example, there is no registration. It's very casual, a very nice lady signs you in on her ipad. Might be a bit confusing to some, but it's really okay. 

Staff is polite. Rooms are clean. Bed is reasonably comfortable. 

Overall, however, if I have to go to Chelsea again (and I do hope I do), this will be the hotel I will stay at. And certainly I'm thinking of a romantic weekend with my wife, eating delicious Chelsea food and biking around on the complimentary bikes. 

You get the picture.

title: Impressive Room
text: We stayed here for a week recently and I was impressed with the comfortable large ( for New York standards) room., superbly well stocked mini bar and additionals. Amazing comfy bed. Slightly pretentious outside cocktail bar. Well placed in Chelsea for high line, meatpacking and surrounding districts. Can be noisy from outside when the bar is open. Great, polite lobby staff very helpful. Stroppy too cool for school barista in lobby coffee bar. Bit of a well heeled hipster hangout. Across street from fantastic Cookshop for amazing breakfasts.

title: High line hotel fantastic!
text:
Always a winner and reasonably priced with excellent service and rooms. Location is perfect as well. Would come back no question.  Coffee bar in downstairs is some of the best coffee in NYC. 
      Thank you again

title: A different room would have made this a 5 star review
text: We were placed in a room right across from the coffee bar.  I immediately thought it could be a problem, but when I mentioned it to the staff, they said that was the last room they had and couldn't move us.  They also said that things quiet down after the coffee bar closes.  Guess what?  After the coffee bar closes, it becomes a cocktail bar.  Guess what else?  The noise level outside our room was absolutely shocking and even though we had ear plugs, neither of us got much sleep until the bar quieted down, which I believe was around 3 or 4am.  Guess what else?  The coffee bar then opens at 6am.  My advice for this hotel is: do not stay in the rooms across from the coffee/cocktail bar.  The manager told us they could comp us, but never did.  What a pity too, because the hotel is gorgeous -- well-appointed rooms, beautiful architecture, fantastic service from the front desk.  Just zero sleep that night.  And after reading some of the other reviews about this issue, I noticed that someone from the management staff replies to each one saying they have fixed the noise issue, but they really haven't because people were complaining about this exactly issue in 2012.  I just wish I'd read those reviews before booking a room at this hotel.

title: Fantastic location, enormous and atmospheric rooms, beautifully decorated, quiet, good service
text: Our room was on the first floor right behind the outdoor bar, and we never heard a thing - either traffic noises or any noise from the bar. I've stayed in many different NYC hotels in the past, and this was the biggest hotel room I have ever seen. And the room was thoughtfully decorated with beautiful rugs on wooden floors, a fantastic bathroom that had been renovated keeping the style and period of the building in mind. All in all an absolutely fantastic room. The bed was a little on the soft side, but otherwise, no complaints. The lobby was wonderful, and the service staff were welcoming and helpful. The location in a seminary adds to the quirkiness of the hotel. There is also a very nice back courtyard and seating area  - a quiet haven. The highline is steps away, as are many nice restaurants and stores. All in all, absolutely fantastic for a couples trip. The Whitney museum is walking distance, as is the riverfront - great place to run in the morning. The highline itself is overrated - only go early in the morning as otherwise you will be stuck behind zombie tourists.

title: Great location, historic building, Hipster Heaven
text: Although situated in a fun part of town in an historic building with great antique decor and furnishings, be prepared for Hipster H3ll. it's a 50 minute wait to sit at the bar (where service is terrible anyway and prices even high for upscale NYC). Our room, which was very large and beautiful, smelled like a guinea pig (and I like guinea pigs) and was on the lower level near the elevators (loud), late night bar come coffee shop (at 6:30 am) i.e. VERY LOUD. The staff were nice but this was hardly worth the cost just for the hipsterness...and for crying out loud I live in San Francisco where "hipster" is close to Godliness. And yes all NYC hotel rooms are loud but these rooms should never be used for guests. Would better off for storage.

title: Coffee hours restricted!
text: Disappointed to find, after a lengthy day of walking, that coffee is not served after 6pm! Cocktails offered, but no chance to recharge with a coffee and no room facilities for a coffee either.  Foyer packed in rain as there are no other places to sit in the hotel our room was lovely but very small. One side of the bed was under the eaves...not great if sleep is interrupted at night!

title: Poor catering to Bridal Party
text:
I was thrilled to be staying in the High Line Suite for my wedding weekend. Me and my partner both had rooms next door to eachother so our wedding party could bounce back and forth to help us get ready for our special day. However, we experienced a handful of issues with the staff upon arrival.

From the moment we checked in, we had submitted a credit card pre-authorization for both of our rooms so that all charges and incidentals would be on a family member's card (as our wedding night at this wonderful, yet slightly expensive hotel, was a gift to us from them). Unfortunately when we went to checkin they notified us that they couldn't grant that authorization even though I showed them the form I submitted. So we had to put our personal credit cards on file.

From there, I had requested and paid for a half-day rate for the second room so we could stay until 4pm (as our wedding wasn't until 5pm). I called the night before as suggested to ensure availability, they gave me verbal confirmation over the phone that everything was taken care of. However, at 11am, we were notified that we must vacate the room as it was past checkout time and must pay a full day rate and move to another room if we chose to stay. Why would I go through all that trouble to avoid extra stress on our wedding day only to have to move and pay for rooms in the end!? The wedding party was in the middle of getting ready for the big day and after the Maid of Honor debated with the manager, I, the bride, finally called back down to argue with them a bit more and finally got them to agree to the late check out terms I had paid for. 

And last but certainly not least, as our wedding party hurried to clear the Suite after the wedding night so we could all go to brunch before the 11am checkout, we realized that the Maid of Honor's computer was left in the room. We called the hotel no later than 2 hours after checkout only to find that the room was cleaned and vetted through their 3-step approval process and "nothing" was found. That is a complete lie. We could describe the exact location in which it was left, and they claim that absolutely nothing was left in the room. Beyond that, I intentionally left a couple of items behind that I didn't feel like carrying back...a cooler with wine in it, some candles and some hair products. And they still claim that we left nothing in the room.

I am incredibly disappointed with the hotel staff's catering to my bridal party during our two-night stay at The High Line Hotel. As beautiful and charming the space is, the staff does not make it worth recommending to my friends and family.

title: Awesome
text: This place is great it has great food great service well mannered people it's really friendly and not to pricey. I went here on business and I got to say I will be going back here again. Everyone enjoyed it.

title: The perfect hotel in NYC
text:
I have stayed here before and keep coming back. The staff is friendly and very helpful. From the General Manager to the maid: everyone is there to make the stay perfect.
Front desk is efficient and the coffee shop Intelligentsia makes one of the greatest cups of coffee you can have.
Rooms are good; bed is super comfortable and bathroom and amenities perfect.
The historic building and the grounds plus the location make this the perfect hotel to stay in NYC.

title: Treat yourself to a unique hotel experience!
text: You're immediately exposed to a unique stay in the best way possible - a perfect blend of the old brought up to modern standards.  Efficient paperless check-in, coffee house in lobby with additional food options, peaceful courtyard, great architecture, comfy beds, and a pleasant helpful staff.  Great access to the High Line, short stroll to Chelsea Market, and many restaurants in a rapidly upcoming area. Enjoy !

title: Be a local in the big city
text: I can't say enough great things about the High Line Hotel.  All staff knew my name and were eager to help with anything.  The location was perfect for me (near my conference) and the bellman was quick to grab a cab whenever I needed it.  The lobby is charming and has an adorable coffee bar and amazing outside patio.  The rooms are small (aren't they all in NYC?), but clean and quaint.  I highly recommend a walk along the High Line (converted elevated rail) and a stroll by the piers.  This is my new place to stay in the city.

title: New Favorite NYC Hotel!
text: With kids who went to Columbia and Barnard I've spent a lot of time in New York and stayed in more than a few hotels but this is my new favorite!  If you like the feel of staying in a real neighborhood, the High Line is the place for you.  It's a great location in Chelsea; steps to the High Line and Chelsea Market, restaurants and shops and not far to the subway.  Penn Station is a 10-minute cab ride away. The hotel itself is old fashioned in a wonderful way!  Housed in the dorm of a former seminary, the lobby looks like it dates back to the '20s and boasts a fantastic coffee bar with full coffee and tea service as well as a case stocked each morning with donuts, pastries and scones (and they were good!).  The rooms are large and light-filled, decorated with pieces that look as though they're original to the building or were carefully curated to complete the look.  My sister and I shared the double queen and could have brought our kids along and comfortably shared the space. The beds were fabulous; I haven't slept that well in ages.  The staff is young and friendly and happy to help.  I will be back at the High Line on my next visit to the city in the fall!

title: A charming place with some issues
text:
The location is great.

The staff in the lobby and outdoor areas were friendly and helpful.  We could not be more pleased.

The room was very nice and the toiletries were top quality.  The towels were some of the best we've ever seen in a hotel.

However, there were several issues.

Upon our arrival, there was quite a bit of food crumbs, and food wrapping, on the floor.  We called the front desk and the issue was addressed.

On the evening of our first night, we realized the bed topper was feather.  My wife is allergic to feathers.  We called the front desk to ask for feather-free bedding.  We were informed that housekeeping was gone for the day, but it would be addressed with the next day room cleaning.  This did not happen and we had to call to the front desk a second time before the issue was addressed.

On our final night we called the front desk to receive a wake-up call.  Luckily we also set our cellphone alarms because the wake-up call never arrived.   

Overall, we cannot rate this as one of the better hotels we have stayed at.  The charm and friendly staff do not make up for failure to follow though on simple requests.

title: Really fun
text: This place is funky and fun.  Our room is spacious, well lit, and totally comfortable.  Everything works.  The location is great.  The staff is friendly and capable.  The building is historic and wonderfully restored.

title: Best in Chelsea
text:
Love staying at The High Line Hotel when visiting daughter and son in law in Chelsea.
Appreciate the guest pass at Equinox. Staff friendly, helpful and car arranged to airport reasonable. Great coffee bar in lobby.  Request a room away from 10th Ave…a bit noisy.

title: My favorite place to stay in the city.
text:
Great location. Wonderful staff, friendly and professional. Big rooms. Beds are extraordinary. Have stayed here many times now...has a quiet courtyard, nice unfussy feel.
Have stayed here alone and with a friend...feels safe, comfortable.

title: Hidden Luxury Gem with Cool Heritage Vibe
text: New York has so many hotels and so few with any real character, charm and warmth.  The High Line Hotel has all of these and more. Rooms have the feel of a luxury drawing room from another era, and the courtyard areas are magical.  Great coffee from Intelligentsia in the small lobby area (which becomes a bar at night) and very friendly, helpful staff.  Try for a room on the back-facing courtyard side and away from the lobby area.  Plan on spending lots on the mini bar, which has so many cool choices. Can't wait to get back!

title: Exceptioanl Staff Always Brings Us Back...
text:
We have been staying at the Highline Hotel for well over a year now, and it is our #1 choice in Manhattan for comfortable accomodations.  We have stayed in every type room available, and each one is full of history and charm.  Our favorite is the Highline Suite.  Intelligentsia and Alta Linea, the in-house coffee bar and restaurant, are both excellent places to meet, dine, and entertain.  The Highline Hotel is centrally located. One can be anywhere in the city quickly; cabs and subways are always plentiful. The neighborhood is pure New York, full of galleries, and is easily walked.  The Highline Park, a linear, aerial greenway built on an old elevated train track, is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.  The adjacent Meatpacking District is loaded with hip restaurants like Dos Caminos and Buddakan as well as shopping at any of the designer boutiques like Jeffery and Diane Von Furstenberg.  Equinox Gym is a just a few short blocks away, and there are many hot nightclubbing opportunities all around.

All of these components would make just about any traveler feel at home.  However, we must point out what brings the whole experience together is the exceptional hotel staff.  They are seasoned and well-trained. We are always welcomed with warm greetings and sincere smiles, all of our needs are met quickly and efficiently, and our privacy is respected.  Alvin, Thomas, Teresa, Tidi, Paul, Stephanie, and the entire Front of the House Staff, the Housekeeping and Engineering Staff, and the Management Team always exceed our expectations.

We recommend the Highline Hotel to any traveler who loves the unique, expects exceptional service, and is looking for a place to call home while exploring the best city in the world.

title: Character and location!
text: My sister and I really enjoyed this hotel. It is a very cute building with loads of character. Rooms were of adequate size (I have definitely stayed in smaller rooms in NYC). There was no closet in the room but there was a hanging rack instead (which is no issue for me personally). Bed was comfortable, bathroom was cute. Overall i was very impressed. We had a great view from our room too. The courtyard out front was bustling and really lovely, and the lobby coffee shop was great. This hotel is directly across from the Chelsea High Line and very convenient to the west village and all of chelsea. I absolutely LOVED the location.

title: as a returning guest i was glad to see improvement
text:
this is an overated funky hotel for reasons i still did not manage to figure out despite my repeated stays! rooms are classy and elegant. bathrooms have the old fashion curtain which is not nice. AC is weird - as in most of NY and beds are super comfy!!

PLEASE GET A PROPER RECEPTION DESK AS THE RECEPTIONISTS HAVE TO STAND ALL THE TIME WHICH IS NOT GOOD! it is really stressfull to hang out and see the poor waiters to be standing all the time. Pls do something about it.

coffee is of great great quality and expensive of course. oat and chocolate flapjacks to die for!!! cool front yard and nice coctails at the bar along with bar food - though i hate the no smoking outdoor policy (makes no sense).

title: Great Experience
text:
I loved my stay at the Hotel.
The staff are amazing. Very professional.
The rooms are spotlessly clean .
The bed...A DREAM BED!!!
LOVED IT !!highly recommend to All.
I have written everything I wanted to say.
The coffee Bar is amazing. It turns into a bar at night. The courtyard is beautifully kept and very romantic.

title: Boutique hotel with charm
text: Charming hotel nestled in the Chelsea neighborhood. The High Line is in walking distance of the High Line park and 15 great restaurants. The staff is exceptional. Daniel, Mike, Alvin and the entire staff are incredibly helpful and polite. The rooms were beautiful and offered robes with slippers. The only down side was the air conditioning units in the room windows which were extremely  loud.

title: Interesting and Beautiful Ammenities
text: This was a unique boutique hotel with great character and charm.  Adorable neighborhood.  Hands down, Daniel was the most polite and welcoming employee at the hotel and any hotel where I have ever had the pleasure of staying.  His level of service exceeded that of the Ritz!

title: I LOVE the High Line Hotel
text:
From the moment you realize that the High Line is a converted seminary, and you see how they've brought it up to date with such loving care, you will be blown away.

Not your typical high-end hotel, but ever so charming and unique, with beautiful cozy public spaces, an Intelligentsia Coffee place during the day the day that turns into a cool bar at night.

The rooms are amazingly comfortable, with high ceilings, big bathrooms and very nice linens.

They've even kept the seminarians' desks with the paper stamps that they used to emboss their letters.

One of my top favorites in NYC!

title: Delightful!
text: First trip to NY and was charmed by this gem and Chelsea neighborhood. We got upgraded to a deluxe double and the room was surprisingly spacious for being in Manhattan (traveled with our teenage son).  The character of this restored seminary just oozes through with the 19th century brick building, antique furniture and eclectic décor.  Not having a front desk was odd but staff was wonderful and helpful. The location near many restaurants and shops and interesting High Line park made our trip to NY extremely positive and a definite redo.

title: A Charming, Comfortable Oasis
text: The High Line is conveniently located (easy walk to the A, C and E subway lines) in a charming neighborhood. And it offers beautifully appointed accommodations, attentive (but not fawning) staff, and the perfect escape from the noise and hectic pace of NYC. Love this place!

title: Beautiful, TINY.
text:
The recent renovation and redesign of the High Line Hotel tips the scale in favor of form over function. Beautiful polished woods paired with trendy gothic wall and floor coverings make for luxurious furnishment, but the "Full Sized Room" leaves you feeling beyond cramped. (Although I should have guessed something was to be amiss when the check in valet referred to our room as "The Harry Potter Room.") Gabled ceilings with walls a mere 10 inches from the edge of our bed to either side of the room, my husband and I were left with about 10 square feet of standing room within our unit, and could touch the ceilings. There was not enough room to open a suitcase, and the room was not equipped with a closet. We literally had to open our suitcase in the bathroom when needed, as it was the only space available. Luckily we only had one piece of luggage- 2 would not have fit, even under the bed! There was no suitcase rack, as there was not enough room to make use of it. We had to ask for the robes to be removed from the bathroom so we could use their hooks to store our clothing--as opening/closing our suitcases was not an option throughout our 5 day stay. I've lived in the city for over 10 years and have seen my fair share of "tiny" hotel rooms for friends and family- this one beyond took the cake. On the top floor, the air conditioning did not work, but the front desk installed a window unit when we complained...but there went our view!

My recommendation would be if you book a standard full/queen room, do not let them place you in one of their (1/2) rooms; ie Room 57 1/2. The location is great for gallery viewing, highline strolling, and quiet nights. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but who needs that with NYC right outside your door?

title: Great Start to a Good Weekend
text:
The Wife and I started our friends wedding weekend in Chelsea, and after much hemming and hawing over where to stay finally settled on the Highline. We couldn't be happier with our selection. From the moment we walked in the door, the service was impecable. Check-in was a breeze, and suggestions for dinner and drinks were ample and on point. 

The room was appointed with a desk, comfy bed, and operable typewriter my wife used to leave a note for our daughter (when she's born that is). Free Wifi in the room, and old world charm that you don't find in modern hotels throughout the city. Inteligista Coffee bar in the lobby, and a quiet seating area right on 10th street. 

Close to multiple eateries nearby (Morimoto, Cookshop, Artichoke, etc etc), and a quick 5 minute walk to the Chelsea Market and Highline. 

5/5 would certainly stay again, and recommend to all our friends.

title: Exquisite stays
text: I have been traveling to NYC for work over the last six months.  The High Line has become my oasis.  In no other hotel have I been treated so wonderfully by the staff.  Every bit of my experience at The High Line has been top notch.  I'd rather stay no where else.

title: The High Experience
text:
I've been recently and for the first time to this hotel during a BIZ trip in NY city.

The structure is absolutely characteristic both externally and internally.

The environment is absolutely warm and the overview is very cool. You do not understand in what time you are... Modern and "retro'" at the same time.

Rooms are confortable and not small. Which is quite unusual in the city.

In front of the hotel you have an access to the High Line, amazing! Do not leave NY if you do not try a walk there!

My overall experience has been very positive.

I'll back for sure

title: Super Trendy hotel en super trendy location
text: La construcción del hotel es increíble, estilo gótico y cuando entras te encuentras con un sitio super moderno. La ubicación es excelente, el barrio de Chelsea está cada día mas lindo, lleno de sitios para comer, tomar algo, a dos cuadras del Chelsea Market y enfrente del High Line.  El patio interior del hotel es encantador también. Las habitaciones son espaciosas para la media de Manhattan. El baño quizás requiere alguna renovación, pero está ok. La cama es demasiado blanda y no tan buena con tu espalda pero en general es un bonito y buen hotel para una estancia en este lado de Manhattan.

title: Exceptional Experience
text: I have frequented many of the New York City luxury hotels and have to say that the HighLine, by far, is one of my absolute favorites. Everything from the service to the overall experience was exceptional.

title: You shouldn't go so I can hoard its wonderfulness.
text: From the courtesy of the staff, who upgraded my room and treated me like a valued guest, to the Intelligensia Coffee bar to the romantic & elegantly appointed room, it's a joy to stay. I'd only say don't go so it stays available when I'm in NY.

title: Excellent Spot
text: We stayed there for a couples' break this weekend.  Most were at The Standard but we wanted to try something new.  The High Line is a great little spot with nice rooms, friendly service and really cool indoor and outdoor garden areas to sit, drink, read, relax.  The High Line park is just across the street and your in the middle of the Chelsea/Meatpacking district...great shopping, dining and nightlife.  Check out the High Line if your looking to stay in the area.

title: Promises not kept
text: Our first stay made us come back  a second time a year ago. Room #1, as we entered  had a constant loud annoying vibrating buzzing noise. We asked for another room with a promise to look into what seemed to be a never before heard mystery noise to the staff. Our third visit in May, accompanied by our two young adult children, we were again given room #1 with the same noise! Again the employees seemed suspiciously unaware of this mystery noise, except one. He mentioned a fan in the elevator shaft that could not be turned off.. No other room was available, so both nights were sleepless, earplugs having no effect whatsoever! Though the staff is always very friendly and attentive, I am very disappointed with the lack of comeback, after having spoken to the desk staff, twice, left messages and written to the general manager. My messages are not returned if left on the voice box. And finally when the response does come it is so incredibly vague, I feel we are not taken seriously. We are frequent New York visitors, 5 to 6 times a year, and stay in high end hotels. Never again at the High Line Hotel. That goes to all my friends.

title: Disappointed in High Line Hotel
text: We really wanted to like this hotel and stayed there because of the reviews, but we come away very disappointed. We have stayed several times a year in NYC hotels for 12 years and understand small rooms, but our room was extremely small. Added to that, the ceilings sloped inwrapped making a small room worse. On the first full day our room was not made up until after 5:00 pm and then the maids did not have all their supplies. On the last day, our cold water (and hot) was not cold, but scalding hot. Way too hot to brush our teeth, wash our face, or shower. When reported to the office, we were told that it happens sometimes.  This is a hotel nothing like its web site that has seen better days.

title: Headquarters for a Tour of Manhatten
text: Staff was friendly and helpful; enjoyed the room which was unique, It was close to the High Line and other sites downtown. The room was comfortable and different from most hotel rooms in that it had a homey feel. I would stay there again if ever in New York again.

title: One of the best hotel stays in NYC!
text: Everything was great- Our room was beautiful with big windows, high ceilings and period details and it was very spacious. The staff was incredibly welcoming and also kindly accommodated us when we let them know we would be three staying instead of two by giving us a room with two queen beds. And the best coffee ever is served at Intelligentsia in the lobby. We will be back!

title: Cozy Stay
text:
The High Line Hotel is a gem in the middle of Chelsea. Unlike the hundreds of hotels in NYC, The High Line provides you with a cozy atmosphere, filled with an authentic vintage feel you wouldn't get anywhere else. The staff is extremely warm and helpful and was greeted by the Front Office Manager, Ricardo, upon my arrival. He was very proactive, kindhearted and went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed to make my stay comfortable. 

The location is perfect. It's away from the hustle and bustle of midtown, surrounded by amazing restaurants and steps away from the famous High Line. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and looking forward to staying here in the near future.

title: Perfect Stay
text: A fabulous place to stay in Chelsea.  Staff is warm and helpful. Our room was on the garden side, it was very quiet and had huge windows. Didn't mind at all that there wasn't a full restaurant with fabulous Chelsea & NYC restaurants at your doorstep.  The coffee bar run by Intelligentsia during the day made exceptional espresso drinks with delicious pastries to fill my breakfast needs and I loved that it turned to a bar at night for a night cap!  Also loved that the hotel did not feel like just any other hotel, definitely had a small scale elegant feel.  Definitely will stay here again.

title: Service, defined
text:
I've just returned from my third visit to the High Line, and without a doubt it's my favorite place to stay in all of Manhattan. Frequent trips the past two years have shown me all types of accomodations, from B&Bs to luxe hotels to just-the-solid-basics, but for my money, I want to stay here every chance that I get.

The second I roll up, I'm greeted - and remembered as a repeat guest, even though my stays have been short (and booked through a third-party app). I'm welcomed, shown every courtesy, checked in quickly - and if I'm early, bags are stowed and I'm given a call when the room's ready. I get back and am given my key; the bags follow me to my room. Even the smallest rooms feel cozy in the best way, with dashes of vintage, eclectic and modern decor (from the books in the shelf to the small live plants placed throughout the room - and check out the wallpaper, and the taxidermy!) and the bed and towels and bath are all luxurious. I always get a phenomenal night's sleep. Many of my favorite things are within a short walk (I'm very partial to Chelsea) - and the High Line park is a must-stroll if you want to see the most smiles in New York City.

I'm normally a bit of a bargain hunter for my Manhattan trips (with as often as I go, you have to be); the highest compliment I can give a hotel is to say it's worth its standard rate and then some, which is the case for the High Line Hotel. A point in fact: this past weekend, I had booked at a place I'd stayed at previously that recently changed ownership, and the service level had declined significantly. The accommodations were comfortable and clean, but there were so many snafus that when I was presented with the option to stay an extra night in Manhattan, I chose to leave the other establishment for the High Line, which was slightly higher in price. The way I was treated at the High Line - and the comfort of the accommodations - was worth the price difference and then some. No smoother experience can be had, and they pay attention to the little things. It's appreciated more than I can say, and was an exceptionally welcome relief.

The vibe and the staff are exactly right for me, and I can't wait to go back.

title: Wedding Fiasco
text: We went to Chelsea for a wedding and stayed overnight.  Made reservations months in advance but were provided the two worst rooms in the hotel, L6 and L7.  The noise was until 2:00AM and started again at 6:00AM.  For what we paid we thought that we would be provided rooms in keeping with the price.  These rooms were of the seminary type with very limited closet space and storage for suitcases.  We requested some consideration for the bad rooms since we booked so far in advance.  None was provided. Never again.

title: Perfect
text:
I booked this for a staycation for my husband's 40th birthday because it looked up his alley - cool old building, authentic old-timey feeling (as opposed to the contrived, theme-ey vintage vibe so many places like this have) and a great location for us to explore a part of Manhattan that we don't get to enjoy very much since we moved to Brooklyn.  

The rooms are small but gorgeous, I fully luxuriated in the Bigelow toiletries, and our view out onto a courtyard made us feel like we were in Paris!  Going down to the lobby to get coffee and treats in the am was perfect as well, and then we hopped across the street for an insane brunch/bloody mary's at Cookshop followed by a nice long (but way too crowded) Highline walk.  I'd imagine that for an out of towner the location is also pretty amazing for accessing the rest of the city.  You are two long avenues away from a subway but it's a great midway point between Chelsea and Meatpacking, which are really fun neighborhoods to stay in bc of all of the fantastic food and drink options.  And to get to museums and other tourist attractions you can walk the 12 minutes to the train at 23rd street.  

Fyi there's no front desk - just a few people with iPads in the lobby.  But they were so nice and helpful - the customer service was great.

I'm hesitant to even write this review bc I want to make this our default get-away-from-the-kids place, and we could barely afford the room as it was... if it gets more popular we'll get priced out!  But it was such a perfect stay that I feel like they deserve a rave review.

title: Excellent experience, super attentive staff
text: Pulling up to this place is impressive.  The building just stands out, a classy historic boutique in the heart of Chelsea, directly on the High Line.  There is no hotel parking, but there is a really affordable lot directly across the street ($32 for 24 hrs!).  As soon as you approach the hotel, staff comes to greet you.  They opened the door, asked to help with bags, and walked us to the check-in area.  There is not check-in desk, which was different, but cool.  The staff member takes your name and scans your credit card with an iPad - simple as that.  Our room was so bright, quiet, clean and comfortable.  Tons of character with old creaky wood floors and huge doors, and the room was decorated with cool antique furniture.  The bed was actually one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on - perfect pillows and blankets too.  In the room, there was a complete fully stocked snack bar - including craft beers, top shelf liquor, wine, water, candies, chips and goodies - it was all shockingly affordable!  They didn't try to kill you with over-priced stuff if you were dying for a snack.   They also had an "intimate kit," just in case ;)  The bathroom was small but suitable in size, the complimentary soaps and shampoos were seriously great - C.O. Bigelow products, which smell amazing.  The towels were huge and soft and luxurious.  There were comfy bathrobes and slippers to use in the room, as well as free wi-fi and a nice big flat screen TV.  There's a really nice courtyard in the front of the building where you can sit and read, or have a snack, or just enjoy a sunny day.  The only negatives that I can point out: no in house restaurant or room service (which actually was no problem whatsoever because there are an abundance of AMAZING restaurants just footsteps away), and the fact that there was an air conditioner unit in the window.  The issue with that was that it blocked a bit of our view, but really it was not that big of a deal at all.  I got a great deal on this hotel using the "Hotel Tonight" app, and it was quite a bit less expensive than similar high end hotels.  I would highly recommend this place for a nice few days in the city - I cannot wait to come back.

title: Excellent ambiance and customer service
text: The staff at the High Line Hotel was the highlight for me. The baristas in the lobby coffee shop, and two gentlemen - Alvin & Daniel - who were very warm and welcoming and didn't seem to mind the questions of a tourist! Both were quite helpful. The hotel itself was in a neighborhood I enjoyed exploring, my room was clean and the entire place had an elegant, historic ambiance.

title: Delightful Establishment!
text:
In town for just 2 nights, I wanted a place close to the event I was attending and in a neighborhood I could explore comfortably on my own. My expectations were exceeded when I entered to check in.  A pleasant process that did not involve waiting in a line at a desk.  When I entered my room I was pleased to find a very comfortable bed, a nicely appointed bath and, I found out later, a very quiet place. 
Delightful!

title: Interesting boutique hotel with a ton of character
text:
Stayed over a weekend to visit several of the local art galleries. The building is a beautifully redone old seminary with original details and quirks throughout. We loved the charm and character and would highly recommend for anyone seeking a bit of old New York. The hotel managed to embrace the physical location without compromising on the comfort one would expect of a similarly priced high end hotel. The room was comfortable and had everything we needed including a fridge and ample closet space. We were on the 10th Ave side and traffic could be a bit noisy (its NYC) but the blackout curtains mitigated most of the light and sound.

The hotel is in a great location in Chelsea, close to restaurants, galleries, nightlife, and of course the highline. Service was very good, although there is no traditional front desk.

The only nits I have is that the rooms are small (typical for NYC) and there is no room service (although there are many nearby restaurants and other food options).

Would highly recommend.

title: Excellent level of customer service; different from the chains.
text: The level of customer service was right at the top.  When it is that good, they make it look easy.  When we went to Sunday brunch up the street and met with indifferent customer service, it was so noticeable...I guess we aren't at the High Line anymore.  Used the Equinox Fitness down the street and that was an amazing experience too.  Had a trainer work with me, stretch me out, video me, and that is all just part of the Equinox experience.  I would go back to the High Line just to go the Equinox!  Being able to get around via the High Line is really fun; great dinner at a restaurnat in Chelsea Market.  Our room was very small, so we would ask for a bigger room, one with a closet, but we loved how unique everything was, with the wood floors, old oriental rugs, and curated accessories in the room.  Super comforatble bed; excellent, large flat screen.

title: Perfect location, attentive service
text: Very cool boutique hotel across from High Line.  Lots of thoughtful details including a stamp press in the rooms previously used by seminarians as the hotel renovated a gorgeous seminary.  Rooms were quite large by New York standards.  Convenient to subways and walkable to many outstanding spots such as Chelsea Market and the West Village.  Concierge (Daniel) went out of way to be helpful and friendly...good advice and attention to detail.  We'll be back!

title: ニューヨークに行く人全員にすすめたい！
text:
2泊して、チェルシーを堪能しました。
が、チェルシーの町よりも何よりも、ホテル自体がすばらしく、もっとホテルでゆっくりする時間を取りたかったくらいです。
元神学校を改装した重厚で歴史ある建物に、シックさを取り入れたインテリア。
とてもおしゃれで落ち着きます。
スタッフはおおむね親切です。
おおむね、というのは、特に特別すばらしい！！！ということでもなく、本当に普通にすばらしかったです。
値段が高いのがちょっと。。。

title: Fabulous Retreat
text: The service at the High Line Hotel is impeccable!  The location is convenient to the subway, wonderful restaurants, and of course, The High Line Park.  Looking forward to my next visit to NYC so I can stay there again, and again, and again!

title: Perfect hotel
text:
My third stay at this hotel. Location is perfect; building is amazing; staff is very friendly and the un-hotel feeling of it makes it even better. Cant beat the location!
Intelligentsia coffee shop in the lobby  is the perfect start of the day.
Rooms are awesome and decorated very tastefully, bed is perfect and small details like old fashion pencils, notepads and amenities are scattered nonchalantly in the room.
Management is there to resolve any issue should you need them. "The Hotel" while in NYC.

title: Fantastic hotel and staff
text: My wife and I just spent a long weekend at the High Line Hotel and it is now one of our favorite places to stay in New York. The room was exceptionally large and pleasant. Huge well appointed bathroom. You couldn't ask for a better location. If you are a coffee drinker it's a perfect place as the lobby includes a coffee bar that features "Intelligent" coffee prepared with reverence. The staff is great - friendly and knowledgable, going out of their way to be helpful. Special thanks to Daniel for all his help during our stay. We look forward to returning.

title: Hidden little new gem find in Manhattan!
text:
I just stayed this past weekend at the Highline Hotel on suggestion from a friend who had stayed one time before and truly enjoyed the overall experience!!!
The design of the hotel is true lifestyle and the beds in the guest rooms are the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in.  I love the little touches through out the hotel with vintage pieces of furniture and the stationary stamp on the guest room desk is super cute!
The coffee bar in the lobby is a local hang out with a wide selection of coffee options and teas to choose from!
I will definitely be back soon!

title: Charming, funky, fun
text: The High Line Hotel is a funky fun place in one of the hottest neighborhoods in NYC.  The decor is warm and charming and the staff is friendly and welcoming. We were always greeted, as if we were coming home.  It is conveniently located within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and transportation. (Subway is only 2 blocks and 4 avenues away.) The lobby is a dog friendly coffee shop, so there's always interesting visitors to watch or interact with. This however also appeared to be the only drawback we encountered. After returning to the hotel in the late afternoon, the lobby was so crowded there was no place for us to sit and relax.  I imagine in nicer weather, the back patio would alleviate this issue. That being said, I would definitely return, felt very much at home here.

title: Charmed Place & Perfect Location to Explore Chelsea & Beyond
text:
The High Line Hotel offers the charm you’d expect from Chelsea with easy walking access to the neighborhood and adjacent places like the Flatiron District (Eatly/ABC Carpet Home/UnionSquare) and West Village (Magnolias Bakery). 

I had a girls weekend away in NYC and we all enjoyed our comfortable accommodations (extra comfy bed!). Just stay away from the Standard Queen double-sized bed rooms since they are smaller than a closet and are noted with ½ after the room numbers. The Standard King and especially the Deluxe King provided for lots of room for the gals to hang out and catch up on life. 

The lobby was warm and inviting with its own expresso bar open to the public. The only thing I took issue with is that the neighbors all feel a need to bring their dogs with them to the expresso bar and hang out in the intimate (limited seating) lobby. With three to four dogs at any one time, I wasn’t sure I was in a dog park or a hotel. Dogs aside, I definitely plan to return and can’t wait to experience the hotel and it’s outdoor spaces in warmer weather!

title: I was charmed
text: If you are looking for a super cozy , friendly hotel with awesome furnishings this is the place. I felt as though I was in my own private atelier. Our room (#40 ) had gorgeous natural light and ample space. Beds were very comfortable, too.All of the art and decor is carefully and beautifully curated.

title: Nice place with character
text: Very nice hotel with plenty of character and good design. Windows that actually open and let in plenty of light. Not a corporate, shiny chain hotel feeling one bit - perfect! Nice coffee shop on ground floor. Only drawback is that it's not really close to a subway, which is fine if you've got time to stroll along and the weather is nice. If it's minus 30 (as it was when we visited) and you're on a short timeline, it does feel a bit out of the way and gets expensive in cabs to go east.

title: Nice Hotel
text: The hotel is very nice and quaint. The lobby was a little too small for my taste but still very welcoming. We went in February but I think it is more charming in the Spring/Summer when the courtyard is open.  It's well located. Our double bed room was very spacious.  However the bathroom's plumbing was not the most efficient. It's definitely an hotel for couples, business trip or family with older kids. Very low key yet upscale. I just wish the lobby was a little more spacious.

title: Sexy and spooky
text: If you are looking for a relaxed yet premium atmosphere this is the right place. Historical building full of memorabilia and good looking people around make the environment worth going. Rooms are well designed but not perfect fro travellers that are looking for usual comfort. Heating was too high despite of the warm temperatures outside, wardrobe had no lighting but beds are great.

title: Comfort & Contemporary elegance
text:
The Chelsea location is lovely, within walking distance of sundry independent shops and interesting restaurants not to mention the eponymous park, right on the doorstep. I0th is pretty busy, but we didn't hear much in our dual aspect roof room. The room was spacious, no dreaded fitted carpet, and well lit by secondary light sources; it felt individual. The bed was wonderful. But, good luck with getting any ice- cold water from the taps - in fact the plumbing was a little off; perhaps this is just par for the course in NYC...- our bathroom shower malfunctioned one morning, with some distinctly brackish water pouring from the taps. Here the lack of reception was a minor annoyance, and nothing was ventured to us by way of apology for the minor inconvenience of having to wait for our morning showers. Being Brits, we didn't push it.
The coffee's great and the terrace at ground floor to 10th is a very nice place to enjoy one, or a glass of chilled white.
Overall, we loved it and we'd both be thrilled to stay here on our return to the city.

title: My Kinda Place
text:
It is not fair to the hotel to try and keep it "our little secret" but I am reluctant to tout what a gem this modest hotel really is. The good news is it is not a hotel for everyone. It is hip without being fancy. The staff are not cloying or fawning over you but are professional and can get things done that you need them to get done. The hotel made the right decision not to over do the remodeling of the old seminary which gives a unique character to the rooms and public spaces. To some extent it is like staying in a B&B with all the "homey-ness" but it is big enough that you avoid some of a B&B's awkward intimacy. 
The clientele is a nice and interesting range of youthful, artistic, international and hip. The lobby reminds me very much of my early travels to Europe which are memories whose return I most welcome. 
I'm telling you this but I expect you to keep it a secret. It is just between you and me.

title: Old NYC but quiet with Pdx quality coffee
text: For a coffee snob from Oregon who likes character, location and charm...Highline nailed it. This old seminary dorm converted to a lovely hotel in which you cold feel the ages it had lived. Staff was very accommodating and it was very easy to get down or uptown on the Westside.

title: Retro hotel
text:
A nice change from the glitzy or trendy hotels and certainly cozier than the big name hotel chains found in NYC. The pros outweigh any cons of this hotel. Charming room with antique furnishings. AWESOME bed. Super cozy. However, the lighting was dark and no bed stand on one side of side so reading in bed was a challenge. Overhead lighting was an exposed  harsh lightbulb. The lighting in the bathroom was dark as well, not designed for application of makeup.  But on the other hand, the towels and bathrobes were wonderful. Also the faucet in the bathroom is one of those auto on/off faucets where you were unable to control the temperature of the water. But there was plenty of hot water in the shower and the Bigelow toiletries made everything smell so nice.  
There is no lobby to speak of and the entryway was crowded with coffee drinkers fraternizing the local coffee shop set up in what would be the lobby. One of the unique features of this hotel. The grounds look wonderful and I can't wait to come back in the spring and get a garden view room. The location is great for gallery walking, high line strolling  and eating.

title: Almost great
text: Its quite unassuming when you enter, no real front desk which is a bit confusing seeing as there was also no one around to help us with our bags or to greet us. After a few problems with check in and a free coffee to make up for it we were up in our rooms and i felt instantly at home. My room, a deluxe king, was huge with a massive extremely comfortable bed. The room over looked the garden but being on the top floor also had a magical view of the empire state over the roof tops. Being at the back of the hotel meant it was incredibly quiet and calm. One draw back of being in the attic however was that the shower was too low and standing at 6' it comfortably washed my shoulders and nothing higher. One minor room detail was the lack of luggage stand, one big detail is the lack of restaurant and subsequently room service. It would be incredible if the great hall was turned into somewhere to eat as although the rooms are lovely the hotel overall lacks any kind of vibe, the only real common area is the coffee shop as you come in which feels a bit like sitting in a hallway and isn't really somewhere you want to hang out. Staff were half and half in terms of friendliness and I often felt the people working in the coffee shop wanted nothing more than for you to leave them alone. In saying all of this i would stay again purely for the room and location, if they eventually include the addition of a restaurant i'd probably stay on the majority of my frequent visits to New York.

title: A genuine home away from home!
text: Great little hotel! Rooms are spotless, cool, functional and more than comfy. Nice detailing. Great bed. Excellent bathrooms and a fun mini bar that understands a hangover (Oxygen capsules!). Above all great value. I paid around $225 a night! Staff super courteous. Would I go back? Of course. A genuine home away from home. Bravo! PS reluctant to write this review as I wanted to keep it a secret. :-)

title: great experience
text:
great staff and wonderful charming  room
definetly  not cookie cutter place
great spot in west chelsea
highly recommended
super accomodating staff
the opposite of chain hotel sameness
cool lobby coffee shop
great restaurants in immed vicinity

title: Best hotel experience in a long time
text: Very friendly, professional staff.  Efficient check-in/out process.  Endless charm in a great location.  Rooms were so unique and impeccably clean.  I highly recommend it and will be returning again soon.

title: Feels like home away from home
text: Daniel and John went above and beyond with their service and professionalism. Would highly recommend this place to anyone.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very romantic. They have an amazing coffee shop in the lobby with great cappuccino and pastries. The rooms are very roomy and beautifully appointed.

title: More, Clement Clarke Moore
text:
Pack your top hat for a step inside a brick giant that feels like the Dickens.  Elegant, its essences billowing from some time past.  The halls might as well be powered by steam; clean, crisp, frothy steam.  As if on a train platform during a 1940s noir-ish classic, everyman in a trench coat, the one woman looking over her shoulder before she searches ahead, there is a sense of grandeur and anticipation at the High Line.  The rooms are spacious, with furniture and hardy, polished wood floors of a bygone era.  The surrounding details feel considered.  You should have to sip a martini just to enter.  Beds?  As heavenly as that noir actress.  Soft and firm in every place that each should be. A glorious night's sleep, or, depending on the occasion and company.  

Don't go for the hotel lobby, as there is not much of one.  Be sure to pack a minimal sense of the curious.  Recall what neighborhood you find yourself in and by all means be gay.  Go here to get away to the estate where Clement Clarke Moore penned 'Twas the Night Before Christmas.'  Most of all, go here to be the Bard of Chelsea, if only for only one night.

title: Stunningly beautiful hotel if you appreciate historical buildings.
text:
We fell for this place years ago when it was The Desmond Tutu Center, and although there are aspects of the previous hotel we miss much of the new is better. The architecture and exquisite detail remain for the most part and are fantastic throughout the hotel. Take the stairs, for example, and you'll see. Several elevators are available, but we prefer the original lift or the lovely stairwells. All staff were gracious and attentive during this visit, although I was hopeful we'd receive extra special treatment during this stay as we celebrated a momentous event. 
Some rooms are quite small, but during this stay and many others we've found our room to be more than adequate. Again, we love the architecture and seeming effort at preservation.

title: Coffee and Antiques
text: A hidden gem on the West side, very unique. A former seminary, the lobby is a coffee shop and there is no front desk. Rooms are large and furnished with  antiques. There's no Restaurant or bar or disco music in the background.  Get a room on a higher floor to avoid coffee shop noise  I would return.

title: New world understated character and class
text: I stay at the High Line hotel every time I visit New York because I love the feel of the hotel (it's a converted Monastery), it's quirky and full of character and the service is outstanding. I always feel more like I'm staying in someone's home. The Intelligentsia cafe serves the best coffee in NYC and in summer the front courtyard converts to a fabulous outdoor european style cafe/bar. I love being in the heart of Chelsea. I will continue to stay at this hotel every time I visit NYC

title: Not quite a four dot, but better than a three dot
text:
We traveled with an infant to celebrate a friend's birthday in the hotel.  I enjoyed the stay--but they have some issues to work out.  It's such a cool building with friendly people, I bumped them up to a four.  I hope that they live up to it in the future.    
The reservation process was poor.  I had to call to book as part of the group rate, and it was difficult to get called back, get an email confirmation or get any reply.  I suspect online booking is easier.  To shorten the story, I was ready to award two dots to the hotel, at most.  But our welcome was incredibly friendly and a pack and play was ready and waiting in the room for us.  The amenities in the room were nice, except there was a great deal of booze and no coffee.
